name: work
trans: n. 工作； 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品vt. 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进vi. 工作；运作；起作用

sentences.english: There isn’t a lot of work at this time of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年这个时候工作机会都不多。

sentences.english: He’s been out of work (= without a job ) for two years.
sentences.chinese: 他失业有两年了。

sentences.english: More people are in work (= have a job ) than ten years ago.
sentences.chinese: 现在有工作的人比十年前多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作；[物] 功；产品；操作；职业；行为；事业；工厂；著作；文学、音乐或艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that you do regularly, especially in order to earn money

detailed_translations.chinese: 使工作；操作；经营；使缓慢前进
detailed_translations.english: to do the activities and duties that are part of your job

name: coworker
trans: n. 同事；合作者

name: workforce
trans: n. 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

sentences.english: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。

sentences.english: The company is cutting its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正在裁员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数
detailed_translations.english: all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area

name: workplace
trans: n. 工作场所；车间

sentences.english: ...the difficulties facing women in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: …妇女在工作场所中面临的困难。

detailed_translations.english: the room, building etc where you work

name: workout
trans: n. 锻炼；练习；试验

name: patchwork
trans: n. 拼缝物，拼缀物；混杂物

name: labor
trans: n. 劳动；工作；劳工；分娩vi. 劳动；努力；苦干vt. 详细分析；使厌烦

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: labour
trans: n. （英国）工党

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

name: laborer
trans: n. 劳动者；工人

sentences.english: Traditionally cut blue jeans carry a whiff of the laborer about them, so denim on a leader suggests a willingness to roll up the sleeves and dig in.
sentences.chinese: 传统剪裁的蓝色牛仔裤带有一种劳动者的气息，因此领导者穿着仔裤可以表达一种愿意卷起袖子大干一场的意思。

sentences.english: It is no use offering the manual laborer, tired out with a hard week’s sweat and effort, the chance of playing a game of football or baseball on Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 对于那些体力劳动者来说，一周辛苦的工作使他们精疾力竭，因此在周六下午给他们提供踢足球或者打棒球的机会是没有意义的。

sentences.english: Basically, in 2009, the life of a wage laborer has the same essential features in every corner of the globe.
sentences.chinese: 在2009年，工资劳动者的生活，其基本特征在全球的各个角落都是大致相同的。

name: labourer
trans: n. 劳动者；劳工

sentences.english: a farm labourer
sentences.chinese: 农场工人

detailed_translations.english: someone whose work needs physical strength, for example building work

name: career
trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速adj. 作为毕生职业的vi. 全速前进，猛冲

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

name: vocational
trans: adj. 职业的，行业的

sentences.english: vocational qualifications
sentences.chinese: 职业资格

detailed_translations.english: teaching or relating to the skills you need to do a particular job

name: strike
trans: n. 罢工；打击；殴打vi. 打，打击；罢工；敲，敲击；抓；打动；穿透vt. 打，击；罢工；撞击，冲击；侵袭；打动；到达

sentences.english: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
sentences.chinese: 政府承诺，如消防员罢工，就将调军队来协助。

detailed_translations.english: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc

name: state
trans: n. 国家；州；情形adj. 国家的；州的；正式的vt. 规定；声明；陈述

sentences.english: She was in an extremely confused state of mind .
sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.english: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
sentences.chinese: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

sentences.english: The country was in a state of war (= officially fighting a war ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个国家正处于战争状态。

sentences.english: Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
sentences.chinese: 水有三种形态: 液态、气态和固态。

sentences.english: ...reform of the state social-security system.
sentences.chinese: …国家社会保障体制的改革。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in
to formally say or write a piece of information or your opinion
State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies

name: statement
trans: n. 声明；陈述，叙述；报表，清单

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

name: restate
trans: vt. 重申；重新叙述；重讲

sentences.english: He is not changing the rules; he is simply restating the policy that was established last year.
sentences.chinese: 他没有改变规定，只是把去年定下来的政策重新表述了一下。

detailed_translations.english: to say something again in a different way, so that it is clearer or more strongly expressed

name: overstate
trans: vt. 夸张；夸大的叙述

sentences.english: To say that all motorists speed in residential areas is overstating the case.
sentences.chinese: 说所有驾驶员都在住宅区内超速行驶是言过其实了。

sentences.english: The importance of a child’s early years cannot be overstated (= is very important ).
sentences.chinese: 儿童幼年期的重要性怎么强调也不为过。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

name: estate
trans: n. 房地产；财产；身份

sentences.english: a country estate
sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

detailed_translations.chinese: 土地， 住宅区， 地产； 财产， 遗产； 庄园， 种植园
detailed_translations.english: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner

name: status
trans: n. 地位；状态；情形；重要身份

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: statute
trans: n.  法规；法令；条例

sentences.english: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute (= established by law ) .
sentences.chinese: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

detailed_translations.english: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

name: stake
trans: n. 桩，棍子；赌注；火刑；奖金vt. 资助，支持；系…于桩上；把…押下打赌vi. 打赌

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: administer
trans: vt. 管理；执行；给予vi. 给予帮助；执行遗产管理人的职责；担当管理人

sentences.english: The money will be administered by local charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将由当地慈善机构管理。

sentences.english: Our office administers the affairs of the Society.
sentences.chinese: 我们办公室管理协会的事务。

detailed_translations.english: to manage the work or money of a company or organization

name: administration
trans: n. 管理；行政；实施；行政机构

sentences.english: We’re looking for someone with experience in administration.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻找一个有管理经验的人。

sentences.english: The health service spends too much on administration.
sentences.chinese: 医疗服务部门在行政方面花费太多。

detailed_translations.english: the activities that are involved in managing the work of a company or organization

name: administrative
trans: adj. 管理的，行政的

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: change
trans: n. 变化；找回的零钱vt. 改变；交换vi. 改变；兑换

sentences.english: I find it hard to cope with change.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很难适应变化。

sentences.english: scientists worried about climatic change
sentences.chinese: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.english: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.english: No major changes were made to the book.
sentences.chinese: 这本书没有大的修改。

sentences.english: She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.chinese: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.english: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Matt emptied the loose change from his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 马特把口袋里所有的零钱都掏了出来。

detailed_translations.english: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

name: exchange
trans: n. 交换；交流；交易所；兑换vt. 交换；交易；兑换vi. 交换；交易；兑换

sentences.english: We exchange gifts at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 我们在圣诞节时交换礼物。

sentences.english: It’s a place where people can chat and exchange ideas.
sentences.chinese: 在这个地方人们可以聊天和交流想法。

sentences.english: Four of my cassettes for your Madonna CD is a fair exchange.
sentences.chinese: 我用四盒磁带换你的麦当娜激光唱片很公平。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something and receive the same kind of thing from them at the same time
the act of giving someone something and receiving something else from them

name: alter
trans: vt. 改变，更改vi. 改变；修改

sentences.english: Her face hadn’t altered much over the years.
sentences.chinese: 过了这么多年，她的容貌并没有多大改变。

sentences.english: The city centre has altered beyond recognition (=  changed very much  ) .
sentences.chinese: 市中心变得都认不出来了。

sentences.english: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 我们有责任帮助难民，这一事实无法改变。

detailed_translations.english: to change, or to make someone or something change

name: alternative
trans: n. 二中择一；供替代的选择adj. 供选择的；选择性的；交替的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: switch
trans: n. 开关；转换；鞭子vi. 转换；抽打；换防vt. 转换；用鞭子等抽打

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

name: use
trans: n. 使用；用途；发挥vt. 利用；耗费vi. 使用，运用

sentences.english: Can I use your phone?
sentences.chinese: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

sentences.english: I’ll show you which room you can use.
sentences.chinese: 我来跟你说一下你可以用哪个房间。

sentences.english: I always use the same shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 我一直用同一种洗发水。

sentences.english: Use your imagination when planning meals.
sentences.chinese: 安排三餐时要动点脑筋。

sentences.english: She booked the flight using a false name.
sentences.chinese: 她用化名预订了航班。

detailed_translations.english: if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用， 应用； 用途， 效用
detailed_translations.english: the action or fact of using something

name: used
trans: v. 用（use的过去式）；（used to）过去常做adj. 习惯的；二手的，使用过的

sentences.english: I do the dishes every day, so I’m used to it.
sentences.chinese: 我每天洗盘子，所以习惯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 习惯的；二手的，使用过的
用（use的过去式）；（used to）过去常做

name: useful
trans: adj. 有用的，有益的；有帮助的

sentences.english: useful information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息

sentences.english: A little Japanese can be really useful.
sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

sentences.english: Can you come and make yourself useful(= help people to do something )?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

name: useless
trans: adj. 无用的；无效的

sentences.english: The editor killed a few useless lines.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删掉了几行无用的文字。

sentences.english: Please cancel the words which are useless.
sentences.chinese: 请把无用的词划掉。

sentences.english: They wrote his suggestion off as a useless idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他的建议看做是无用的想法。

name: underused
trans: adj. 未充分利用的

name: misuse
trans: vt. 滥用；误用；虐待n. 滥用；误用；虐待

sentences.english: Even harmless drugs can be misused.
sentences.chinese: 即使是无毒副作用的药物也有使用不当的时候。

sentences.english: The term ‘schizophrenia’ is often misused.
sentences.chinese: “精神分裂症”这个术语经常被误用。

sentences.english: There is concern that the judges might misuse their power.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心裁判员可能会滥用权力。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for the wrong purpose, or in the wrong way, often with harmful results
the use of something in the wrong way or for the wrong purpose

name: social
trans: n. 联谊会；联欢会adj. 社会的，社交的；群居的

sentences.english: social issues, such as unemployment and education
sentences.chinese: 失业和教育之类的社会问题

sentences.english: the country’s serious social problems
sentences.chinese: 该国严重的社会问题

sentences.english: a challenge to the social order
sentences.chinese: 对社会秩序的一个挑战

detailed_translations.chinese: 社会的； 交际的， 社交的
detailed_translations.english: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives

name: sociable
trans: n. 联谊会adj. 社交的；好交际的；友善的

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

name: socialise
trans: vt. 使社会化；使社会主义化vi. 参加社交活动；发生社交往来（等于socialize）

sentences.english: Make time to socialise with friends – and also make time for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 抽时间进行社交——跟朋友聚聚，也是为自己抽出时间。

name: socialize
trans: vt. 使社会化；使社会主义化；使适应社会生活vi. 交际；参与社交

sentences.english: ...an open meeting, where members socialized and welcomed any new members.
sentences.chinese: …让会员们相互交流、欢迎所有新成员的一次公开集会。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time with other people in a friendly way

name: asocial
trans: adj. 自私的；不合群的；缺乏社交性的

name: sociologist
trans: n. 社会学家

sentences.english: The findings of this sociologist are very interesting because they illustrate once again the relationship that exists between what we do in the present and the results we obtain in the future.
sentences.chinese: 这个社会学家的发现是非常有趣的，因为他们在一次的说明我们现在做的和我们未来获得的结果有关系。

sentences.english: Not only is social class supposed not to exist in America, it is almost a dirty word—“America's forbidden thought”, in the words of one sociologist.
sentences.chinese: 美国不仅不应该存在社会阶级，而且那几乎是一个肮脏的词——用一位社会学家的话来说就是“美国所禁忌的思想”。

name: society
trans: n. 社会；交往；社团；社交界

sentences.english: technology and its effects on modern society
sentences.chinese: 科技及其对现代社会的影响

sentences.english: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
sentences.chinese: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

detailed_translations.english: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together

name: take
trans: vi. 拿；获得vt. 拿，取；采取；接受（礼物等）；买，花费；耗费（时间等）n. 捕获量；看法；利益，盈益；（入场券的）售得金额

sentences.english: Will you take the job?
sentences.chinese: 你接受这份工作吗？

sentences.english: Do you take American Express?
sentences.chinese: 你们接受美国运通信用卡吗？

sentences.english: If you take my advice , you’ll see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你听我的意见，就去看医生。

sentences.english: Our helpline take s 3.5 million calls (= telephone calls ) a year.
sentences.chinese: 我们的求助热线每年接听350万个电话。

sentences.english: Some doctors are unwilling to take new patients without a referral.
sentences.chinese: 有些医生不愿意接收没有转诊单的新病人。

sentences.english: Liz found his criticisms hard to take .
sentences.chinese: 利兹觉得他的批评很难接受。

sentences.english: I just can’t take any more (= can’t deal with a bad situation any longer ) .
sentences.chinese: 我再也受不了了。

sentences.english: Staff have agreed to take a 2% pay cut.
sentences.chinese: 员工同意接受2%的降薪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拿走； 接受， 接纳
detailed_translations.english: to accept or choose something that is offered, suggested, or given to you

name: intake
trans: n. 摄取量；通风口；引入口；引入的量

sentences.english: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.chinese: 你每天酒精摄入量不能超过两个单位。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

name: retake
trans: n. 重考；重新摄录；重新摄录的照片或录音vt. 再取；重拍；补考

name: takeaway
trans: n. 外卖食品；外卖餐馆adj. 外卖的；外吃的

sentences.english: Married couples spend more time eating together, sit in front of the TV more and often order takeaway ready meals while exercising less.
sentences.chinese: 调查发现，已婚夫妇一起吃饭、坐著看电视的时间增多，他们经常叫外卖，同时锻鍊次数减少。

detailed_translations.english: a meal that you buy at a shop or restaurant to eat at home

name: mistake
trans: n. 错误；误会；过失vt. 弄错；误解vi. 弄错；误解

sentences.english: The most common mistake is to plant them too deep.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的错误就是把它们种得太深了。

sentences.english: She mistook my meaning entirely.
sentences.chinese: 她完全误解了我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that has been done in the wrong way, or an opinion or statement that is incorrect
to understand something wrongly

name: blunder
trans: n. 大错vt. 做错vi. 跌跌撞撞地走；犯大错

sentences.english: They blundered badly when they gave him the job.
sentences.chinese: 他们犯了大错，让他做这份工作。

sentences.english: to make a terrible blunder
sentences.chinese: 犯大错

detailed_translations.english: to make a big mistake, especially because you have been careless or stupid
a careless or stupid mistake

name: company
trans: n. 公司；陪伴，同伴；连队vt. 陪伴vi. 交往

sentences.english: Which company do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.english: I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

detailed_translations.english: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

name: accompany
trans: vt. 陪伴，伴随；伴奏vi. 伴奏，伴唱

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: companion
trans: n. 同伴；朋友；指南；手册vt. 陪伴

sentences.english: For ten years he had been her constant companion .
sentences.chinese: 十年来他一直陪伴她左右。

sentences.english: His dog became his closest companion .
sentences.chinese: 他的狗成了他最亲密的伙伴。

sentences.english: a travelling companion
sentences.chinese: 旅伴

detailed_translations.english: someone you spend a lot of time with, especially a friend

name: accord
trans: n. 符合；一致；协议；自愿vt. 使一致；给予vi. 符合；一致

sentences.english: The punishments accorded with the current code of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 处罚与现行的纪律规则一致。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two people, ideas, or statements agree with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 使符合；使一致；调节；授予，赠与，给予
detailed_translations.english: to give someone or something special attention or a particular type of treatment

name: according
trans: prep. 根据；按照；据（…所说）；按（…所报道） 依照；根据…所说；依据

detailed_translations.chinese: 相等的， 一致的， 依…而定的

name: accordingly
trans: adv. 因此，于是；相应地；照著

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

name: own
trans: vt. 拥有；承认vi. 承认adj. 自己的；特有的n. 自己的

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: owner
trans: n.  所有者；物主

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

name: ownership
trans: n. 所有权；物主身份

sentences.english: The price of home ownership is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 房价在不断上涨。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of owning something

name: property
trans: n. 性质，性能；财产；所有权

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: owe
trans: vt. 欠；感激；应给予；应该把……归功于vi. 欠钱

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

name: mean
trans: adj. 平均的；卑鄙的；低劣的；吝啬的vt. 意味；想要；意欲n. 平均值vi. 用意

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.english: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

name: means
trans: n. 手段；方法；财产v. 意思是；打算（mean的第三人称单数）

sentences.english: The only means of communication was sign language.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的交流方法是手语。

sentences.english: The window was our only means of escape .
sentences.chinese: 跳窗是我们唯一的逃生方法。

sentences.english: Do you have any means of identification ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: art as a means of expression
sentences.chinese: 作为一种表达方式的艺术

sentences.english: Homework should not be used as a means of controlling children.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业不应该作为约束儿童的手段。

sentences.english: I had no means of telling him I would be late.
sentences.chinese: 我没有办法告诉他我会迟到。

sentences.english: Brian was prepared to use any means to get what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩准备不择手段地得到他想要的。

sentences.english: They had entered the country by unlawful means .
sentences.chinese: 他们通过非法途径进入了这个国家。

sentences.english: the means by which performance is assessed
sentences.chinese: 评估表现的手段

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing or achieving something

name: meaningful
trans: adj. 有意义的；意味深长的

sentences.english: Sam and Barbara exchanged meaningful glances.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆和芭芭拉交换了会意的眼神。

detailed_translations.english: a look that clearly expresses the way someone feels, even though nothing is said

name: intend
trans: vi. 有打算vt. 打算；想要；意指

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

name: intention
trans: n. 意图；目的；意向；愈合

sentences.english: They went into town with the intention of visiting the library.
sentences.chinese: 他们进了城，打算参观图书馆。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or desire to do something

name: intentionally
trans: adv. 故意地，有意地

sentences.english: Or you can choose to accelerate your growth and intentionally devour life and all it offers .
sentences.chinese: 或者你可以选择加速你的成长，有意地吞噬生活及生活所赐予你的一切。

sentences.english: But in the past, we almost never intentionally or successfully utilized such wealth of information in creating, and reusing our knowledge and developed capability.
sentences.chinese: 但是在过去，我们几乎从未有意或成功地利用这些丰富的信息创建、重用我们的知识和拓展我们的能力。

sentences.english: Before it was fired, it was perfectly round, but the artist intentionally roughed up the edges.
sentences.chinese: 在它被烧制出来前，它相当的圆润。 但艺术家有意地把它的边缘弄粗糙。

name: choose
trans: vt. 选择，决定vi. 选择，挑选

sentences.english: It took us ages to choose a new carpet.
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选新地毯花了很长时间。

sentences.english: A panel of judges will choose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 会由一个评判小组选出冠军。

sentences.english: He chose his words carefully as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时字斟句酌。

sentences.english: You can, if you choose, invest in the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以投资股票市场。

detailed_translations.english: to decide which one of a number of things or people you want

name: select
trans: n. 被挑选者；精萃adj. 精选的；挑选出来的；极好的vt. 挑选；选拔vi. 挑选

sentences.english: The party was small and select.
sentences.chinese: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.english: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.chinese: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
detailed_translations.english: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc

name: selection
trans: n. 选择，挑选；选集；精选品

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

name: selective
trans: adj. 选择性的，讲究的；有选择地，有选择性地；仔细挑选地

sentences.english: selective schools
sentences.chinese: 择优录取学生的学校

sentences.english: He has a very selective memory (= he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的记忆选择性很强。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

name: opt
trans: vi. 选择

sentences.english: Depending on your circumstances you can opt for one method or the other.
sentences.chinese: 根据自己的情况，你可以选择这种或那种方法。

detailed_translations.english: to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another

name: option
trans: n.  选项；选择权；买卖的特权

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

name: business
trans: n. 商业； 生意； 交易；事情

sentences.english: Students on the course learn about all aspects of business.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程的学生要学习商业活动的各个方面。

sentences.english: Carl began in the music business by running a recording studio.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔是从经营录音棚开始干音乐这一行的。

sentences.english: We do business with a number of Italian companies.
sentences.chinese: 我们和一些意大利公司做生意。

sentences.english: ...recording Ben as he goes about his business.
sentences.chinese: …摄录本做自己的事的样子。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of making money by producing or buying and selling goods, or providing services

name: businessman
trans: n. 商人

sentences.english: A businessman will grasp at any chance to make a profit.
sentences.chinese: 一个商人会抓住任何一个机会赚钱。

sentences.english: His parents are so rich that he can just play at being a businessman.
sentences.chinese: 他父母有的是钱，以致他可以敷衍了事地作个商人。

sentences.english: He is a businessman ... and that is what we need right now. Someone who can create jobs for our kids.
sentences.chinese: 他是个商人，也就是我们现在最需要的人，他是一个可以为我们的孩子创造就业机会的人。

detailed_translations.english: a man who works in business

name: commerce
trans: n. 贸易；商业；商务

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: commercial
trans: n. 商业广告adj. 商业的；营利的；靠广告收入的

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: enterprise
trans: n. 企业；事业；进取心；事业心

sentences.english: state/public enterprise (=one owned by the government)
sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 事业,企(事)业单位；事业心,进取心
detailed_translations.english: a company, organization, or business

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 企业家；承包人；主办者

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: trade
trans: n. 贸易，交易；行业；职业vt. 用…进行交换vi. 交易，买卖；以物易物

sentences.english: They had to travel into town to trade the produce from their farm.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不到镇上去出售他们农场的产品。

sentences.english: We traded necklaces.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换了项链。

detailed_translations.english: to buy and sell goods, services etc as your job or business

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: sale
trans: n. 销售；出售；拍卖；销售额；廉价出售

sentences.english: Harvey gets a $50 commission every time he makes a sale (= sells something as part of his job ) .
sentences.chinese: 哈维每做成一笔生意可得到50美元的佣金。

sentences.english: Car salesmen will often bring down the price rather than lose a sale (= fail to sell something ) .
sentences.chinese: 汽车推销员常常宁愿降价也不愿失去一笔生意。

sentences.english: arms sales to Iran
sentences.chinese: 对伊朗的军火销售

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；出售；拍卖；销售额；廉价出售
detailed_translations.english: when you sell something

name: wholesale
trans: n. 批发adj. 批发的；大规模的vt. 批发adv. 大规模地；以批发方式vi. 批发；经营批发业

sentences.english: wholesale prices
sentences.chinese: 批发价

sentences.english: The fabrics are sold wholesale to retailers, fashion houses, and other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 这些纺织品批发给零售商、时装店和其他厂家。

sentences.english: The fabrics are sold wholesale to retailers, fashion houses, and other manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 这些纺织品批发给零售商、时装店和其他厂家。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
the business of selling goods in large quantities at low prices to other businesses, rather than to the general public
If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores
If something is sold wholesale, it is sold in large quantities and at cheaper prices, usually to stores

name: commodity
trans: n. 商品，货物；日用品

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: bargain
trans: n. 交易；便宜货；契约v. 讨价还价；议价；(谈价钱后)卖

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: question
trans: n. 问题，疑问；询问；疑问句vt. 询问；怀疑；审问vi. 询问；怀疑；审问

sentences.english: Can I ask you a question?
sentences.chinese: 我能问你个问题吗？

sentences.english: I’m afraid I can’t answer that question.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕无法回答那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: a sentence, phrase or word that asks for information

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 ； 查询vi. 询问；表示怀疑vt. 询问；对……表示疑问

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: inquire
trans: vi. 询问；查究；询价vt. 询问；查究；问明

sentences.english: ‘Why are you doing that?’ the boy inquired.
sentences.chinese: “你为什么这么做？”男孩问道。

sentences.english: Toby would have liked to inquire further (= ask more questions ).
sentences.chinese: 托比本想问更多的问题。

sentences.english: The investigation will inquire into the company’s financial dealings.
sentences.chinese: 此次调查将会涉及公司的财务往来。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for information

name: enquire
trans: vi. 询问；调查；问候（等于inquire）vt. 询问；打听

sentences.english: I am writing to confirm /enquire/inform you…
sentences.chinese: 我写信是要确认/询问/通知你…

sentences.english: I recently e-mailed one website to enquire why my goods had not yet arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我最近给一个网站发邮件去询问为什么我订购的商品还没有到达。

sentences.english: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
sentences.chinese: 你们无论进那一城，那一村，要打听那里谁是好人，就住在他家，直住到走的时候。

name: inquiry
trans: n. 探究；调查；质询

sentences.english: I don’t know who sent the gift, but I’ll make some inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道礼物是谁送的，但我会打听一下。

sentences.english: The police have launched a murder inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 警方已开始对谋杀案展开调查

detailed_translations.english: a question you ask in order to get information

name: enquiry
trans: n.  询问， 询盘

sentences.english: We are pleased to receive your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 我们很高兴收到您的询问函。

sentences.english: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
sentences.chinese: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

sentences.english: When fresh supplies come into the market, we can revert to your enquiry.
sentences.chinese: 等新货上市时，我们才能回头考虑你们的询盘。

name: issue
trans: n. 问题；流出；期号；发行物vt. 发行，发布；发给；放出，排出vi. 发行；流出；造成…结果；传下

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

name: matter
trans: n. 物质；事件vi. 有关系；要紧

sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

name: affair
trans: n. 事情；事务；私事；（尤指关系不长久的）风流韵事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: mark
trans: n. 标志；马克；符号；痕迹；分数vi. 作记号vt. .标志；做标记于；打分数n. . 标志；做标记于；打分数

sentences.english: The kitten is mainly white with black marks on her back.
sentences.chinese: 小猫身体基本为白色，背上有黑色斑点。

sentences.english: Make a mark at the bottom of the page.
sentences.chinese: 在页末做个记号。

sentences.english: A simple wooden cross marked her grave.
sentences.chinese: 一个简单的木十字架标出了她坟墓的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of darker or lighter colour on a plain surface such as a person’s skin or an animal’s fur
to show where something is

name: marked
trans: adj. 显著的；有记号的v. 表示（mark的过去分词）；作记号；打分数

sentences.english: a marked lack of enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 明显缺乏热情

sentences.english: The patient showed a marked improvement in her condition after changing medication.
sentences.chinese: 换药治疗后病人的病情明显好转。

sentences.english: Miller’s organized desk stood in marked contrast to the rest of the office.
sentences.chinese: 米勒的桌子上整理得井井有条，和办公室里的其他桌子形成明显的对比。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示（mark的过去分词）；作记号；打分数

name: markedly
trans: adv. 明显地；显著地；引人注目地

sentences.english: The relations between our two countries have improved markedly in every aspect.
sentences.chinese: 我们两国的关系在各方面都有了显著的发展。

sentences.english: Bankers say that they have got tougher but they have still tightened lending standards less markedly than their counterparts in the euro area as a whole.
sentences.chinese: 银行业主说他们已经紧缩了信用，但是整体上他们对借贷标准的收紧并没有像欧洲其他地区的同行那样明显。

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: section
trans: n. 截面；部分；部门；地区；章节vt. 把…分段；将…切片；对…进行划分vi. 被切割成片；被分成部分

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: sector
trans: n. 部门；扇形，扇区；象限仪；函数尺vt. 把…分成扇形

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

name: segment
trans: n. 段；部分vt. 分割vi. 分割

sentences.english: Decorate with orange segments.
sentences.chinese: 用几瓣橙子作点缀。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

name: human
trans: n. 人；人类adj. 人的；人类的

sentences.english: There are many different cell types in the human body .
sentences.chinese: 人体中有许多种不同的细胞类型。

sentences.english: the power of the human mind
sentences.chinese: 人脑的威力

sentences.english: The desire for joy lies deep within the human spirit .
sentences.chinese: 对快乐的渴求藏在人类心灵深处。

sentences.english: Infra-red light is invisible to the human eye.
sentences.chinese: 红外线是人眼看不见的。

sentences.english: theories of human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 关于人类行为的理论

sentences.english: different areas of human experience
sentences.chinese: 人类各方面的经验

sentences.english: respect for the absolute value of human life
sentences.chinese: 对人类生命绝对价值的尊重

sentences.english: The accident was the result of human error.
sentences.chinese: 事故是由于人为过失造成的。

sentences.english: The meat was declared unfit for human consumption.
sentences.chinese: 这种肉被宣布不适合人类食用。

sentences.english: Like humans, cats and dogs are omnivores.
sentences.chinese: 和人类一样，猫和狗是杂食性动物。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to people, especially as opposed to machines or animals
a person

name: non-human
trans: adj. 非人类的；非人工的

name: humanity
trans: n. 人类；人道；仁慈；人文学科

sentences.english: We want a clean healthy environment for all humanity .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望全人类拥有一个干净健康的生存环境。

sentences.english: crimes against humanity
sentences.chinese: 反人类罪

sentences.english: We must never forget our common humanity.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远不要忘记共同的人性。

detailed_translations.english: people in general

name: humanistic
trans: adj. 人文主义的；人道主义的

sentences.english: Religious values can often differ greatly from humanistic morals.
sentences.chinese: 宗教价值观常常和人文主义道德观相去甚远。

detailed_translations.english: A humanistic idea, condition, or practice relates to humanism

name: anthropologist
trans: n. 人类学家；人类学者

sentences.english: This is something I learned as an anthropologist –people love to tell their stories.
sentences.chinese: 这是我作为一名人类学家所理解的----人们喜欢讲述自己的故事。

sentences.english: Fisher, a biological anthropologist, says she wrote her latest book because she wanted to uncover the science behind “why you love who you love and perhaps even help people find the one”.
sentences.chinese: 费舍尔，生物人类学家，说她的最新著作的出发点是缘于她想揭开“为什么你会爱上你的爱人，这也许会帮助人们找到爱人”背后的科学依据。

sentences.english: A data manager, media coordinator, and medical anthropologist will also be arriving over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 一名数据管理员、媒体协调员和医学人类学家也将于周末抵达。

name: anthropology
trans: n. 人类学人类学家

sentences.english: "In anthropology, you can't equate third gender with homosexuality," he said.
sentences.chinese: “在人类学中，你不能将同性恋和第三性别混同，”他说。

sentences.english: When I was a student at Cambridge I remember an anthropology professor holding up a picture of a bone with 28 incisions carved in it.
sentences.chinese: 当我还在剑桥读书的时候，我记得有一位人类学的教授拿出一张照片，上面是一根有28个切口的骨头。

sentences.english: Not to be the skunk at this party, but I think it's important to ask whether neuroscience reveals anything more than we already know from, say, anthropology.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想成为派对上的讨厌鬼，但我认为很重要的是，要问清楚神经科学是否揭示出我们已知之外的东西，比如人类学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of people, their societies,  culture s  etc

name: archeologist
trans: n. 考古学家

name: archaeologist
trans: n. 考古学家

sentences.english: In fact, she was an archaeologist.
sentences.chinese: 其实她是一个考古学家。

sentences.english: But I do not believe, as a field archaeologist, that we can use the scientific method to prove or disprove [them].
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个在现场工作的考古学家，我不相信我们能用科学手段对它们进行证实或证伪”。

name: archeological
trans: adj. 考古学的

name: archaeological
trans: adj.  考古学的； 考古学上的

sentences.english: Just who made the tools is unclear from the archaeological evidence alone, though our relative Homo erectus is identified as the likely creator of at least the Acheulian tools.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经确定我们的近亲直立人至少是阿舍利工具可能的创造者，但仅凭考古学证据还无法确定是谁制造了这些工具。

sentences.english: So there are two other models, then, models different from the immigration model, two other models for understanding the formation of Israel, that build on this archaeological evidence.
sentences.chinese: 那么还有两个其他的模型，与移民模型不同的两个模型，这两个模型也是为了说明以色列的形成，它们是依据考古学证据。

sentences.english: The work fills (in) a gap which has hitherto existed in our archaeological literature.
sentences.chinese: 这部著作填补了我国考古学文献中的一个空白。

name: demographic
trans: adj. 人口统计学的；人口学的

sentences.english: In the same demographic breakdown of people may have different characteristics of the consumer mentality.
sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.english: It is generally studied and mapped by an organization through lists and reportscontaining demographic information that may have an effect on the marketing of keyproducts or services.
sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

name: public
trans: n. 公众；社会；公共场所adj. 公众的；政府的；公用的；公立的

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: publication
trans: n. 出版；出版物；发表

sentences.english: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这本指南正被翻译成好几种语言，准备在圣诞节前后出版。

sentences.english: a delay in the publication of the exam results
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩的延期公布

detailed_translations.english: the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published

name: publish
trans: vi. 出版；发行；刊印vt. 出版；发表；公布

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: publisher
trans: n. 出版者，出版商；发行人

sentences.english: The publishers planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.
sentences.chinese: 出版社计划将这份杂志做成周刊。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers etc

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查vt. 研究；调查vi. 研究；调查

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: researcher
trans: n. 研究员

sentences.english: The Cloud Mouse is a project of Microsoft researcher Richard Harper and his collaborators at Microsoft Research Asia.
sentences.chinese: 云鼠标是微软研究员理查德哈珀和他的合作者在微软亚洲研究院的一个项目 。

sentences.english: Let me just conclude this post by saying, our passion for search is stronger than ever - and as a search researcher, I have the best job in the world :-).
sentences.chinese: 在这篇帖子结束的时候我想说，我们对搜索的热情比任何时候都强烈-作为一个搜索研究员，我有世界上最好的工作:)。

name: survey
trans: n. 调查；测量；审视；纵览vt. 调查；勘测；俯瞰vi. 测量土地

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: investigation
trans: n. 调查；调查研究

sentences.english: The investigation continued for nearly three years.
sentences.chinese: 调查持续了近三年。

sentences.english: a criminal investigation
sentences.chinese: 刑事调查

sentences.english: A private detective was hired to conduct the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 雇了一名私人侦探进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: an official attempt to find out the truth about or the cause of something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: government
trans: n. 政府；政体；管辖

sentences.english: The Government are planning further cuts in public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府正计划进一步削减公共支出。

sentences.english: The US government has tightened restrictions on firearms.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府已经加强了对枪支的管制。

sentences.english: Neither party had the majority necessary to form a government.
sentences.chinese: 两个政党都没有获得组阁所必需的多数票。

sentences.english: strong government
sentences.chinese: 强有力的统治

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who govern a country or state

name: governmental
trans: adj. 政府的；政治的；统治上的

sentences.english: an attempt to restrict governmental power
sentences.chinese: 限制政府权力的尝试

detailed_translations.english: of a government, or relating to government

name: govern
trans: vt. 管理；支配；统治；控制vi. 居支配地位；进行统治

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.english: The party had been governing for seven months.
sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

sentences.english: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

detailed_translations.english: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

name: governance
trans: n. 管理；统治；支配

sentences.english: ...he will meet with officials from several countries to discuss ways to promote good governance.
sentences.chinese: ...他将与诸国官员会面，讨论如何促进对国家的良性管理。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of governing

name: governor
trans: n. 主管人员；统治者，管理者； 调节器；地方长官

sentences.english: He was governor of Iowa in the late 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 他是20世纪70年代末爱荷华州的州长。

sentences.english: the prison governor
sentences.chinese: 监狱长

detailed_translations.english: the person in charge of governing a state in the US

name: increase
trans: n. 增加，增长；提高vt. 增加，加大vi. 增加，增大；繁殖

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: increasingly
trans: adv. 越来越多地；渐增地

sentences.english: Marketing techniques are becoming increasingly sophisticated.
sentences.chinese: 市场营销技巧越来越巧妙。

sentences.english: Increasingly, young people distrust all forms of government.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人越来越不相信任何形式的政府。

detailed_translations.english: more and more all the time

name: decrease
trans: n. 减少，减小；减少量vt. 减少，减小vi. 减少，减小

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

name: soar
trans: n. 高飞；高涨vi. 高飞；高耸；往上飞舞

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: spike
trans: n. 长钉，道钉；钉鞋；细高跟vt. 阻止；以大钉钉牢；用尖物刺穿

sentences.english: a clumsy attempt to spike rumours of a cabinet split

sentences.chinese: 他是一位有声望的科学家。

sentences.chinese: 作为一名科学家，他不信耶稣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

name: distinction
trans: n. 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

sentences.english: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.chinese: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

detailed_translations.english: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

name: distinctive
trans: adj. 有特色的，与众不同的

sentences.english: a rock band with a distinctive sound
sentences.chinese: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

detailed_translations.english: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize

name: distinctiveness
trans: n. 特殊性；区别性；辨别性

name: distinctly
trans: adv. 明显地；无疑地，确实地

sentences.english: Speak clearly and distinctly.
sentences.chinese: 说话要清楚明白。

sentences.english: He distinctly remembered the day his father left.
sentences.chinese: 他清晰地记得父亲离开的那一天。

detailed_translations.english: clearly

name: distinguish
trans: vi. 区别，区分；辨别vt. 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

sentences.english: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
sentences.chinese: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

sentences.english: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
sentences.chinese: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

detailed_translations.english: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

name: power
trans: n. 力量，能力；电力，功率；政权，势力； 幂adj. 借影响有权势人物以操纵权力的vt. 激励；供以动力；使…有力量vi. 快速前进

sentences.english: It is not within my power (= I am unable or not in a position) to help you.
sentences.chinese: 我是爱莫能助啊。

sentences.english: The ship was helpless against the power of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船只能任凭强大的暴风雨肆虐。

sentences.english: The Secretary of State has the power to approve the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 国务卿有权批准这些提议。

sentences.english: 4 to the power of 3 is 4^3 (= 4 × 4 × 4 = 64).
sentences.chinese: 4的3次方是4^3。

detailed_translations.english: the ability or right to control people or events

name: powerful
trans: adj. 强大的；强有力的adv. 很；非常

sentences.english: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
sentences.chinese: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。

sentences.english: a very influential and powerful family
sentences.chinese: 很有权势的家庭

sentences.english: a powerful speech
sentences.chinese: 有感染力的演讲

detailed_translations.english: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions

name: strength
trans: n. 力量；力气；兵力；长处

sentences.english: The police force is below strength at the moment (= there are fewer police than there should be ).
sentences.chinese: 目前警力不足。

sentences.english: the strength of a rope
sentences.chinese: 绳子的强度

detailed_translations.english: the number of people in a team, army etc

name: strengthen
trans: vt. 加强；巩固vi. 变强；变坚挺

sentences.english: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
sentences.chinese: 我们的友谊逐年加深。

sentences.english: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

sentences.english: The company plans to strengthen its hand (= make itself more powerful ) in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处，以此增强在欧洲的实力。

detailed_translations.english: to become stronger or make something stronger

name: energy
trans: n.  能量；精力；活力；精神

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: energetic
trans: adj. 精力充沛的；积极的；有力的

sentences.english: an energetic man
sentences.chinese: 精力旺盛的男子

sentences.english: an energetic drive to get more customers
sentences.chinese: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

detailed_translations.english: having or needing a lot of energy or determination

name: dynamics
trans: n. 动力学，力学

sentences.english: And our goal is to find out the time, the dynamics of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目的是找出时间，找出这个问题的动力学。

sentences.english: We know the dynamics of outsourcing.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解外包的动力。

sentences.english: Both are believed to have important roles in sea ice dynamics, but how important they are remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 认为这两者在海冰动力学方面都有重要的作用，但是他们尚不清楚是多么重要。

detailed_translations.english: the branch of mechanics concerned with the forces that change or produce the motions of bodies

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培vt.  培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: cultural
trans: adj. 文化的；教养的

sentences.english: the very real historical and cultural differences between our two societies
sentences.chinese: 我们两个社会之间非常现实的历史和文化差异

sentences.english: the desire to maintain a distinct cultural identity
sentences.chinese: 保持独特的文化特征的愿望

sentences.english: It is important to look at the political and cultural context in which the novel was written.
sentences.chinese: 要考虑小说创作时的政治和文化背景，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: people who share the same cultural background
sentences.chinese: 有着相同文化背景的人

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to a particular society and its way of life

name: cultivate
trans: vt. 培养；陶冶；耕作

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: civilisation
trans: n. （英）文明（等于civilization）

sentences.english: Perhaps intelligence and civilisation are not what we should be concentrating on.
sentences.chinese: 也许智能和文明不属于我们应该关注的问题。

sentences.english: If I have understood you correctly, you are proposing to do nothing to prevent the likely collapse of industrial civilisation.
sentences.chinese: 如果我对你的理解正确的话，你在主张不做任何事情去防止可能的工业文明的崩溃。

sentences.english: Let us examine our history and see how men - the master race for all of our recorded history in almost every corner of every human civilisation - have fared so far.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，让我们检查一下我们的历史，并且看看男性——在我们所有现存历史，几乎每一个人类文明的角落都是统治者的族群，是如何发展的。

name: civilization
trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.english: modern American civilization
sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: civilised
trans: adj. 文明的

name: civilized
trans: adj. 文明的；有礼貌的v. 教化；使…文明；启发（civilize的过去分词）

sentences.english: Such things should not happen in a civilized society.
sentences.chinese: 文明社会不应该有这种事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: a civilized society is well organized and developed, and has fair laws and customs

name: civility
trans: n. 礼貌；礼仪；端庄

sentences.english: Please have the civility to knock before you enter next time.
sentences.chinese: 下次你进来之前要有点礼貌——先敲门。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour which most people consider normal

name: civilian
trans: n. 平民，百姓adj. 民用的；百姓的，平民的

sentences.english: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.english: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.chinese: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

detailed_translations.english: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military

name: result
trans: n. 结果；成绩；答案；比赛结果vi. 结果；导致；产生

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；重要性；推论

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: consequently
trans: adv. 因此；结果；所以

sentences.english: Most computer users have never received any formal keyboard training. Consequently, their keyboard skills are inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的电脑使用者都没有经过正规的键盘操作训练，因此他们的键盘技巧不够熟练。

sentences.english: The molecules are absorbed into the bloodstream and consequently affect the organs.
sentences.chinese: 这些分子被吸收到血液里，从而影响到器官。

detailed_translations.english: as a result

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果，结局；成果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: aftermath
trans: n. 后果；余波

sentences.english: In the aftermath of the coup, the troops opened fire on the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 在那次政变的余波之中，军队向示威者开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time after something such as a war, storm, or accident when people are still dealing with the results

name: fallout
trans: n. 原子尘； 放射性尘埃；原子尘微粒回降；附带结果

sentences.english: The political fallout of the affair cost him his job.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件的政治影响使他丢了工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射微尘, 原子尘, 附带结果
detailed_translations.english: the results of a particular event, especially when they are unexpected

name: court
trans: n. 法院；球场；朝廷；奉承vt. 招致（失败、危险等）；向…献殷勤；设法获得vi. 求爱

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: courtship
trans: n. 求爱；求婚；求爱期

sentences.english: courtship rituals
sentences.chinese: 求偶仪式

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during which a man and woman have a romantic relationship before marrying

name: defense
trans: n. 防卫，防护；防御措施；防守vt. 谋划抵御

sentences.english: Of course, we'll consult closely with our allies every step of the way, because the security and defense of our allies, both in Europe and Asia, is not negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们将在前行道路上就每一步骤与我们的盟国密切磋商，因为我们欧洲和亚洲盟国的安全与防卫是不容讨价还价的。

name: defence
trans: n. 防御；防卫；答辩；防卫设备

sentences.english: soldiers who died in defence of their country
sentences.chinese: 为保卫祖国而献身的战士

sentences.english: The harbour's sea defences are in poor condition.
sentences.chinese: 港口的海防工事状况很差。

sentences.english: He wanted to conduct his own defence.
sentences.chinese: 他想自己为自己辩护。

detailed_translations.english: the act of protecting sb/sth from attack, criticism, etc.

name: defendant
trans: n. 被告adj. 辩护的；为自己辩护的

sentences.english: We find the defendant not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 我们裁定被告无罪。

detailed_translations.english: the person in a court of law who has been  accused  of doing something illegal

name: prosecute
trans: vt. 检举；贯彻；从事；依法进行vi. 起诉；告发；作检察官

sentences.english: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
sentences.chinese: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

detailed_translations.english: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law

name: prosecution
trans: n. 起诉，检举；进行；经营

sentences.english: a criminal prosecution
sentences.chinese: 刑事诉讼

sentences.english: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
sentences.chinese: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

detailed_translations.english: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

name: prosecutor
trans: n. 检察官；公诉人； 起诉人；实行者

sentences.english: I was the first to go before the prosecutor.
sentences.chinese: 我是第一个被带到检察官面前的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 检察官； 起诉人， 原告
detailed_translations.english: In some countries, a prosecutor is a lawyer or official who brings charges against someone or tries to prove in a trial that they are guilty

name: judge
trans: vt. 判断；审判n. 法官；裁判员vi. 审判；判决

sentences.english: You should never judge a person by their looks.
sentences.chinese: 决不要以貌取人。

sentences.english: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。

sentences.english: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
sentences.chinese: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。

sentences.english: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
sentences.chinese: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物

sentences.english: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。

sentences.english: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
sentences.chinese: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。

sentences.english: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
sentences.chinese: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。

sentences.english: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
sentences.chinese: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。

sentences.english: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为，从他所做的这一切客观地来评价，是不诚实的。

sentences.english: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特想过去帮他，但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。

sentences.english: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
sentences.chinese: 对她的评价不要太苛刻，毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

detailed_translations.english: to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

name: judgment
trans: n. 判断；裁判；判决书；辨别力

sentences.english: I’ve known him for years and I trust his judgment.
sentences.chinese: 我与他相识多年，相信他的判断力。

sentences.english: a decision based on sound judgment
sentences.chinese: 以良好的判断力为基础的决定

sentences.english: Watch carefully and use your judgment.
sentences.chinese: 仔细观察并运用自己的判断力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 判断；裁判；判决书；辨别力
detailed_translations.english: the ability to make sensible decisions about what to do and when to do it

name: judgement
trans: n. 意见；判断力； 审判；评价

sentences.english: He trusted in his judgement.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他的判断。

sentences.english: All action is based on judgement.
sentences.chinese: 一切行动均以判断为基础。

sentences.english: The judgement is often biased by interest.
sentences.chinese: 判断往往因利害关系而有偏差。

name: trial
trans: n. 试验；审讯；努力；磨炼adj. 试验的；审讯的

sentences.english: The trial is due to start next week.
sentences.chinese: 审理定于下周开始。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

name: appeal
trans: n. 呼吁，请求；吸引力，感染力；上诉；诉诸裁判vt. 将…上诉，对…上诉vi. 呼吁，恳求；上诉；诉诸，求助；有吸引力，迎合爱好；（体育比赛中）诉诸裁判

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

name: plead
trans: vt. 借口；为...辩护；托称vi. 恳求；辩护

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: market
trans: n. 市场；行情；股票市场；市面；集市；销路；商店vt. 在市场上出售vi. 做买卖

sentences.english: I usually buy all my vegetables at the market.
sentences.chinese: 我通常都是在菜市场里购买蔬菜。

sentences.english: Our main overseas market is Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主要海外市场是日本。

detailed_translations.english: a time when people buy and sell goods, food etc, or the place, usually outside or in a large building, where this happens

name: marketer
trans: n.  市场商人；市场营销人员

name: marketing
trans: n. 行销，销售v. 出售；在市场上进行交易；使…上市（market的ing形式）

sentences.english: a clever marketing ploy
sentences.chinese: 聪明的营销策略

sentences.english: Company sales improved dramatically following a $2 million marketing campaign.
sentences.chinese: 公司投入两百万美元搞了一个营销活动之后，销售额显著提高。

sentences.english: a career in sales and marketing
sentences.chinese: 市场营销工作

sentences.english: Cushman is director of marketing for a chain of Italian restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 库什曼是一家意大利连锁饭店的营销经理。

sentences.english: the UK marketing manager
sentences.chinese: 英国营销经理

detailed_translations.english: the activity of deciding how to advertise a product, what price to charge for it etc, or the type of job in which you do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 出售；在市场上进行交易；使…上市（market的ing形式）

name: budget

sentences.english: Let me explain my reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 让我解释我的推论。

sentences.english: Your reasoning is comprehensive but I do not agree with you.
sentences.chinese: 你的推理是可以理解的，但我不同意你的观点。

sentences.english: But auctions require "if he thinks that she thinks that I think that he thinks" chains of reasoning that tend to have weak links.
sentences.chinese: 不过，拍卖要求有“如果他认为她认为我认为他那么认为”的推理链条，而这种链条往往存在薄弱环节。

detailed_translations.english: a process of thinking carefully about something in order to make a judgment

name: reasonable
trans: adj. 合理的，公道的；通情达理的

sentences.english: a reasonable request
sentences.chinese: 合情合理的要求

sentences.english: Be reasonable — you can’t expect her to do all the work on her own!
sentences.chinese: 要讲道理，你不能指望她一个人干所有的工作！

sentences.english: I thought it was a perfectly reasonable (= completely reasonable ) question.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这个问题问得很有道理。

sentences.english: He had reasonable grounds (= good reasons but no proof ) for believing the law had been broken.
sentences.chinese: 他有合理的根据认为有人违法了。

sentences.english: good food at a reasonable price
sentences.chinese: 价格公道的美食

detailed_translations.english: fair and sensible

name: unreasonable
trans: adj. 不合理的；过度的；不切实际的；非理智的

sentences.english: I think he’s being unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他是在无理取闹。

detailed_translations.english: not fair or sensible

name: rational
trans: n. 有理数adj. 合理的；理性的

sentences.english: Parents need to be fully informed so they can make a rational decision.
sentences.chinese: 父母需要充分了解情况，这样才可以作出合理的决定。

sentences.english: I’m sure there’s a rational explanation for all this.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这一切都有合理的解释。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to have a rational conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 不可能和他进行理性的谈话。

detailed_translations.english: based on reason rather than emotions

name: rationalist
trans: n. 理性主义者，唯理主义者

name: logic
trans: n. 逻辑；逻辑学；逻辑性adj. 逻辑的

sentences.english: There is a certain logic in their choice of architect.
sentences.chinese: 他们对建筑师的选择是有一定道理的。

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

name: logical
trans: adj. 合逻辑的，合理的；逻辑学的

sentences.english: It’s a logical site for a new supermarket, with the housing development nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近有住宅区，新的超级市场选址在此是合情合理的。

sentences.english: a logical conclusion
sentences.chinese: 合理的结论

detailed_translations.chinese: 逻辑的， 合乎常理的
detailed_translations.english: seeming reasonable and sensible

name: coherent
trans: adj. 连贯的，一致的；明了的；清晰的；凝聚性的；互相耦合的；粘在一起的

sentences.english: The three years of the course are planned as a coherent whole.
sentences.chinese: 这三年的课程是作为连贯的整体来安排的。

sentences.english: a coherent account of the incident
sentences.chinese: 对该事件条理分明的陈述

sentences.english: He's so calm when he answers questions in interviews. I wish I could be that coherent.
sentences.chinese: 他如此镇定地回答了访谈中的问题。我希望我也能那样有条不紊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
detailed_translations.english: if a piece of writing, set of ideas etc is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

name: likely
trans: adj. 很可能的；合适的；有希望的adv. 很可能；或许

sentences.english: Snow showers are likely tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天可能有阵雪。

sentences.english: the most likely cause of the problem
sentences.chinese: 造成这个问题最有可能的原因

sentences.english: It is more than likely (= almost certain ) the votes will have to be counted again.
sentences.chinese: 选票很有可能要重新点算。

sentences.english: It could have been an accident, but that was hardly likely (= not very likely ).
sentences.chinese: 这有可能是意外事故，但可能性不大。

sentences.english: I’d very likely have done the same thing in your situation.
sentences.chinese: 我要是处在你这种情况，也很有可能会那样做的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true
probably

name: unlikely
trans: adj. 不太可能的；没希望的adv. 未必

sentences.english: Donna might be able to come tomorrow, but it’s very unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜明天也许能来，不过这可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: not likely to happen

name: possible
trans: n. 可能性；合适的人；可能的事物adj. 可能的；合理的；合适的

sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

name: impossible
trans: n. 不可能；不可能的事adj. 不可能的；不可能存在的；难以忍受的；不真实的

sentences.english: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
sentences.chinese: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”

sentences.english: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
sentences.chinese: 这些事情不可能准确无误 。

sentences.english: The noise made sleep impossible.
sentences.chinese: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。

sentences.english: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
sentences.chinese: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。

sentences.english: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
sentences.chinese: 现在找工作很难，对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。

sentences.english: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
sentences.chinese: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。

sentences.english: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
sentences.chinese: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。
