sentences.english: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
sentences.chinese: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。

sentences.english: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
sentences.chinese: 即使有可能，要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

name: possibly
trans: adv. 可能地；也许；大概

sentences.english: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
sentences.chinese: 这最后一项任务也许是最难的。

sentences.english: It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
sentences.chinese: 要花三个星期，也许更久。

sentences.english: ‘Will you be here tomorrow?’ ‘Possibly.’
sentences.chinese: “你明天到这儿来吗？”“也许吧。”

sentences.english: ‘Was it murder?’ ‘ Quite possibly (= it is very likely ) .’
sentences.chinese: “是谋杀吗？”“很可能是。”

detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain

name: possibility
trans: n. 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: probably
trans: adv. 大概；或许；很可能

sentences.english: It'll probably be OK.
sentences.chinese: 这大概没有问题。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that sth is likely to happen or to be true

name: probability
trans: n. 可能性；机率； 或然率

sentences.english: You must decide whether, on the balance of probabilities , he committed the crime.
sentences.chinese: 你们一定要权衡正反两方面的可能性，然后再裁定他是否犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

name: perhaps
trans: n. 假定；猜想；未定之事adv. 或许；（表示不确定）也许；（用于粗略的估计）或许；（表示勉强同意或其实不赞成）也许；可能

sentences.english: Perhaps she’s next door.
sentences.chinese: 她也许在隔壁。

sentences.english: Perhaps it will snow tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天可能会下雪。

sentences.english: It won’t take so long next time, perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 也许下次不用那么久。

sentences.english: ‘I don’t think you understand.’ ‘Well, perhaps not .’
sentences.chinese: “我想你不明白。”“嗯，也许吧。”

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something may be true, but you are not sure

name: potential
trans: n. 潜能；可能性； 电势adj. 潜在的；可能的；势的

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: potentially
trans: adv. 可能地，潜在地

sentences.english: a potentially dangerous situation
sentences.chinese: 有潜在危险的局势

detailed_translations.english: something that is potentially dangerous, useful etc is not dangerous etc now, but may become so in the future

name: information
trans: n. 信息，资料；知识；情报；通知

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

name: inform
trans: vi. 告发；告密vt. 通知；告诉；报告

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: require
trans: vt. 需要；要求；命令

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: requirement
trans: n. 要求；必要条件；必需品

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: acquire
trans: vt. 获得；取得；学到；捕获

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: acquisition
trans: n. 获得物，获得；收购

sentences.english: the acquisition of language
sentences.chinese: 语言的习得

detailed_translations.english: the process by which you gain knowledge or learn a skill

name: create
trans: vt. 创造，创作；造成

sentences.english: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为宇宙是通过一次大爆炸创造出来的。

sentences.english: Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为引起了很多问题。

sentences.english: The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这家新工厂预计能创造400多个新的就业机会。

sentences.english: The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
sentences.chinese: 那通告反而引起了混乱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something exist that did not exist before

name: creation
trans: n. 创造，创作；创作物，产物

sentences.english: a job creation scheme
sentences.chinese: 创造就业机会的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创建； 创造的作品， 产物； 宇宙， 天地万物
detailed_translations.english: the act of creating something

name: creative
trans: adj. 创造性的

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

name: creativity
trans: n. 创造力；创造性

sentences.english: artistic creativity
sentences.chinese: 艺术创造力

sentences.english: Teachers have been attacked for stifling creativity in their pupils.
sentences.chinese: 教师被批评压抑了学生的创造力。

sentences.english: Editors complain about the lack of creativity in the ideas put to them.
sentences.chinese: 编辑们抱怨说交给他们的选题缺乏创意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to use your imagination to produce new ideas, make things etc

name: invent
trans: vt. 发明；创造；虚构

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: invention
trans: n. 发明；发明物；虚构；发明才能

sentences.english: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话
detailed_translations.english: the act of inventing something

name: reinvent
trans: vt. 重新使用；彻底改造；重复发明（在不知他人已发明的情况下）

name: lead
trans: n. 领导；铅；导线；榜样vt. 领导；致使；引导；指挥vi. 领导；导致；用水砣测深adj. 带头的；最重要的

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: leader
trans: n. 领导者；首领；指挥者

sentences.english: the largest ever gathering of world leaders
sentences.chinese: 全世界领导人史无前例的大聚会

detailed_translations.english: the person who directs or controls a group, organization, country etc

name: leadership
trans: n. 领导能力；领导阶层

sentences.english: The US must now take a firm leadership role.
sentences.chinese: 美国现在必须扮演一个强有力的领导人角色。

sentences.english: the Conservative leadership contest
sentences.chinese: 保守党的领导人角逐

sentences.english: The next leadership election is due in November.
sentences.chinese: 下一届领导人选举将在十一月举行。

detailed_translations.english: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

name: misleading
trans: adj. 令人误解的；引入歧途的v. 给…带错路；把…引入歧途（mislead的ing形式）

sentences.english: The article was misleading, and the newspaper has apologized.
sentences.chinese: 那篇文章具有误导性，那家报纸已致歉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人误解的， 导致错误结论的； 引入歧途的； 欺骗的； 迷惑人的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make someone believe something that is not true

name: guide
trans: n. 指南；向导；入门书vt. 引导；带领；操纵vi. 担任向导

sentences.english: a tour guide
sentences.chinese: 导游

sentences.english: an experienced mountain guide
sentences.chinese: 一位有经验的登山向导

sentences.english: We were guided around the museums.
sentences.chinese: 我们在导游的带领下参观了博物馆。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to take tourists to a place and show them around
to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them

name: guideline
trans: n. 指导方针参考

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: guidance
trans: n. 指导，引导；领导

sentences.english: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
sentences.chinese: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

detailed_translations.english: help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

name: principle
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: share
trans: n. 份额；股份vt. 分享，分担；分配vi. 共享；分担

sentences.english: As a kid he’d never share his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他小时候从不肯与人分享他的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
one of the equal parts into which the  ownership  of a company is divided

name: shareholder
trans: n. 股东；股票持有人

sentences.english: Shareholders have been told to expect an even lower result next year.
sentences.chinese: 股东们被告知明年的业绩还会更差。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns shares in a company or business

name: stock
trans: n. 股份，股票；库存；血统；树干；家畜adj. 存货的，常备的；平凡的vt. 进货；备有；装把手于…vi. 囤积；办货；出新芽

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

name: plan
trans: n. 计划；平面图vt. 计划；设计；打算vi. 计划；打算

sentences.english: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.
sentences.chinese: 他计划先取得经济学学位，然后去国外工作一年。

sentences.english: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
sentences.chinese: 你周末有什么打算？

sentences.english: He immediately began planning his escape.
sentences.chinese: 他立即开始计划逃跑。

sentences.english: The former president is planning a return to politics.
sentences.chinese: 前总统打算重返政坛。

detailed_translations.english: something you have decided to do
to think carefully about something you want to do, and decide how and when you will do it

name: project
trans: n. 工程；计划；事业vt. 设计；计划；发射；放映vi. 设计；计划；表达；投射

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: projection
trans: n. 投射；规划；突出；发射；推测

sentences.english: projection equipment
sentences.chinese: 投影设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 投射；规划；突出；发射；推测
detailed_translations.english: the act of projecting a film or picture onto a screen

name: conceive
trans: vi. 怀孕；设想；考虑vt. 怀孕；构思；以为；持有

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: scheme
trans: n. 计划；组合；体制；诡计vt. 计划；策划vi. 搞阴谋；拟订计划

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

name: design
trans: n. 设计；图案vt. 设计；计划；构思vi. 设计

sentences.english: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

detailed_translations.english: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计， 构想； 图样； 企图
detailed_translations.english: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like

name: program
trans: n. 程序；计划；大纲vt. 用程序指令；为…制订计划；为…安排节目vi. 编程序；安排节目；设计电脑程式

sentences.english: Any large high-speed computer can be programmed to learn.
sentences.chinese: 任何大型高速计算机都可以通过编程获得学习能力。

detailed_translations.english: to give a computer a set of instructions that it can use to perform a particular operation

name: programme
trans: n. 计划，规划；节目；程序vt. 规划；拟…计划vi. 编程序；制作节目

sentences.english: the US space program
sentences.chinese: 美国太空计划

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

name: report
trans: n. 报告；报道；成绩单vt. 报告；报导；使报到vi. 报告；报到；写报导

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

name: journalism
trans: n. 新闻业，新闻工作；报章杂志

sentences.english: a career in journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.english: The hospital has been the target of investigative journalism(= journalism that examines an event or situation in order to find out the truth ).
sentences.chinese: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of writing news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: journalistic
trans: adj. 新闻业的，新闻工作者的

sentences.english: He began his journalistic career in the early eighties in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他于八十年代早期在澳大利亚开始了他的新闻事业。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新闻业的， 新闻工作者的
detailed_translations.english: Journalistic means relating to journalism, or produced by or typical of a journalist

name: media
trans: n. 媒体；媒质（medium的复数）；血管中层；浊塞音；中脉

sentences.english: The scandal was widely reported in the national media .
sentences.chinese: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。

sentences.english: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
sentences.chinese: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。

sentences.english: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。

sentences.english: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
sentences.chinese: 别的地方还会有战争，全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新闻媒介， 传播媒介
detailed_translations.english: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

name: coverage
trans: n. 覆盖，覆盖范围；新闻报道

sentences.english: live coverage of the match (= the match is broadcast at the same time that it is happening )
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛的现场直播

detailed_translations.english: when a subject or event is reported on television or radio, or in newspapers

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: include
trans: vt. 包含，包括

sentences.english: Does the price include postage?
sentences.chinese: 这个价格包含邮费吗？

sentences.english: His job includes looking after under-21 teams.
sentences.chinese: 他的职责包括照管21岁以下球队。

sentences.english: The curriculum includes courses in computing.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容包括计算机技术。

detailed_translations.english: if one thing includes another, the second thing is part of the first

name: inclusive
trans: adj. 包括的，包含的

sentences.english: The fully inclusive fare for the trip is £22.
sentences.chinese: 这次出行的全部费用为22英镑。

sentences.english: The rent is £120 a week, inclusive of heating.
sentences.chinese: 房租连暖气费在内是每星期120英镑。

detailed_translations.english: an inclusive price or cost includes everything

name: exclude
trans: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: exclusive
trans: n. 独家新闻；独家经营的项目；排外者adj. 独有的；排外的；专一的

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: exclusively
trans: adv. 唯一地；专有地；排外地

sentences.english: ...an exclusively male domain.
sentences.chinese: …一个由男性独占的领域。

detailed_translations.english: Exclusively is used to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else

name: value
trans: n. 值；价值；价格；重要性；确切涵义vt. 评价；重视；估价

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: valuable
trans: n. 贵重物品adj. 有价值的；贵重的；可估价的

name: overvalue
trans: vt. 对…估价过高；过分重视

name: devalue
trans: vt. 使贬值；降低…的价值vi. 贬值

sentences.english: Nigeria has just devalued its currency .
sentences.chinese: 尼日利亚刚刚令自己的货币贬值。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce the value of one country’s money when it is exchanged for another country’s money

name: devaluation
trans: n. 货币贬值

sentences.english: Nothing like that has happened in Europe — yet. But it’s certainly within the realm of possibility, especially as the pain of austerity and internal devaluation drags on.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲还没有发生这样的事情，但肯定在可能性范畴之内，尤其是随着财政紧缩与内部贬值痛苦的持续，这种可能会增大。

sentences.english: The risk of devaluation (of the currency) does not affect them as much as it does other investors.
sentences.chinese: （货币）贬值风险对他们的影响不像对其他投资商那么大。

name: around
trans: prep. 四处；在…周围adv. 大约；到处；在附近

sentences.english: What an inspiration she was to all around her!
sentences.chinese: 她对于她周围所有的人是一种多么大的鼓舞!

sentences.english: All those around him looked at him with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 周围的人都对他投射出惊异的眼光。

name: surround
trans: n. 围绕物vt. 围绕；包围adj. 环绕立体声的

sentences.english: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
sentences.chinese: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

detailed_translations.english: to be all around someone or something on every side

name: surrounding
trans: n. 环境，周围的事物adj. 周围的，附近的

sentences.english: Troops sealed off the surrounding area .
sentences.chinese: 军队封锁了周围地区。

sentences.english: We decided to explore the surrounding countryside .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定去附近的乡间走走看看。

detailed_translations.english: near or around a particular place

name: surroundings
trans: n. 环境；周围的事物

sentences.english: I need to work in pleasant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 我需要在舒适的环境下工作。

detailed_translations.english: the objects, buildings, natural things etc that are around a person or thing at a particular time

name: approximately
trans: adv. 大约，近似地；近于

sentences.english: The journey took approximately seven hours.
sentences.chinese: 旅程大约花了七个小时。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that sth is almost, but not completely, accurate or correct

name: product
trans: n. 产品；结果； 乘积；作品

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: produce
trans: n. 农产品，产品vt. 生产；引起；创作；生育，繁殖vi. 生产，创作

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

name: producer
trans: n. 制作人，制片人；生产者；发生器

sentences.english: ...Saudi Arabia, the world's leading oil producer.
sentences.chinese: …沙特阿拉伯，世界上最重要的石油生产国。

sentences.english: Hollywood producers and movie stars
sentences.chinese: 好莱坞的制片人和影星

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials

name: production
trans: n. 成果；产品；生产；作品

sentences.english: That model won't go into production before late 2007.
sentences.chinese: 那种型号要到2007年底才会投入生产。

sentences.english: a drop in oil and gas production
sentences.chinese: 石油和天然气产量的下降

detailed_translations.english: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

name: productive
trans: adj. 能生产的；生产的，生产性的；多产的；富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

name: productivity
trans: n. 生产力；生产率；生产能力

sentences.english: high productivity levels in manufacturing
sentences.chinese: 制造业中的高生产率

sentences.english: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
sentences.chinese: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

detailed_translations.english: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them

name: by-product
trans: n. 副产品；附带产生的结果；意外收获

sentences.english: The raw material for the tyre is a byproduct of oil refining.
sentences.chinese: 这种轮胎的原料是汽油提炼的副产品。

detailed_translations.english: something additional that is produced during a natural or industrial process

name: output
trans: n. 输出，输出量；产量；出产vt. 输出

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: yield
trans: n. 产量；收益vt. 屈服；出产，产生；放弃vi. 屈服，投降

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: reap
trans: vt. 收获，获得；收割vi. 收割，收获

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

name: case
trans: n. 情况；实例；箱vt. 包围；把…装于容器中

sentences.english: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.english: a severe case of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒重病例

sentences.english: It is simply not the case that prison conditions are improving.
sentences.chinese: 监狱条件得到改善的情况绝非事实。

detailed_translations.english: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

name: situation
trans: n. 情况；形势；处境；位置

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

name: circumstance
trans: n. 环境，情况；事件；境遇

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: context
trans: n. 环境；上下文；来龙去脉

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: instance
trans: n. 实例；情况；建议vt. 举...为例

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

name: condition
trans: n. 条件；情况；环境；身份vt. 决定；使适应；使健康；以…为条件

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: conditional
trans: n. 条件句；条件语adj. 有条件的；假定的

sentences.english: a conditional acceptance
sentences.chinese: 有条件的接受

detailed_translations.english: if an offer, agreement etc is conditional, it will only be done if something else happens first
a sentence or  clause  that is expressed in a conditional form

name: call
trans: n. 电话；呼叫；要求；访问vi. 呼叫；拜访；叫牌vt. 呼叫；称呼；召集

sentences.english: You may call it harmless fun, but I call it pornography.
sentences.chinese: 你可能会说这是无恶意的小玩笑，但是我却认为这是色情。

sentences.english: I heard someone calling in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我听到远处有人在叫。

detailed_translations.english: to use a word or name to describe someone or something in a particular way

name: recall
trans: n. 召回；回忆；撤消vt. 召回；回想起，记起；取消

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: concern
trans: n. 关系；关心；关心的事；忧虑vt. 涉及，关系到；使担心

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

name: concerned
trans: v. 关心（concern的过去时和过去分词）；与…有关adj. 有关的；关心的

sentences.english: Divorce is very painful, especially when children are concerned.
sentences.chinese: 离婚是非常痛苦的，涉及孩子的话更是如此。

sentences.english: Some of the farmers concerned suffer particularly from the low prices.
sentences.chinese: 涉及的农民当中，有些人因低价受到的损失尤为惨重。

sentences.english: We are trying to reach an agreement with all concerned (= everyone who is involved or affected ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们试图与相关各方达成协议。

detailed_translations.english: involved in something or affected by it

detailed_translations.chinese: 关心（concern的过去时和过去分词）；与…有关

name: discern
trans: vt. 识别；领悟，认识vi. 看清楚，辨别

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

name: caregiver
trans: n. 照料者，护理者

sentences.english: In addition to fulfilling the traditional roles of caregiver and homemaker, many Orthodox women also assume the role of primary breadwinner so their husbands can pursue religious studies full time.
sentences.chinese: 除了要践行传统的照料者和主妇角色，许多东正教女性也要承担起养家的责任以便她们的丈夫可以全身心进行宗教研究。

detailed_translations.english: someone who takes care of a child or sick person

name: history
trans: n. 历史，历史学；历史记录；来历

sentences.english: Throughout history the achievements of women have been largely ignored.
sentences.chinese: 从古至今，妇女的成就都被大大地忽视了。

sentences.english: No man in recent history has done more to rebuild the Democratic Party.
sentences.chinese: 他对重建民主党的贡献在近代史上无人能及。

sentences.english: the early history of Scotland
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰的早期历史

sentences.english: Other meteor storms have occurred in recorded history .
sentences.chinese: 在有记载的历史上发生过其他的流星暴。

sentences.english: a museum devoted to local history
sentences.chinese: 专门介绍当地历史的博物馆

sentences.english: one of the darkest episodes in American history
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上最黑暗的事件之一

sentences.english: an interesting period in Egyptian history
sentences.chinese: 埃及历史上一段有趣的时期

sentences.english: a decision that changed the course of history
sentences.chinese: 改变历史进程的决定

sentences.english: a college steeped in history
sentences.chinese: 一所历史悠久的学院

sentences.english: Your doctor will ask for your medical history.
sentences.chinese: 医生会询问你的病历。

detailed_translations.english: all the things that happened in the past, especially the political, social, or economic development of a nation

name: historian
trans: n. 历史学家

sentences.english: I am a historian, and I teach in an American university.
sentences.chinese: 我是一位历史学家，在美国一所大学任教。

sentences.english: "There’s nothing I can tell you about how [this or] any other incidents were or are handled, " CIA historian David Robarge said.
sentences.chinese: “关于[这一或]或任何其他事故是如何处理的，我没有什么可以告诉你的，”中央情报局历史学家大卫·罗巴尔说。

sentences.english: The historian drew a horizontal line on the date to remember it.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家在日期上画了一条水平线来记住这天。

detailed_translations.english: A historian is a person who specializes in the study of history, and who writes books and articles about it

name: historic
trans: adj. 有历史意义的；历史上著名的

sentences.english: a historic meeting of world leaders
sentences.chinese: 具有历史意义的世界领导人会议

sentences.english: ‘It is a historic moment ,’ he told journalists.
sentences.chinese: “那是历史性的一刻。”他告诉新闻记者。

detailed_translations.english: a historic event or act is very important and will be recorded as part of history

name: historical
trans: adj. 历史的；史学的；基于史实的

sentences.english: places of historical interest
sentences.chinese: 历史名胜

sentences.english: It is important to look at the novel in its historical context .
sentences.chinese: 在历史背景下看待这部小说很重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the past

name: historically
trans: adv. 历史上地；从历史观点上说

sentences.english: And historically they acted with that sense of stewardship in mind, thinking of what was appropriate for the whole system and not simply for their firm.
sentences.chinese: 而且在历史上，他们也在心目中带有那种使命感，思考的是什么对这个社会是最好的，不仅仅是对自己的公司。

sentences.english: After all, historically, the two nations have been enemies.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟在历史上，两个国家曾经是敌人。

sentences.english: Because historically, we have not defined marriage in our constitution.
sentences.chinese: 因为历史上我们从未在宪法中给婚姻下过定义。

name: chronicle
trans: n. 编年史，年代记；记录vt. 记录；把…载入编年史

sentences.english: His life is chronicled in a new biography published last week.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平被写成一本新传记，于上周出版。

sentences.english: The book chronicles the events leading up to the war.
sentences.chinese: 该书记述了导致战争爆发的一系列事件。

detailed_translations.english: to describe events in the order in which they happened

name: chronic
trans: adj. 慢性的；长期的；习惯性的

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: rise
trans: n. 上升；高地；增加；出现vt. 使…飞起；使…浮上水面vi. 上升；增强；起立；高耸

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

name: arise
trans: vi. 出现；上升；起立

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: raise
trans: n. 高地；上升；加薪vt. 提高；筹集；养育；升起vi. 上升

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: arouse
trans: vt. 引起；唤醒；鼓励vi. 激发；醒来；发奋

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: back
trans: n. 后面；背部；靠背；足球等的后卫；书报等的末尾adj. 后面的；过去的；拖欠的vt. 支持；后退；背书；下赌注adv. 以前；向后地；来回地；上溯；回来；回原处vi. 后退；背靠；倒退

sentences.english: I’ll be back in a minute.
sentences.chinese: 我马上回来。

sentences.english: Put that book back where you found it!
sentences.chinese: 把那本书放回原处！

sentences.english: He was back home by half past eleven.
sentences.chinese: 他是11点半之前回家的。

sentences.english: It’s possible to travel there and back in a day.
sentences.chinese: 到那里一天来回是可以的。

sentences.english: Kirov stepped back a pace.
sentences.chinese: 基洛夫往后退了一步。

detailed_translations.english: in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before

name: backdrop
trans: n. 背景；背景幕；交流声

sentences.english: ...the rugged cliffs that formed a backdrop to the village.
sentences.chinese: ...构成村庄天然屏障的崎岖峭壁。

detailed_translations.english: the  scenery  behind something that you are looking at

name: backfire
trans: n. 逆火，回火vi. 放出逆火；预先放火；产生出乎意料及事与愿违的结果

sentences.english: The company’s new policy backfired when a number of employees threatened to quit.
sentences.chinese: 公司的新政策事与愿违，有好几名员工威胁说要辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放出逆火；预先放火；产生出乎意料及事与愿违的结果
detailed_translations.english: if a plan or action backfires, it has the opposite effect to the one you intended

name: background
trans: n. 背景；隐蔽的位置adj. 背景的；发布背景材料的vt. 作…的背景

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

name: feedback
trans: n. 反馈；成果，资料；回复

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

name: firm
trans: n. 公司；商号adj. 坚定的；牢固的；严格的；结实的vt. 使坚定；使牢固adv. 稳固地vi. 变坚实；变稳固

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

name: affirm
trans: vt. 肯定；断言vi. 确认；断言

sentences.english: The general affirmed rumors of an attack.
sentences.chinese: 将军证实了袭击的传闻。

sentences.english: Both sides affirmed their commitment to the ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均申明答应停火。

detailed_translations.english: to state publicly that something is true

name: confirm
trans: vt. 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固

sentences.english: New evidence has confirmed the first witness’s story.
sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.english: To confirm my diagnosis I need to do some tests.
sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

detailed_translations.english: to state or show that sth is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence

name: hold
trans: n. 控制；保留vi. 支持；有效；持续vt. 持有；拥有；保存；拘留；约束或控制又作“Hold住”使用，中英混用词汇，表示轻松掌控全局。

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

name: holder
trans: n. 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物

sentences.english: the 800 m world record holder
sentences.chinese: 800米世界纪录保持者

sentences.english: Season-ticket holders are furious at the rise in rail fares.
sentences.chinese: 买季票的人对火车票价上涨极为愤怒。

sentences.english: British passport holders
sentences.chinese: 英国护照持有人

detailed_translations.chinese: 持有人；所有人；固定器；（台、架等）支持物
detailed_translations.english: someone who owns or controls something

name: withhold
trans: vt. 保留，不给；隐瞒；抑制vi. 忍住；克制

sentences.english: I withheld payment until they had completed the work.
sentences.chinese: 我扣着钱，直到他们完工。

sentences.english: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to give someone something

name: uphold
trans: vt. 支撑；鼓励；赞成；举起

sentences.english: We have a duty to uphold the law.
sentences.chinese: 维护法律是我们的责任。

detailed_translations.english: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist

name: grasp
trans: n. 抓住；理解；控制vi. 抓vt. 抓住；领会

sentences.english: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。

sentences.english: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

sentences.english: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
sentences.chinese: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

sentences.english: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
sentences.chinese: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊，领她进了门。

detailed_translations.english: to take and hold something firmly
the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

name: provide
trans: vt. 提供；规定；准备；装备vi. 规定；抚养；作准备

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: providing
trans: conj. 假如，以…为条件v. 供给（provide的ing形式）；预备

name: provider
trans: n. 供应者；养家者

sentences.english: an Internet service provider
sentences.chinese: 因特网服务供应商

detailed_translations.english: a company or person that provides a service

name: offer
trans: vt. 提供；出价；试图n. 提议；出价；意图；录取通知书vi. 提议；出现；献祭；求婚

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: supply
trans: n. 供给，补给；供应品vt. 供给，提供；补充vi. 供给；替代

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

name: supplement
trans: vt. 增补，补充n. 增补，补充；补充物；增刊，副刊

sentences.english: vitamins and other dietary supplements
sentences.chinese: 各种维生素和其他膳食补充剂

detailed_translations.chinese: 增补， 补充； 增刊， 副刊
detailed_translations.english: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

name: render
trans: n. 打底；交纳；粉刷vt. 致使；提出；实施；着色；以…回报vi. 给予补偿

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: complementary
trans: adj. 补足的，补充的

sentences.english: The computer and the human mind have different but complementary abilities.
sentences.chinese: 电脑与人脑各不相同，却又互为补充。

detailed_translations.english: complementary things go well together, although they are usually different

name: turn
trans: n. 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止vi. 转向；转变；转动vt. 转动，使旋转；转弯；翻过来；兑换

sentences.english: Ricky turned and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 里基转身走了。

sentences.english: She turned her head in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地转过头来。

sentences.english: Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel (= turned away suddenly because of anger ) , and stomped out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼，猛地一转身，噔噔噔地走出了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动，使旋转；转弯；翻过来；兑换
detailed_translations.english: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

detailed_translations.chinese: 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止
detailed_translations.english: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

name: turnaround
trans: n. 转变；转向；突然好转；回车道

name: turnover
trans: n. 翻覆； 营业额；流通量；半圆卷饼；失误adj. 翻过来的；可翻转的

sentences.english: The company had a turnover of $3.8 million.
sentences.chinese: 那个公司拥有380万美元的营业额。

detailed_translations.chinese: 营业额， 成交量； 人员调整， 人员更替率
detailed_translations.english: the amount of business done during a particular period

name: downturn
trans: n. 衰退（经济方面）；低迷时期

sentences.english: America’s current economic downturn
sentences.chinese: 美国目前经济的衰退

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退（经济方面）；低迷时期
detailed_translations.english: a period or process in which business activity, production etc is reduced and conditions become worse

name: overturn
trans: vt. 推翻；倾覆；破坏vi. 推翻；倾覆n. 倾覆；周转；破灭

sentences.english: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯莉一跃而起，碰倒了椅子。

sentences.english: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
sentences.chinese: 他的汽车发生侧翻，把他困在了里面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倾覆， 翻转， 翻倒
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

detailed_translations.chinese: 使翻转，使倾覆，使倒下；颠覆，推翻
detailed_translations.english: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

name: consider
trans: vi. 考虑；认为；细想vt. 考虑；认为；考虑到；细想

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

name: reconsider
trans: vt. 重新考虑；重新审议vi. 重新考虑

sentences.english: He should reconsider his decision to resign.
sentences.chinese: 他应该重新考虑辞职的决定。

sentences.english: We want you to come. Please reconsider.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望你来，请你重新考虑一下。

detailed_translations.english: to think again about something in order to decide if you should change your opinion or do something different

name: considerable
trans: adj. 相当大的；重要的，值得考虑的

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

name: considerably
trans: adv. 相当地；非常地

sentences.english: It’s considerably colder today.
sentences.chinese: 今天冷多了。

sentences.english: Conditions have improved considerably over the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 过去几年里条件已经得到了很大的改善。

detailed_translations.english: much or a lot

name: consideration
trans: n. 考虑；原因；关心；报酬

sentences.english: proposals put forward for consideration
sentences.chinese: 提请考虑的建议

sentences.english: They’ve got no consideration for others.
sentences.chinese: 他们一点都不为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: careful thought and attention, especially before making an official or important decision

name: contemplate
trans: vt. 沉思；注视；思忖；预期vi. 冥思苦想；深思熟虑

sentences.english: He had even contemplated suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至想过自杀。

sentences.english: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
sentences.chinese: 杰克去度假，仔细思考一下他的未来。

sentences.english: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 他微微含笑注视着她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑；深思；细想；注视，凝视
detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you might do in the future

name: political
trans: adj. 政治的；党派的

sentences.english: a monarch without political power
sentences.chinese: 没有政治权力的君主

sentences.english: He was a political prisoner (= one who was put in prison because he was thought to be harmful to the state) .
sentences.chinese: 他曾是个政治犯。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the state, government or public affairs

name: politician
trans: n. 政治家，政客

sentences.english: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
sentences.chinese: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家

sentences.english: a British Labour politician
sentences.chinese: 英国工党政治家

detailed_translations.english: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

name: politics
trans: n. 政治，政治学；政治活动；政纲

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: policy
trans: n. 政策，方针；保险单

sentences.english: US policy towards China
sentences.chinese: 美国的对华政策

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

name: regime
trans: n. 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: focus
trans: n. 焦点；中心；清晰；焦距vt. 使集中；使聚焦vi. 集中；聚焦；调节焦距

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

name: unfocused
trans: adj. 不聚成焦点的

sentences.english: The discussion was becom­ing unfocused.
sentences.chinese: 讨论的焦点越来越分散。

detailed_translations.english: not dealing with or paying attention to the most important ideas, causes etc

name: emphasis
trans: n. 重点；强调；加强语气

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: emphasise
trans: vt. （英）强调；加强…的语气（等于emphasize ）

sentences.english: I would emphasise three criteria.
sentences.chinese: 我想强调三条标准。

sentences.english: Many candidates go into interviews and are keen to emphasise their skills.
sentences.chinese: 在面试中，更多的候选人倾向于强调他们的专业技能。

sentences.english: They emphasise the significance of economic stability and social equality.
sentences.chinese: 他们强调了经济稳定、社会平等的重要性。

name: emphasize
trans: vt. 强调，着重

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: highlight
trans: n. 最精彩的部分；最重要的事情；加亮区vt. 突出；强调；使显著；加亮

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.english: That weekend in Venice was definitely the highlight of our trip.
sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

detailed_translations.english: to make a problem or subject easy to notice so that people pay attention to it
the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: concentrate
trans: n. 浓缩，精选；浓缩液vi. 集中；浓缩；全神贯注；聚集vt. 集中；浓缩

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: concentration
trans: n. 浓度；集中；浓缩；专心；集合

sentences.english: She needed all her powers of concentration to stop herself from slipping on the icy road.
sentences.chinese: 她需要集中全部注意力才能不让自己在结冰的路上滑倒。

sentences.english: Lack of concentration was a real problem.
sentences.chinese: 注意力不集中是个大问题。

sentences.english: I lost my concentration and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 我精神一放松就睡着了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中； 专注， 专心； 浓缩； 浓度
detailed_translations.english: the ability to think about something carefully or for a long time

name: industry
trans: n. 产业；工业；勤勉

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

name: industrial
trans: n. 工业股票；工业工人adj. 工业的，产业的；从事工业的；供工业用的；来自勤劳的

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

name: industrialist
trans: n. 实业家；工业家；产业工人

sentences.english: ...prominent Japanese industrialists.
sentences.chinese: …杰出的日本工业家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实业家；工业家；产业工人
detailed_translations.english: a person who owns or runs a factory or industrial company

name: agriculture
trans: n. 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学

sentences.english: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

name: agricultural
trans: adj. 农业的；农艺的

sentences.english: Farmers struggling for survival strip the forests for agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 为生存而挣扎的农民们把森林伐光来作农业用地。

detailed_translations.english: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture

name: process
trans: n. 过程，进行；方法，步骤；作用；程序；推移adj. 经过特殊加工（或处理）的vt. 处理；加工vi. 列队前进

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: proceed
trans: vi. 开始；继续进行；发生；行进n. 收入，获利

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: procedure
trans: n. 程序，手续；步骤

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: important
trans: adj. 重要的，重大的；有地位的；有权力的

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

name: importance
trans: n. 价值；重要；重大；傲慢

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

name: crucial
trans: adj. 重要的；决定性的；定局的；决断的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的；生死攸关的；有活力的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: significant
trans: n. 象征；有意义的事物adj. 重大的；有效的；有意义的；值得注意的；意味深长的

sentences.english: His most significant political achievement was the abolition of the death penalty.
sentences.chinese: 他政治上最重大的成就是废除了死刑。

sentences.english: Please inform us if there are any significant changes in your plans.
sentences.chinese: 你们的计划如有重大变动，请通知我们。

detailed_translations.english: having an important effect or influence, especially on what will happen in the future

name: insignificant
trans: adj. 无关紧要的

sentences.english: You realize that your problems are insignificant in comparison.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，你的问题相对来说微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too small or unimportant to consider or worry about

name: foremost
trans: adj. 最重要的；最先的adv. 首先；居于首位地

sentences.english: Economic concerns are foremost on many voters’ minds.
sentences.chinese: 经济是许多选民关心的首要问题。

sentences.english: Rostropovich was long considered the world’s foremost cellist.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，罗斯特罗波维奇一直被视为世界上首屈一指的大提琴家。

detailed_translations.english: in a leading position among a group of people or things

name: trivial
trans: adj. 不重要的，琐碎的；琐细的

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: watershed
trans: n. （美）流域；分水岭；集水区；转折点adj. 标志转折点的

sentences.english: The election of Mary Robinson in 1990 was a watershed in Irish politics.
sentences.chinese: 1990年玛丽·鲁滨逊的当选是爱尔兰政治的分水岭。

detailed_translations.chinese: （美）流域；分水岭；集水区；转折点
detailed_translations.english: an event or time when important changes happen in history or in your life

name: improve
trans: vt. 改善，增进；提高…的价值vi. 增加；变得更好

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

name: improvement
trans: n. 改进，改善；提高

sentences.english: Our results have shown some improvement this month.
sentences.chinese: 我们的成绩这个月有所提高。

sentences.english: Are you making some improvements to your home?
sentences.chinese: 你在改善家里的居住条件吗？

detailed_translations.english: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

name: heighten
trans: vt. 提高；增高；加强；使更显著vi. 升高；变强

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增加

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: enhancement
trans: n. 增加；放大

sentences.english: Progressive enhancement helps us to do that because it forces us to focus on the content and build out from there.
sentences.chinese: 渐进增强能够帮助我们做到这一点，因为它让我们关注内容并且从内容开始构建。

name: augment
trans: n. 增加；增大vt. 增加；增大vi. 增加；增大

sentences.english: Any surplus was sold to augment their income.
sentences.chinese: 所有多余的东西被售卖一空来增加他们的收入。

detailed_translations.english: to increase the value, amount, effectiveness etc of something

name: elevate
trans: vt. 提升；举起；振奋情绪等；提升…的职位

sentences.english: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
sentences.chinese: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

sentences.english: Gradually elevate the patient into an upright position.
sentences.chinese: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

detailed_translations.english: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

name: measure
trans: n. 测量；措施；程度；尺寸vt. 测量；估量；权衡vi. 测量；估量

sentences.english: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后，民众要求制定新的安全措施。

sentences.english: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
sentences.chinese: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

detailed_translations.english: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

name: measurement
trans: n. 测量； 度量；尺寸；量度制

sentences.english: What’s your waist measurement?
sentences.chinese: 你腰围是多少？

sentences.english: accurate measurement of body temperature
sentences.chinese: 体温的精确测量

detailed_translations.english: the length, height etc of something

name: degree
trans: n. 程度，等级；度；学位；阶层

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

name: rate
trans: n. 比率，率；速度；价格；等级vt. 认为；估价；责骂vi. 责骂；被评价

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: scale
trans: n. 规模；比例；鳞；刻度；天平；数值范围vt. 测量；攀登；刮鳞；依比例决定vi. 衡量；攀登；剥落；生水垢

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞
detailed_translations.english: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: dimension
trans: n. 方面; 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt. 标出尺寸adj. 规格的

sentences.english: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不信宗教，也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 方面;[数] 维；尺寸；次元；容积 vt标出尺寸
detailed_translations.english: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

name: stress
trans: n. 压力；强调；紧张；重要性；重读vt. 强调；使紧张；加压力于；用重音读

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

name: stressful
trans: adj. 紧张的；有压力的

sentences.english: Moving to a new house is a very stressful experience.
sentences.chinese: 搬新家是件很劳心的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 充满著压力的，充满著紧张的
detailed_translations.english: a job, experience, or situation that is stressful makes you worry a lot

name: pressure
trans: n. 压力；压迫， 压强vt. 迫使；密封；使……增压

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: burden
trans: n. 负担；责任；船的载货量vt. 使负担；烦扰；装货于

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

name: tension
trans: n. 张力，拉力；紧张，不安；电压vt. 使紧张；使拉紧

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

name: support
trans: n. 支持，维持；支援，供养；支持者，支撑物vt. 支持，支撑，支援；扶持，帮助；赡养，供养

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

name: supporter
trans: n. 支持者；拥护者

sentences.english: Manchester United supporters
sentences.chinese: 曼彻斯特联队的支持者

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports a particular person, group, or plan

name: supportive
trans: adj. 支持的；支援的；赞助的

sentences.english: My family were very supportive throughout the divorce.
sentences.chinese: 离婚过程中我的家人自始至终都很支持我。

detailed_translations.english: giving help or encouragement, especially to someone who is in a difficult situation – used to show approval

name: favor
trans: n. 喜爱；欢心；好感vt. 赞成；喜欢；像；赐予；证实

sentences.english: Both countries seem to favour the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 两个国家似乎都更倾向于这份协议。

detailed_translations.english: to prefer someone or something to other things or people, especially when there are several to choose from

name: favour
trans: n. 偏爱；赞同；善行vt. 赞成；喜爱；有助于

sentences.english: Could you do me a favour and tell Kelly I can’t make it?
sentences.chinese: 你帮个忙告诉凯莉说我来不了好吗？

sentences.english: He hired John as a favour to his father.
sentences.chinese: 他雇约翰是给他父亲一个面子。

sentences.english: Paul, can I ask you a favor ?
sentences.chinese: 保罗，能帮我一下吗？

sentences.english: I owed him a favour so I couldn’t say no.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一个人情，所以无法拒绝。

sentences.english: She helps me out when I have too much to do, and I return the favour when I can.
sentences.chinese: 我忙的时候她来帮忙，我能帮她的时候就还她人情。

sentences.english: Do yourself a favour and make sure you get some time to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 对自己好些，一定要留点时间给自己。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them

detailed_translations.chinese: 赞同； 喜爱， 偏爱； 有利于
detailed_translations.english: to provide suitable conditions for something to happen

name: favorable
trans: adj. 有利的；良好的；赞成的，赞许的；讨人喜欢的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: favourable
trans: n. 有利adj. 有利的，顺利的；赞成的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

sentences.english: The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions.
sentences.chinese: 这种病在合适的条件下会传播得很快。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: unfavorable
trans: adj. 不宜的；令人不快的；不顺利的

sentences.english: It will save you from nasty surprises and you will be financially, mentally and legally prepared to save your business from unfavorable consequences of cloud computing.
sentences.chinese: 这样才不至于出现意想不到的不愉快，你要准备好从而避免在财务上、精神上和法律上承担云计算的不利后果。

sentences.english: Despite their desire to be more market-oriented, many of the rural banks may come under pressure from local officials to make loans on unfavorable terms, pushing up their NPLs.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有加强市场导向的期望,但是多数农村银行或受到当地政府的压力,以不利的合同条款发放贷款,从而推高不良贷款.

detailed_translations.chinese: 不宜的；令人不快的；不顺利的

name: unfavourable
trans: adj. 不利的；不适宜的；反对的

name: favorably
trans: adv. 顺利地；亲切地；好意地

name: favourably
trans: adv. 顺利地；有利地；好意地（等于favorably）

name: favoritism
trans: n. 偏袒；得宠

sentences.english: Every office has its share of favoritism, inefficiency and dumb decisions.
sentences.chinese: 每个公司都有他的偏袒、无效率和愚蠢的决定。

sentences.english: To gauge favoritism, the researchers asked the moms three questions: To which child in your family do you feel the most emotional closeness?
sentences.chinese: 为了判断是否属于偏袒，研究人员问了妈妈们三个问题：在你家孩子中，谁跟你感情最亲密？

name: favouritism
trans: n. 徇私；偏爱；得宠

name: prefer
trans: vt. 更喜欢；宁愿；提出；提升vi. 喜欢；愿意

sentences.english: She prefers her coffee black.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

name: preference
trans: n. 偏爱，倾向；优先权

sentences.english: Do you have a colour preference ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

sentences.english: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
sentences.chinese: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。

sentences.english: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
sentences.chinese: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。

sentences.english: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

sentences.english: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
sentences.chinese: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

name: benefit
trans: n. 利益，好处；救济金vt. 有益于，对…有益vi. 受益，得益

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: beneficial
trans: adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: benefactor
trans: n. 恩人；捐助者；施主

sentences.english: An anonymous benefactor donated $2 million.
sentences.chinese: 一位没留姓名的捐助人捐款二百万美元。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money for a good purpose

name: profit
trans: n. 利润；利益vt. 有益于vi. 获利；有益

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: profitable
trans: adj. 有利可图的；赚钱的；有益的

sentences.english: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明，这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。

sentences.english: a highly profitable business
sentences.chinese: 盈利高的企业

sentences.english: a profitable afternoon
sentences.chinese: 有收获的下午

detailed_translations.english: producing a profit or a useful result

name: lucrative
trans: adj. 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的

sentences.english: Thousands of ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的退役军官在私人保安公司找到了薪水丰厚的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that is lucrative lets you earn a lot of money

name: attention
trans: n. 注意力；关心；立正！（口令）

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

name: attentive
trans: adj. 留意的，注意的

sentences.english: an attentive audience
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神的听众

detailed_translations.english: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

name: distract
trans: vt. 转移；分心

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

name: distraction
trans: n. 注意力分散；消遣；心烦意乱

sentences.english: I study in the library as there are too many distractions at home.
sentences.chinese: 我在图书馆学习，家里分心的事太多。

detailed_translations.english: something that stops you paying attention to what you are doing

name: fact
trans: n. 事实；实际；真相

sentences.english: First of all, we need to know the facts of the case.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我们需要了解案子的相关事实。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of information that is known to be true

name: factor
trans: n. 因素；要素； 因数；代理人vt. 把…作为因素计入；代理经营；把…分解成vi. 做代理商

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: factual
trans: adj. 事实的；真实的

sentences.english: Try to keep your account of events as factual as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你要尽量如实地说明情况。

detailed_translations.english: based on facts or relating to facts

name: virtual
trans: adj.  虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: virtually
trans: adv. 事实上，几乎；实质上

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: truth
trans: n. 真理；事实；诚实；实质

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

sentences.english: The experience has taught us some basic truths.
sentences.chinese: 这次经历教会我们一些基本的道理。

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

detailed_translations.english: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

name: truly
trans: adv. 真实地，不假；真诚地

sentences.english: His work is truly original.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品确实十分独特。

sentences.english: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
sentences.chinese: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。

sentences.english: a truly great work of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

name: personal
trans: n. 人事消息栏；人称代名词adj. 个人的；身体的；亲自的

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流
