detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of a school

name: mostly
trans: adv. 主要地；通常；多半地

sentences.english: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
sentences.chinese: 绿茶主要来自中国或日本。

sentences.english: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
sentences.chinese: 大厅里大约有15人，大部分是女性。

sentences.english: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
sentences.chinese: 他责怪他的父母，主要是责怪他爸爸。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc

name: largely
trans: adv. 主要地；大部分；大量地

sentences.english: The state of Nevada is largely desert.
sentences.chinese: 内华达州大部分是沙漠。

sentences.english: It had been a tiring day, largely because of all the tedious waiting.
sentences.chinese: 那一天真累人，主要是因为等得无聊。

detailed_translations.english: mostly or mainly

name: minor
trans: adj. 未成年的；次要的；较小的；小调的；二流的n. 未成年人；小调；副修科目vi. 副修

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

name: minority
trans: n. 少数民族；少数派；未成年adj. 少数的；属于少数派的

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

name: online
trans: adj. 联机的；在线的adv. 在线地

sentences.english: All the city’s schools will be online by the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 到年底，市里的所有学校都会连接因特网。

sentences.english: ...the cool stuff you find online.
sentences.chinese: …你在网上找到的好东西。

detailed_translations.english: connected to other computers through the Internet, or available through the Internet
While connected to a computer or under computer control.

name: network
trans: n. 网络；广播网；网状物

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

name: hack
trans: n. 砍，劈；出租马车vt. 砍；出租vi. 砍

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver
to cut something roughly or violently

name: download
trans: vt.  下载

sentences.english: games that can be downloaded free from the Internet
sentences.chinese: 可以从因特网上免费下载的游戏

detailed_translations.english: to move information or programs from a computer network to a small computer

name: upload
trans: vt. 上传

name: encode
trans: vt. （将文字材料）译成密码；编码，编制成计算机语言

sentences.english: As previously mentioned, the main thing this renderer does is decode input and encode output.
sentences.chinese: 正如前面提到的，渲染器做的主要工作就是解码输入和编码输出。

sentences.english: Decoder - This feature can be used to decode data to get back the original form, or to encode and encrypt data.
sentences.chinese: 这个特性用来解码数据，从而得到数据的原始形式。或者用来编码和加密数据。

sentences.english: Obviously, if you wanted to encode and decode in some other format, I would suggest extending the input and output stream.
sentences.chinese: 如果您希望以其他格式进行编码和解码，我建议您继承输入和输出流，这是很自然的事情。

detailed_translations.english: to put a message or other information into code

name: code
trans: n. 代码，密码；编码；法典vt. 编码；制成法典vi. 指定遗传密码

sentences.english: The spy sent his message in code.
sentences.chinese: 这个间谍用密码发送情报。

sentences.english: But we have not yet implemented this in the code.
sentences.chinese: 但我们在代码中尚未实现此功能。

sentences.english: The hacker came smack up against the company's policy of keeping its records in code.
sentences.chinese: 这个计算机黑客突然碰壁了，因这家公司实行了用密码保存公司纪录的政策。

name: sense
trans: n. 感觉，功能；观念；道理；理智vt. 感觉到；检测

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: nonsense
trans: n. 胡说；废话adj. 荒谬的int. 胡说！

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: sensible
trans: n. 可感觉到的东西; 敏感的人;adj. 明智的; 通情达理的; 合乎情理的; 意识到的，能感觉到的;

sentences.english: She seems very sensible.
sentences.chinese: 她好像很明智。

sentences.english: sensible advice
sentences.chinese: 合理的建议

sentences.english: It’s sensible to keep a note of your passport number.
sentences.chinese: 把你的护照号码记下来是明智的。

sentences.english: Moving house seemed like the sensible thing to do .
sentences.chinese: 搬家似乎是明智的做法。

detailed_translations.english: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

name: sensitive
trans: adj. 敏感的；感觉的； 灵敏的；感光的；易受伤害的；易受影响的n. 敏感的人；有灵异能力的人

sentences.english: a very sensitive child
sentences.chinese: 一个很敏感的小孩

sentences.english: a highly sensitive electronic camera
sentences.chinese: 高敏感度的电子摄像机

detailed_translations.english: easily upset or offended by events or things that people say

name: sensitivity
trans: n. 敏感；敏感性；过敏

sentences.english: Each user should have access to a security level based upon the level of data sensitivity he or she can see.
sentences.chinese: 根据用户可以看到的数据的敏感性级别，每个用户都应该可以访问某个安全级别。

sentences.english: The authentication mode you choose for your environment will be determined by the level of sensitivity of your data.
sentences.chinese: 应该为您的环境选择什么样的身份验证模式，这是由数据的敏感级别来决定的。

sentences.english: The sensitivity of the test meets WHO standards for detecting the toxin in drinking water.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试的灵敏度满足了世界卫生组织探测饮用水毒物的标准。

name: insensitive
trans: adj. 感觉迟钝的，对…没有感觉的

sentences.english: ...women's and Latino organizations that say he is insensitive to civil rights.
sentences.chinese: …指责他漠视民权的女性和拉丁美洲人的组织。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感觉迟钝的，对…没有感觉的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is insensitive to a situation or to a need does not think or care about it

name: sentiment
trans: n. 感情，情绪；情操；观点；多愁善感

sentences.english: the spread of nationalist sentiments
sentences.chinese: 民族主义情绪的传播

sentences.english: the anti-immigrant sentiments expressed by some Americans
sentences.chinese: 一些美国人表露出的反移民情绪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

name: emotion
trans: n. 情感；情绪

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: emotional
trans: adj. 情绪的；易激动的；感动人的

sentences.english: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
sentences.chinese: 在我非常痛苦的时候，她是我的情感支柱。

sentences.english: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
sentences.chinese: 安患了抑郁症，还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional state of the patient
sentences.chinese: 患者的生理和情绪状态

sentences.english: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
sentences.chinese: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

sentences.english: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
sentences.chinese: 当我们不得不离开时，他非常伤感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 情绪(上)的，情感(上)的；激起感情的； 敏感的；情绪激动的〔尤指哭泣〕
detailed_translations.english: relating to your feelings or how you control them

name: emotionally
trans: adv. 感情上；情绪上；令人激动地；情绪冲动地

name: community
trans: n. 社区； 群落；共同体；团体

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

name: communal
trans: adj. 公共的；公社的

sentences.english: a communal bathroom
sentences.chinese: 一个公用浴室

detailed_translations.english: shared by a group of people or animals, especially a group who live together

name: communicate
trans: vi. 通讯，传达；相通；交流；感染vt. 传达；感染；显露

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: communication
trans: n. 通讯， 通信；交流；信函

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

name: corporate
trans: adj. 法人的；共同的，全体的；社团的；公司的；企业的

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

name: corporation
trans: n. 公司；法人（团体）；社团；大腹便便；市政当局

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

name: define
trans: vt. 定义；使明确；规定

sentences.english: the ability to define clients’ needs
sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.english: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.chinese: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.english: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.chinese: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

detailed_translations.english: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

name: definition
trans: n. 定义； 清晰度；解说

sentences.english: a dictionary definition
sentences.chinese: 词典里的释义

detailed_translations.english: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

name: redefine
trans: vt. 重新定义

sentences.english: Feminists have redefined the role of women.
sentences.chinese: 女权主义者们已重新定义了女性角色。

detailed_translations.english: If you redefine something, you cause people to consider it in a new way

name: definitely
trans: adv. 清楚地，当然；明确地，肯定地

sentences.english: ‘Do you reckon Margot will be there?’ ‘ Definitely not .’
sentences.chinese: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”

sentences.english: The hotel fitness centre is definitely worth a visit.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。

sentences.english: I definitely need a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我太需要休假了。

detailed_translations.english: without any doubt

name: indefinitely
trans: adv. 不确定地，无限期地；模糊地，不明确地

sentences.english: It can give you the ability to store indefinitely your session data where it can be retrieved not only after a restart, but from any of a number of machines in a cluster.
sentences.chinese: 它可以给予您无限地存储会话数据的能力，使您的会话数据不仅可以在重新启动后检索，还可以从群集中许多机器中的任意一个检索。

sentences.english: Assuming the systems keep operating, like I've said, we can command the vehicle from the ground and operate it fine, and remain on orbit indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 假定系统继续运行，我和所说的那样，我们可以很好地从地面指挥和操作飞船，使它无限期地留在轨道上。

detailed_translations.english: without giving clear or exact details

name: effort
trans: n. 努力；成就

sentences.english: Lou lifted the box easily, without using much effort.
sentences.chinese: 卢没费多大力气就把箱子搬了起来。

sentences.english: Frank put a lot of effort into the party.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克办这次聚会花了不少精力。

sentences.english: Learning to speak another language takes effort.
sentences.chinese: 学说外语要下功夫。

sentences.english: I'm afraid this essay is a poor effort.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，这篇文章写得不好。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental energy that you need to do sth; sth that takes a lot of energy

name: endeavor
trans: n. 努力；尽力（等于endeavour）vi. 努力；尽力（等于endeavour）vt. 努力；尽力（等于endeavour）

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: endeavour
trans: n. 尽力，竭力vi. 竭力；企图vt. 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

name: strive
trans: vi. 努力；奋斗；抗争

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make a great effort to achieve something

name: order
trans: n. 命令；顺序；规则； 定单vt. 命令；整理；定购vi. 命令；定货

sentences.english: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.chinese: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.english: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.english: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.chinese: 法院下令放他出狱。

detailed_translations.english: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

name: disorder
trans: n. 混乱；骚乱vt. 使失调；扰乱

sentences.english: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
sentences.chinese: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

detailed_translations.chinese: 混乱， 杂乱， 骚乱
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

name: arrange
trans: vi. 安排；排列；协商vt. 安排；排列；整理

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: arrangement
trans: n. 布置；整理；准备

sentences.english: Have you made all your travel arrangements?
sentences.chinese: 你的旅行都安排好了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 整理， 排列； 安排； 准备工作
detailed_translations.english: plans and preparations that you must make so that something can happen

name: sequence
trans: n.  序列；顺序；续发事件vt. 按顺序排好

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: subsequent
trans: adj. 后来的，随后的

sentences.english: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
sentences.chinese: 这些技能代代相传。

sentences.english: subsequent pages of the book
sentences.chinese: 接下去的书页

detailed_translations.english: happening or coming after something else

name: account
trans: n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述vt. 认为；把…视为vi. 解释；导致；报账

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: accountable
trans: adj. 有责任的；有解释义务的；可解释的

sentences.english: The hospital should be held accountable for the quality of care it gives.
sentences.chinese: 医院应当对医护质量负责。

detailed_translations.english: responsible for the effects of your actions and willing to explain or be criticized for them

name: accountability
trans: n. 有义务；有责任；可说明性

sentences.english: View your job, and her job, as a shared accountability.
sentences.chinese: 把你和她的工作看做是一种联合责任。

sentences.english: But you must balance that need with the need for accountability.
sentences.chinese: 但是你必须在个人需求和责任感两方面做出平衡。

sentences.english: Some of us have trouble with accountability because we associate the word with punishment, scrutiny, and/or not meeting standards or agreements.
sentences.chinese: 好些人都把责任理解错误了，因为我们总是把责任和惩罚，仔细检查或者没有达到标准或不一致性联系在一起。

name: count
trans: n. 计数；计算；伯爵vt. 计算；认为vi. 计数；有价值

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

name: algorithm
trans: n.  算法，运算法则

name: claim
trans: n. 要求；声称；索赔；断言；值得vt. 要求；声称；需要；认领vi. 提出要求

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: acclaim
trans: n. 欢呼，喝彩；称赞vt. 称赞；为…喝彩，向…欢呼vi. 欢呼，喝彩

sentences.english: His work was acclaimed by art critics.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品得到艺术评论家的推崇。

sentences.english: Angela Bassett has won critical acclaim for her excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 安杰拉·巴西特因她出色的表演而赢得了评论界的赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: to praise someone or something publicly
Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

name: claimant
trans: n. 原告； 索赔人；提出要求者

sentences.english: benefit claimants
sentences.chinese: 救济金申请人

detailed_translations.chinese: 原告；[贸易] 索赔人；提出要求者
detailed_translations.english: someone who claims something, especially money, from the government, a court etc because they think they have a right to it

name: declare
trans: vt. 宣布，声明；断言，宣称vi. 声明，宣布

sentences.english: A state of emergency has been declared.
sentences.chinese: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

sentences.english: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。

sentences.english: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain (= officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动，这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

detailed_translations.english: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true

name: assert
trans: vt. 维护，坚持；断言；主张；声称

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: assertion
trans: n. 断言，声明；主张，要求；坚持；认定

sentences.english: She makes very general assertions about marriage in the poem.
sentences.chinese: 她在诗中的婚姻主张非常笼统。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言，声明；主张，要求；坚持；认定
detailed_translations.english: something that you say or write that you strongly believe

name: allege
trans: vt. 宣称，断言；提出…作为理由

sentences.english: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她指称该组织中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言， 宣称， 硬说
detailed_translations.english: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

name: announce
trans: vt. 宣布；述说；预示；播报vi. 宣布参加竞选；当播音员

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: announcement
trans: n. 公告；宣告；发表；通告

sentences.english: The minister made the announcement at a news conference.
sentences.chinese: 部长在记者招待会上发表了这项声明。

detailed_translations.english: an important or official statement

name: contend
trans: vi. 竞争；奋斗；斗争；争论vt. 主张；为...斗争

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: compliment
trans: n. 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺vt. 恭维；称赞

sentences.english: All the guests paid her extravagant compliments.
sentences.chinese: 所有客人都对她赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Being compared to Abba is a great compliment.
sentences.chinese: 能和阿巴乐队相提并论是极大的赞誉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恭维；称赞；问候；致意；道贺
detailed_translations.english: a remark that shows you admire someone or something
to say something nice to someone in order to praise them

name: describe
trans: vt. 描述，形容；描绘

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

name: description
trans: n. 描述，描写；类型；说明书

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

name: prescription
trans: n. 药方；指示；惯例adj. 凭处方方可购买的

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: subscribe
trans: vt. 签署；赞成；捐助vi. 订阅；捐款；认购；赞成；签署

sentences.english: My main reason for subscribing to New Scientist is to keep abreast of advances in science.
sentences.chinese: 我订阅《新科学家》的主要原因是要跟上科学的进步。

sentences.english: Each employee may subscribe for up to £2,000 worth of shares.
sentences.chinese: 每位员工最高可以认购价值 2,000 英镑的股份。

sentences.english: The tour of Edinburgh is fully subscribed.
sentences.chinese: 去爱丁堡旅游的名额已经满了。

detailed_translations.english: to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service

name: subscriber
trans: n. 订户；签署者；捐献者

name: subscription
trans: n. 捐献；订阅；订金；签署

sentences.english: You may cancel your subscription at any time.
sentences.chinese: 你随时可以取消订阅。

sentences.english: I’ve decided not to renew my subscription .
sentences.chinese: 我决定不再续订了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money you pay, usually once a year, to receive copies of a newspaper or magazine, or receive a service, or the act of paying money for this

name: manuscript
trans: n.  手稿；原稿adj. 手写的

sentences.english: Unfortunately, parts of the original manuscript have been lost.
sentences.chinese: 遗憾的是，部分原始手稿丢失了。

detailed_translations.english: a book or piece of writing before it is printed

name: opportunity
trans: n. 时机，机会

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

name: chance
trans: n. 机会，际遇；运气，侥幸；可能性vt. 偶然发生；冒……的险vi. 碰巧；偶然被发现

sentences.english: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.english: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 总有可能会出现问题。

sentences.english: If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.english: There is little chance of her being found alive.
sentences.chinese: 她生还的可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do

name: occasion
trans: n. 时机，机会；场合；理由vt. 引起，惹起

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: occasionally
trans: adv. 偶尔；间或

sentences.english: Occasionally Alice would look up from her books.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯偶尔会从书中抬起头来。

name: practice
trans: n. 实践；练习；惯例vt. 练习；实习；实行vi. 练习；实习；实行

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: malpractice
trans: n. 玩忽职守；不法行为；治疗不当

sentences.english: No complaints, no malpractice lawsuits, seems friendly, well-liked.
sentences.chinese: 没有被投诉过，也没有治疗不当的诉讼，友善受欢迎。

sentences.english: However, the numbers seem out of balance when you consider that nearly all doctors in specialties such as obstetrics and general surgery will face at least one malpractice claim during their careers.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当你仔细想想，在诸如产科和普通外科之类的专业里，几乎所有医生在他们的职业生涯中都要面临着至少一次失误索赔时，这些数字似乎失衡了。

name: practical
trans: adj. 实际的；实用性的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: impractical
trans: adj. 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

name: practically
trans: adv. 实际地；几乎；事实上

sentences.english: I’ve read practically all of his books.
sentences.chinese: 我差不多读过他所有的书。

sentences.english: She sees him practically every day.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎天天见到他。

sentences.english: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
sentences.chinese: 将会发生什么，几乎不能预料。

sentences.english: The two designs were practically identical.
sentences.chinese: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: practicality
trans: n. 实用性，实际性；实际，实例

sentences.english: doubts about the practicality of your suggestion
sentences.chinese: 对于你所提建议的可行性的怀疑

sentences.english: You need to think about comfort and practicality when choosing walking shoes.
sentences.chinese: 选购步行鞋时需要考虑舒适性和实用性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实用性，实际性；实际，实例
detailed_translations.english: how suitable something is, or whether it will work

name: routine
trans: n.  程序；日常工作；例行公事adj. 日常的；例行的

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: routinely
trans: adv. 例行公事地；老一套地

sentences.english: This vaccine is already routinely used.
sentences.chinese: 这种疫苗的使用已经常规化。

detailed_translations.english: if something is routinely done, it is done as a normal part of a process or job

name: nature
trans: n. 自然；性质；本性；种类

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的；物质的；天生的；不做作的n. 自然的事情；白痴；本位音

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: unnatural
trans: adj. 不自然的；反常的；不近人情的

sentences.english: It was very cold, which seemed unnatural for late spring.
sentences.chinese: 天很冷，对于晚春来说似乎不正常。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不自然的；反常的；不近人情的
detailed_translations.english: different from what you would normally expect

name: instinct
trans: n. 本能，直觉；天性adj. 充满着的

sentences.english: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她有些不对劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 本能； 直觉， 生性
detailed_translations.english: a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know something, which is not learned

name: instinctively
trans: adv. 本能地

sentences.english: What do we instinctively do?
sentences.chinese: 出于本能，我们会怎么做？

sentences.english: He thought how like her expression was then, to what it had been when she looked round at the Doctor - that night - and instinctively dropped her hand and turned away.
sentences.chinese: 他想，她现在的表情跟她那天夜里环视四周，最后望着医生时的表情是多么相像啊，于是他就本能地放下她的手，走开了。

sentences.english: We answer this question instinctively and quite quickly because we have some intuitive sense of the whole experience.
sentences.chinese: 我们本能而迅捷地回答这个问题，因为对于整个经历，我们有一些直觉的感受。

name: viscerally
trans: adv. visceral（内脏的；发自肺腑的）的变形

name: trust
trans: n. 信任，信赖；责任；托拉斯vt. 信任，信赖；盼望；赊卖给vi. 信任，信赖；依靠

sentences.english: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.english: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.english: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.english: I just don’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.english: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

detailed_translations.english: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

name: distrust
trans: n. 不信任vt. 不信任怀疑

sentences.english: She had every reason to distrust him.
sentences.chinese: 她完全有理由不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to not trust someone or something
a feeling that you cannot trust someone

name: entrust
trans: vt. 委托，信托

sentences.english: He entrusted his cash to a business partner for investment in a series of projects.
sentences.chinese: 他把现款委托给一个生意合伙人投资一系列项目。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone responsible for doing something important, or for taking care of someone

name: trustworthiness
trans: n. 可信赖；确实性

name: approach
trans: n. 方法；途径；接近vt. 接近；着手处理vi. 靠近

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: method
trans: n. 方法；条理；类函数adj. 使用体验派表演方法的

sentences.english: traditional teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 传统的教学法

sentences.english: I think we should try again using a different method.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们应该用不同的方法再试一次。

sentences.english: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
sentences.chinese: 信息存储和检索的有效方法

detailed_translations.english: a planned way of doing something, especially one that a lot of people know about and use

name: habit
trans: n. 习惯，习性；嗜好vt. 使穿衣

sentences.english: Regular exercise is a good habit.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。

sentences.english: Thinking negatively can become a habit.
sentences.chinese: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。

sentences.english: She has a habit of playing with her hair when she’s nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她有一个习惯，一紧张就拨弄自己的头发。

sentences.english: Some people drink alcohol as much from habit as from desire.
sentences.chinese: 有些人喝酒既是因为想喝，也是出于习惯。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

name: inhabit
trans: vt. 栖息；居住于；占据vi. （古）居住；栖息

sentences.english: The woods are inhabited by many wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 很多野生动物栖居在这片森林里。

sentences.english: inhabited islands
sentences.chinese: 有人居住的岛屿

detailed_translations.english: if animals or people inhabit an area or place, they live there

name: habitually
trans: adv. 习惯地；日常地

name: habitat
trans: n.  栖息地，产地

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: inhabitant
trans: n. 居民；居住者

sentences.english: a city of six million inhabitants
sentences.chinese: 有600万居民的城市

detailed_translations.english: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: avoid
trans: vt. 避免；避开，躲避；消除

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: evade
trans: vt. 逃避；规避；逃脱vi. 逃避；规避；逃脱

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

name: inevitable
trans: adj. 必然的，不可避免的

sentences.english: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

name: inevitably
trans: adv. 不可避免地；必然地

sentences.english: The decision will inevitably lead to political tensions.
sentences.chinese: 该决定必然导致政治局势的紧张。

sentences.english: Inevitably, the situation did not please everyone.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况必定不能让所有人都感到满意。

detailed_translations.english: used for saying that something is certain to happen and cannot be avoided

name: compare
trans: vi. 相比，匹敌；比较，区别；比拟（常与to连用）vt. 比拟，喻为；构成n. 比较

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

name: comparison
trans: n. 比较；对照；比喻；比较关系

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

name: comparable
trans: adj. 可比较的；比得上的

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

name: comparatively
trans: adv. 比较地；相当地

sentences.english: a comparatively small number of people
sentences.chinese: 相对较少的人数

sentences.english: Comparatively few books have been written on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 有关这方面的书相对较少。

sentences.english: Crime on the island is comparatively rare .
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上犯罪活动相对较少。

sentences.english: Comparatively speaking, this part of the coast is still unspoiled.
sentences.chinese: 相对而言，这一段海岸尚未遭到破坏。

detailed_translations.english: as compared to something else or to a previous state

name: contrast
trans: n. 对比；差别；对照物vt. 使对比；使与…对照vi. 对比；形成对照

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: evident
trans: adj. 明显的；明白的

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: clear
trans: n. 清除；空隙adj. 清楚的；清澈的；晴朗的；无罪的vt. 通过；清除；使干净；跳过vi. 放晴；变清澈adv. 清晰地；完全地

sentences.english: clear instructions
sentences.chinese: 明确的指示

sentences.english: The question wasn’t very clear.
sentences.chinese: 这问题不是很清楚。

sentences.english: It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
sentences.chinese: 我从没用过这么清晰易懂的指南。

sentences.english: Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (= express myself well ) .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我涉及的内容太多，没有表达清楚。

sentences.english: If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不明白，那就最好照直说并把事情弄清楚。

sentences.english: If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear (= used when you are angry ) ?
sentences.chinese: 如果再让我发现你抽烟，我就罚你不准出门。我的话你听清楚了吗？

sentences.english: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
sentences.chinese: 扫雪机已经出动，去清扫路面了。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

name: clarity
trans: n. 清楚，明晰；透明

sentences.english: Letters may be edited for length and clarity.
sentences.chinese: 信件可能要加以修改以求篇幅合适，意思明了。

sentences.english: a lack of clarity in the law on property rights
sentences.chinese: 产权法律含糊不清

detailed_translations.english: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

name: apparent
trans: adj. 显然的；表面上的

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: obvious
trans: adj. 明显的；显著的；平淡无奇的

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: strikingly
trans: adv. 显著地；突出地，引人注目地

sentences.english: one of the most strikingly attractive regions in Britain
sentences.chinese: 英国风景异常美丽的地区之一

detailed_translations.chinese: 醒目地, 引人侧目地
detailed_translations.english: in a way that is very easy to notice

name: justice
trans: n. 司法，法律制裁；正义；法官，审判员

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: justify
trans: vi. 证明合法；整理版面vt. 证明…是正当的；替…辩护

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: justification
trans: n. 理由；辩护；认为有理，认为正当；释罪

sentences.english: Hoggart felt, with some justification, that his colleagues had let him down.
sentences.chinese: 霍加特觉得同事令他失望，这是有理由的。

detailed_translations.english: a good and acceptable reason for doing something

name: jury
trans: n.  陪审团；评判委员会adj. 应急的

sentences.english: the members of the jury
sentences.chinese: 陪审团成员

sentences.english: The jury found him not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定他无罪。

sentences.english: the right to trial by jury
sentences.chinese: 由陪审团进行审理的权利

detailed_translations.english: a group of 12 ordinary people who listen to the details of a case in court and decide whether someone is guilty or not

name: juror
trans: n. 审查委员，陪审员

sentences.english: The foreman was asked by the clerk whether the jurors had reached verdicts on which they all agreed.
sentences.chinese: 书记员问陪审团主席是不是陪审员们已作出了全体一致的裁决。

detailed_translations.english: a member of a jury

name: jurisdiction
trans: n. 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力

sentences.chinese: 英国警方对外国银行的账户没有司法管辖权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力
detailed_translations.english: the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists

trans: n. 笔记；音符；票据；注解；纸币；便笺；照会；调子vt. 注意；记录；注解

sentences.chinese: 戴夫记下了她的地址和电话号码。

sentences.english: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
sentences.chinese: 我原来准备给凯茜写个便条，但又决定还是打电话给她。

sentences.english: The notes are at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 注解在书末。

detailed_translations.english: something that you write down to remind you of something

trans: adv. 显著地；尤其

sentences.chinese: 在过去五年中，移居国外的人明显增加。

sentences.english: Notably absent from his statement was any hint of an apology.

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is clearly different, important, or unusual

trans: n. 通知，布告；注意；公告vt. 通知；注意到；留心vi. 引起注意

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

name: present
trans: n. 现在；礼物；瞄准adj. 现在的；出席的vt. 提出；介绍；呈现；赠送vi. 举枪瞄准

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: presently
trans: adv. （美）目前；不久

sentences.chinese: 医生一会儿就到。

sentences.chinese: 一会儿我就睡着了。

sentences.english: The range of courses presently available has grown.
sentences.chinese: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。

detailed_translations.english: in a short time

trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: presentation
trans: n. 展示；描述，陈述；介绍；赠送

sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

name: absently
trans: 不管；不顾；不理会不论；无论；不注意;adv.心不在焉地

name: absence
trans: n.没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意

sentences.english: In the absence of any evidence, the police had to let Myers go.
sentences.chinese: 警察没有证据，只好把迈尔斯放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席， 不在； 缺席的时间， 外出期； 缺乏， 不存在

name: represent
trans: vt.代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送vi.代表；提出异议

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: representation
trans: n.代表；表现；表示法；陈述

sentences.english: The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 画上的时钟象征着光阴的流逝。

sentences.english: A group of students made representations to the college about the poor standard of the accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一群学生就恶劣的住宿条件同校方交涉。

sentences.english: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.
sentences.chinese: 少数族群需要办事更为高效的议会代表。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, sign, description etc that shows something

name: representative
trans: n.代表；典型；众议员adj.典型的，有代表性的；代议制的

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

name: embody
trans: vt.体现，使具体化；具体表达

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: embodiment
trans: n.体现；化身；具体化

name: behalf
trans: n.代表；利益

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: peer
trans: vt.封为贵族；与…同等vi.凝视，盯着看；窥视n.贵族；同等的人；同龄人

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: counterpart
trans: n.副本；配对物；极相似的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: single
trans: n.一个；单打；单程票adj.单一的；单身的；单程的vt.选出vi.击出一垒安打

sentences.english: A single tree gave shade from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 唯有一棵树遮阴。

sentences.english: They won the game by a single point.
sentences.chinese: 他们仅以一分的优势赢得比赛。

sentences.english: the highest price ever paid for a single work of art
sentences.chinese: 为单件艺术品所支付的最高价格

sentences.english: a single-sex school
sentences.chinese: 单一性别的学校

detailed_translations.english: only one
a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again

name: sole
trans: n.鞋底；脚底；基础；鳎目鱼adj.唯一的；单独的；仅有的vt.触底；上鞋底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: respectively
trans: adv.分别地；各自地，独自地

sentences.english: The cups and saucers cost £5 and £3 respectively.
sentences.chinese: 茶杯和茶碟的价钱分别为5英镑和3英镑。

detailed_translations.english: in the same order as the things you have just mentioned

name: figure
trans: n.数字；人物；图形；价格；（人的）体形；画像vt.计算；认为；描绘；象征vi.计算；出现；扮演角色

sentences.english: Reform now figures high on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，改革是当务之急。

detailed_translations.english: to be an important part of a process, event, or situation, or to be included in something

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；人物；算术；体型，风姿；轮廓；画像，塑像；图，图形
detailed_translations.english: the activity of adding, multiplying etc numbers

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算； 认为， 猜想
detailed_translations.english: to form a particular opinion after thinking about a situation

name: reckon
trans: vi.估计；计算；猜想，料想vt.测算，估计；认为；计算

sentences.english: ‘There’s nothing we can do about it.’ ‘You reckon (= used to express doubt or disagreement ) ?’
sentences.chinese: “这件事我们无能为力。”“是吗？”

detailed_translations.english: spoken to think or suppose something

name: calculate
trans: vt.计算；预测；认为；打算vi.计算；以为；作打算

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: speculate
trans: vi.推测；投机；思索vt.推断

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: appear
trans: vi.出现；显得；似乎；出庭；登场

sentences.english: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。

sentences.english: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。

sentences.english: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
sentences.chinese: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

sentences.english: Two faces appeared at our window.
sentences.chinese: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。

sentences.english: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

name: appearance
trans: n.外貌，外观；出现，露面

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: disappear
trans: vi.消失；失踪；不复存在vt.使…不存在；使…消失

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: disappearance
trans: n.消失；不见

sentences.english: Police are investigating the woman’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查这名女子的失踪。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something becomes impossible to see or find

name: emerge
trans: vi.浮现；摆脱；暴露

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: fade
trans: n.淡出；淡入adj.平淡的；乏味的vi.褪色；凋谢；逐渐消失vt.使褪色

sentences.english: the fading evening light
sentences.chinese: 渐暗的暮色

sentences.english: a pair of faded jeans
sentences.chinese: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤

sentences.english: The sun had faded the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

detailed_translations.english: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

name: vanish
trans: n.弱化音vi.消失；突然不见；成为零vt.使不见，使消失

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: promote
trans: vi.成为王后或其他大于卒的子vt.促进；提升；推销；发扬

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: promotion
trans: n.提升，晋升；推销，促销；促进；发扬，振兴

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: prompt
trans: n.提示；付款期限；DOS命令：改变DOS系统提示符的风格adj.敏捷的，迅速的；立刻的vt.提示；促进；激起；（给演员）提白adv.准时地

sentences.english: Prompt action must be taken.
sentences.chinese: 必须立即采取行动。

sentences.english: Prompt payment is requested.
sentences.chinese: 请立即付款。

sentences.english: a prompt response
sentences.chinese: 迅速的答复

sentences.english: What prompted you to buy that suit?
sentences.chinese: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

detailed_translations.english: done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
to make someone decide to do something

name: boost
trans: n.推动；帮助；宣扬vi.宣扬；偷窃vt.促进；增加；支援

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: spur
trans: n.鼓舞，刺激；马刺；山坡vt.激励，鞭策；给…装踢马刺vi.骑马疾驰；给予刺激

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: foster
trans: vt.培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）adj.收养的，养育的

sentences.english: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.chinese: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.english: The couple wanted to adopt a black child they had been fostering.
sentences.chinese: 那对夫妇想收养他们代养的一个黑人小孩。

detailed_translations.english: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time

name: extra
trans: n.临时演员；号外；额外的事物；上等产品adj.额外的，另外收费的；特大的adv.特别地，非常；另外

sentences.english: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
sentences.chinese: 你能多拿一条面包吗？

sentences.english: Allow extra time for your journey.
sentences.chinese: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
sentences.chinese: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.english: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

detailed_translations.english: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
used to emphasize an adjective or adverb

name: extraordinary
trans: adj.非凡的；特别的；离奇的；临时的；特派的

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: extraordinarily
trans: adv.非常；格外地；非凡地

sentences.english: We were extraordinarily lucky.
sentences.chinese: 我们极其幸运。

detailed_translations.english: extremely

name: extravagant
trans: adj.奢侈的；浪费的；过度的；放纵的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: luxury
trans: n.奢侈，奢华；奢侈品；享受adj.奢侈的

sentences.english: He was leading a life of luxury in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚过着豪华舒适的生活。

sentences.english: The dress is lambswool – pure luxury.
sentences.chinese: 礼服是用羔羊毛制作的——绝对奢华。

sentences.english: luxuries like chocolate and perfume
sentences.chinese: 巧克力、香水之类的奢侈品

detailed_translations.english: very great comfort and pleasure, such as you get from expensive food, beautiful houses, cars etc

name: vanity
trans: n.虚荣心；空虚；浮华；无价值的东西

sentences.english: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

name: image
trans: n.影像；想象；肖像；偶像vt.想象；反映；象征；作…的像

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

name: imagine
trans: vi.想像；猜想；想像起来vt.想像；猜想；臆断

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

name: imagination
trans: n.想象力；空想；幻想物

sentences.english: a storyteller with an incredible imagination
sentences.chinese: 想象力极丰富的讲故事者

sentences.english: It does not take much imagination to understand their grief.
sentences.chinese: 不难想象他们是多么悲伤。

sentences.english: With a little imagination, you can find great inexpensive gifts.
sentences.chinese: 稍微动点脑筋，你就会找到物美价廉的礼物。

sentences.english: These people do exist; they’re not figments of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这些人确实存在，他们不是我凭空想象出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

name: imaginative
trans: adj.富于想象的；有创造力的

sentences.english: an imaginative use of computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的妙用

sentences.english: children’s imaginative play
sentences.chinese: 儿童富有想象力的游戏

sentences.english: an imaginative solution to the litter problem
sentences.chinese: 解决乱扔垃圾的问题的有创意的方法

detailed_translations.english: containing new and interesting ideas

name: suppose
trans: conj.假使…结果会怎样vt.假设；认为；让（虚拟语气）；推想vi.猜想；料想

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: supposedly
trans: adv.可能；按照推测；恐怕

name: expose
trans: vt.揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: exposure
trans: n.暴露；曝光；揭露；陈列

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: impose
trans: vt.强加；征税；以…欺骗vi.利用；欺骗；施加影响

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

name: oppose
trans: vt.反对；对抗，抗争vi.反对

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: opposite
trans: adj.相反的；对面的；对立的n.对立面；反义词prep.在…的对面adv.在对面

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

detailed_translations.english: as different as possible from something else
a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

name: opposition
trans: n.反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: opponent
trans: n.对手；反对者；敌手adj.对立的；敌对的

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: pose
trans: vi.摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作vt.造成，形成；摆姿势；装模作样；提出…讨论n.姿势，姿态；装模作样

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: position
trans: n.位置，方位；职位，工作；姿态；站位vt.安置；把……放在适当位置

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

name: hypothesis
trans: n.假设

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: premise
trans: n.前提；上述各项；房屋连地基vt.引出，预先提出；作为…的前提vi.作出前提

sentences.english: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
sentences.chinese: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。

sentences.english: business premises
sentences.chinese: 企业经营场所

detailed_translations.chinese: 房屋和地基， 经营场址； 前提， 假设
detailed_translations.english: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

name: presumably
trans: adv.大概；推测起来；可假定

sentences.english: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大概， 可能， 据推测
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you think something is probably true

name: contrary
trans: n.相反；反面adj.相反的；对立的adv.相反地

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: force
trans: n.力量；武力；军队；魄力vt.促使，推动；强迫；强加

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: reinforce
trans: n.加强；加固物；加固材料vt.加强，加固；强化；补充vi.求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: enforce
trans: vt.实施，执行；强迫，强制

sentences.chinese: 等到调查结束后，结果会被送到联邦检察官办公室。

sentences.english: Francis, having concluded his business with James, left for Miami.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯完成了和詹姆斯的买卖后就去了迈阿密。

detailed_translations.english: to complete something you have been doing, especially for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 推断出，推论出；缔结，议定
detailed_translations.english: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: conclusion
trans: n.结论；结局；推论

sentences.english: These are the report’s main conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是这篇报告的主要结论。

sentences.english: It is still too early to reach a conclusion on this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上作出结论还为时过早。

sentences.english: There are perhaps two main conclusions to be drawn from the above discussion.
sentences.chinese: 从以上的讨论也许可以得出两个主要的结论。

sentences.english: All the evidence pointed to the conclusion that he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 所有证据都表明他是有罪的。

sentences.english: It’s important not to jump to conclusions.
sentences.chinese: 决不要贸然下结论。

sentences.english: The police came to the inescapable conclusion that the children had been murdered.
sentences.chinese: 警方得出了无法回避的结论: 这些儿童被谋杀了。

sentences.english: At the conclusion of the meeting, little progress had been made.
sentences.chinese: 会议开到最后，没有取得多少进展。

detailed_translations.english: something you decide after considering all the information you have

name: conclusive
trans: adj.决定性的；最后的；确实的；确定性的

sentences.english: Her attorneys claim there is no conclusive evidence that any murders took place.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师们声称没有任何发生过谋杀的确凿证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的； 最后的； 决定性的
detailed_translations.english: showing that something is definitely true

name: inconclusive
trans: adj.不确定的；非决定性的；无结果的

sentences.english: The evidence against the two men was inconclusive.
sentences.chinese: 针对这两个人的不利证据并不令人信服。

sentences.english: A coalition government was formed after inconclusive elections.
sentences.chinese: 选举没有结果，于是成立了一个联合政府。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不确定的；非决定性的；无结果的
detailed_translations.english: not leading to a clear decision or result

name: standard
trans: n.标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准adj.标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的

sentences.english: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须达到某一标准，否则无法通过。

sentences.english: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准
detailed_translations.english: the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的
detailed_translations.english: accepted as normal or usual

name: standardised
trans: vt.使…符合标准；使…标准化；使…统一

name: standardized
trans: adj.标准的；标准化的；定型的v.使合乎标准；按标准校准；制定标准（standardize的过去分词）

name: criterion
trans: n.（批评判断的）标准；准则；规范；准据

sentences.english: the criteria we use to select candidates
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选候选人的标准

detailed_translations.english: a standard that you use to judge something or make a decision about something

name: norm
trans: n.标准，规范

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: pattern
trans: n.模式；图案；样品vt.模仿；以图案装饰vi.形成图案

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: physical
trans: n.体格检查adj.物理的；身体的；物质的；根据自然规律的，符合自然法则的

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

name: physically
trans: adv.身体上，身体上地

sentences.english: She is young and physically fit.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻而且身体健康。

sentences.english: Do you find him physically attractive?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得他长得帅吗？

sentences.english: I felt physically sick at the thought.
sentences.chinese: 一想到那个我就觉得身体不舒服。

sentences.english: children who have been physically abused
sentences.chinese: 身体受到虐待的儿童

detailed_translations.english: in relation to your body rather than your mind or emotions

name: physics
trans: n.物理学；物理现象

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: metaphysical
trans: adj.形而上学的；超自然的；玄学派诗歌的

sentences.english: A lot of scientists don’t like discussing metaphysical matters.
sentences.chinese: 很多科学家不喜欢讨论形而上学的东西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形而上学的；超自然的；玄学派诗歌的
detailed_translations.english: concerned with the study of metaphysics

name: psychology
trans: n.心理学；心理状态

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

name: psychological
trans: adj.心理的；心理学的；精神上的

sentences.english: Sleep disorders are a serious psychological problem .
sentences.chinese: 睡眠障碍是严重的心理疾病。

sentences.english: Freud’s psychological theories
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德的心理学理论

sentences.english: What was the patient’s psychological state ?
sentences.chinese: 病人的心理状态如何？

detailed_translations.english: relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behaviour

name: psychologist
trans: n.心理学家，心理学者

sentences.english: a clinical psychologist
sentences.chinese: 临床心理学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained in psychology

name: psychiatrist
trans: n.精神病学家，精神病医生

sentences.english: He and his wife live in North Carolina, where he is a psychiatrist.
sentences.chinese: 他和妻子住在卡罗莱纳州北部，他是一名精神病医生。

sentences.english: Under the new law, then, you could visit a psychiatrist with the same frequency with which you visit your ENT and receive the same level of reimbursement in each case.
sentences.chinese: 然而根据新法，你可以看精神病医师的次数和看眼睛、鼻子和喉咙的次数一样多，而且每次看完之后可以享受同样的报销水平。

sentences.english: “The notion that behavior modification can bring about true happiness is as bogus as can be,” says psychiatrist Charles Goodstein, MD, of New York University.
sentences.chinese: 纽约大学医学博士、精神病学家查尔斯.古德斯坦说：“行为修正能够带来真正的快乐的观念是相当虚假的。”

detailed_translations.english: a doctor trained in the treatment of mental illness

name: mental
trans: adj.精神的；脑力的；疯的n.精神病患者

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。
