sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: agree
trans: vi.vi.同意，意见一致；约定，商定vt.同意，赞成；承认；约定，商定

sentences.english: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

name: agreement
trans: n.协议；同意，一致

sentences.english: They had made an agreement that they would share the profits equally.
sentences.chinese: 他们达成协议，平分利润。

sentences.english: Would their discussion result in his agreement to visit his stepmother?
sentences.chinese: 他们商量后，他会不会同意去看望继母？

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement or promise to do something, made by two or more people, companies, organizations etc

name: consent
trans: n.同意；（意见等的）一致；赞成vi.同意；赞成；答应

sentences.english: The chairman was elected by common consent (= with most people agreeing ) .
sentences.chinese: 主席是大家一致推选出来的。

sentences.english: divorce by mutual consent
sentences.chinese: 双方均同意的离婚

sentences.english: Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚事。

detailed_translations.english: agreement about something
to give your permission for something or agree to do something

name: consensus
trans: n.一致；舆论；合意

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: approve
trans: vi.批准；赞成；满意vt.批准；赞成；为…提供证据

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: approval
trans: n.批准；认可；赞成

sentences.english: The president has already given his approval to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 总统已经批准了这个计划。

sentences.english: It is just three months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.
sentences.chinese: 三个月前我们刚刚得到正式批准进行这个项目。

sentences.english: A company cannot be sold without the approval of the shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 没有股东的同意不能出售公司。

sentences.english: The bill will be submitted for approval by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案将提交国会通过。

sentences.english: The President would appoint the Council of Ministers, subject to the approval of the National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 总统将任命内阁成员，但需经国民议会批准。

sentences.english: The IMF has given its seal of approval to the government’s economic strategy.
sentences.chinese: 国际货币基金组织已经同意该政府的经济策略。

sentences.english: appointments requiring parliamentary approval
sentences.chinese: 需经议会批准的任命

sentences.english: She looked to Greg for approval.
sentences.chinese: 她指望格雷格同意。

detailed_translations.english: when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted

name: disapproval
trans: n.不赞成；不喜欢

sentences.english: His action had been greeted with almost universal disapproval.
sentences.chinese: 他的行动遭到了几乎一致的反对。

detailed_translations.english: If you feel or show disapproval of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not approve of them

name: continue
trans: vt.继续说…；使…继续；使…延长vi.继续，延续；仍旧，连续

sentences.english: He will be continuing his education in the US.
sentences.chinese: 他将在美国继续求学。

sentences.english: 英文例句: I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.english: 英文例句:The road continues northwards to the border.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 这条路往北一直延伸到边境。

detailed_translations.english: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something

name: discontinue
trans: vt.停止；使中止vi.停止，中断

sentences.english: Bus route 51 is being discontinued.
sentences.chinese: 51 路公共汽车目前停止运营。

sentences.english: a discontinued china pattern
sentences.chinese: 不再使用的瓷器图案

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing, producing, or providing something

name: continuous
trans: adj.连续的，持续的；继续的；连绵不断的

sentences.english: continuous economic growth
sentences.chinese: 持续的经济增长

sentences.english: a continuous flow of information
sentences.chinese: 源源不断的信息

detailed_translations.english: continuing to happen or exist without stopping

name: constant
trans: n.常数；恒量adj.不变的；恒定的；经常的

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: constantly
trans: adv.不断地；时常地

sentences.english: He talked constantly about his work.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地谈到他的工作。

sentences.english: The English language is constantly changing .
sentences.chinese: 英语在不断地变化。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, or very often

name: permanent
trans: n.烫发（等于permanentwave）adj.永久的，永恒的；不变的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: perpetuate
trans: vt.使不朽；保持adj.长存的

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

name: advance
trans: n.发展；前进；增长；预付款adj.预先的；先行的vt.提出；预付；使……前进；将……提前vi.前进；进展；上涨

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: advanced
trans: adj.先进的；高级的；晚期的；年老的v.前进；增加；上涨（advance的过去式和过去分词形式）

sentences.english: advanced learners of English
sentences.chinese: 高级程度的英语学习者

sentences.english: advanced physics
sentences.chinese: 高等物理（学）

detailed_translations.english: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level

name: progress
trans: n.进步，发展；前进vi.前进，进步；进行

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: progressive
trans: n.改革论者；进步分子adj.进步的；先进的

sentences.english: a progressive administration
sentences.chinese: 进步的政府

sentences.english: progressive and forward-looking policies
sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

sentences.english: The Republicans were deeply split between progressives and conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 共和党进步派和保守派之间分歧很大。

detailed_translations.english: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
A progressive is someone who is progressive

name: recession
trans: n.衰退；不景气；后退；凹处

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

name: bleak
trans: adj.阴冷的；荒凉的，无遮蔽的；黯淡的，无希望的；冷酷的；单调的

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

name: lack
trans: vt.缺乏；不足；没有；需要vi.缺乏；不足；没有n.缺乏；不足

sentences.english: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。

detailed_translations.english: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

name: shortage
trans: n.缺乏，缺少；不足

sentences.english: There is no heating available due to fuel shortages.
sentences.chinese: 因为燃料短缺，所以没有供暖。

sentences.english: There is no shortage of funds.
sentences.chinese: 不缺资金。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need

name: deficiency
trans: n.缺陷，缺点；缺乏；不足的数额

sentences.english: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
sentences.chinese: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of something that is necessary

name: dearth
trans: n.缺乏；饥馑；粮食不足

sentences.english: EXCEPT as Pearl, in the dearth of human playmates, was thrown more upon the visionary throng which she created.
sentences.chinese: 只不过是由于缺乏玩伴，她同自己创造出来的幻想中的人群更加接近而己。

sentences.english: So for now, this dearth of data means that scientists must rely on climate models to estimate the effects of large-scale burning by aborigines.
sentences.chinese: 所以现在数据的缺乏也就意味着科学家必须依靠气候模型来估计土著大规模焚烧对于气候的影响。

sentences.english: See there is no dearth of knowledge and entrepreneurial skills in we Indians. The only question is that shall we be considered while opting for technology from abroad?
sentences.chinese: 看到没有，我们印度人并不缺乏知识与创业技能。唯一的问题在于我们在追求外国技术的同时有没有考虑去挖掘自身的能力。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

name: local
trans: n.局部；当地居民；本地新闻adj.当地的；局部的；地方性的；乡土的

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

name: locate
trans: vt.位于；查找…的地点vi.定位；定居

sentences.english: The business is located right in the center of town.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店就在市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a particular position or place

name: site
trans: n.地点；位置；场所vt.设置；为…选址

sentences.english: an archaeological site
sentences.chinese: 考古现场

detailed_translations.english: a place where something important or interesting happened
to place or build something in a particular place

name: spot
trans: n.地点；斑点adj.现场的；现货买卖的vt.认出；弄脏；用灯光照射vi.沾上污渍；满是斑点adv.准确地；恰好

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

name: professor
trans: n.教授；教师；公开表示信仰的人

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: profession
trans: n.职业，专业；声明，宣布，表白

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

name: professional
trans: n.专业人员；职业运动员adj.专业的；职业的；职业性的

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: professionalise
trans: v.使专业化；使职业化

name: professionalize
trans: vt.使…专业化；使…专业化vi.专业化；职业化

name: professionalism
trans: n.专业主义；专家的地位；特性或方法

sentences.english: the dedication and professionalism of our staff
sentences.chinese: 我们员工的奉献精神和专业素质

detailed_translations.chinese: 职业水准或特性, 职业化
detailed_translations.english: the skill and high standards of behaviour expected of a professional person

name: amateur
trans: n.爱好者；业余爱好者；外行adj.业余的；外行的

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: expert
trans: n.专家；行家；能手adj.熟练的；内行的；老练的vt.当专家；在…中当行家

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: specialist
trans: n.专家；专门医师adj.专家的；专业的

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: quality
trans: n.质量，品质；特性；才能adj.优质的；高品质的；<英俚>棒极了

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: qualify
trans: vi.取得资格，有资格vt.限制；使具有资格；证明…合格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: qualified
trans: v.限制（qualify的过去分词）；描述；授权予adj.合格的；有资格的

sentences.english: You are one of us, and you are qualified to be a member of this Republic.
sentences.chinese: 你是我们中的一员，你有资格成为这个共和国中的一份子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制（qualify的过去分词）；描述；授权予

name: qualification
trans: n.资格；条件；限制；赋予资格

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: eligible
trans: n.合格者；适任者；有资格者adj.合格的，合适的；符合条件的；有资格当选的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: apply
trans: vi.申请；涂，敷；适用；请求vt.申请；涂，敷；应用

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: applicable
trans: adj.可适用的；可应用的；合适的

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: applicant
trans: n.申请人，申请者；请求者

sentences.english: We have had lots of applicants for these positions.
sentences.chinese: 对这些职位我们已有了很多申请人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

name: application
trans: n.应用；申请；应用程序；敷用

sentences.english: We receive hundreds of job applications each year.
sentences.chinese: 我们每年收到数百封求职信。

sentences.english: I filled in the application form and sent it off.
sentences.chinese: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。

sentences.english: You have to submit your application before the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 月底之前必须递交申请。

sentences.english: I’ve put in an application for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我已递交了调动申请。

sentences.english: He received a letter saying that his application had been rejected .
sentences.chinese: 他收到一封信，告知他的申请已被拒绝。

sentences.english: It can take a long time for your visa application to be processed .
sentences.chinese: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。

sentences.english: The Council is currently reviewing the way it deals with planning applications .
sentences.chinese: 市政会目前正在审查其处理规划申请的方式。

sentences.english: Thank you for your letter of application , which we received yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你的申请信昨天收悉，谢谢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 申请， 申请书； 施用， 涂抹； 应用， 实施； 实用性
detailed_translations.english: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

name: exert
trans: vt.运用，发挥；施以影响

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: utilise
trans: vt.使用（等于utilize）；利用

sentences.english: The one thing that never crosses the minds of our elite is to utilise local talent, local enterprise, local money to build Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 有一件事从来没有穿过我们精英的头脑，那就是利用本地人才，本地企业，本地资金来建设巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: Another benefit is that learning software can utilise all three learning techniques of hearing, seeing and doing which greatly reinforces acquisition.
sentences.chinese: 另一个好处是，学习软件可以利用看、听、做三种学习方式，加强学生对知识的理解和掌握。

name: utilize
trans: vt.利用

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: balance
trans: n.平衡；余额；匀称vt.使平衡；结算；使相称vi.保持平衡；相称；抵销

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

name: imbalance
trans: n.不平衡；不安定

sentences.english: a hormonal imbalance
sentences.chinese: 内分泌失调

detailed_translations.english: a lack of a fair or correct balance between two things, which results in problems or unfairness

name: counterbalance
trans: n.平衡力；自动抵销vt.使平衡；抵消

sentences.english: Riskier investments tend to be counterbalanced by high rewards.
sentences.chinese: 较高风险的投资往往报以高回报。

sentences.english: ...organizations set up as a counterbalance to groups allied to the ANC.
sentences.chinese: ...作为对与非洲人国民大会联盟团体制衡而成立的各种组织。

detailed_translations.english: to have an equal and opposite effect to something such as a change, feeling etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 平衡量， 平衡力； 势均力敌
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a counterbalance to something else counterbalances that thing

name: seek
trans: vt.寻求；寻找；探索；搜索vi.寻找；探索；搜索

sentences.english: new graduates seeking employment
sentences.chinese: 正在求职的刚毕业的大学生

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to seek alternative routes.
sentences.chinese: 驾车者被告知需另寻其他路线。

sentences.english: They quickly sought to distance themselves from the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 他们迅速设法远离抗议者。

detailed_translations.english: to look for someone or something

name: jobseeker
trans: n.求职者

name: search
trans: n.搜寻；探究，查究vt.搜索；搜寻；调查；搜查；探求vi.搜寻；调查；探求

sentences.english: It was too dark to search further.
sentences.chinese: 天太暗，无法继续寻找。

sentences.english: The area was thoroughly searched .
sentences.chinese: 这一地区已被彻底搜查过。

sentences.english: I’ve searched high and low (= everywhere ) for my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 我到处找我的眼镜。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find someone or something by looking very carefully
an attempt to find someone or something

name: hunt
trans: n.狩猎；搜寻vt.打猎；搜索vi.打猎；搜寻

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

name: detail
trans: n.细节，详情vt.详述；选派vi.画详图

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: elaborate
trans: adj.精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的vi.详细描述；变复杂vt.精心制作；详细阐述；从简单成分合成（复杂有机物）

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: concrete
trans: n.具体物；凝结物adj.混凝土的；实在的，具体的；有形的vt.使凝固；用混凝土修筑vi.凝结

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: simplify
trans: vt.简化；使单纯；使简易

sentences.english: an attempt to simplify the tax system
sentences.chinese: 简化税制的尝试

sentences.english: The law needs to be simplified.
sentences.chinese: 这部法律需要简化。

sentences.english: a simplified version of the game
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏的简化版

detailed_translations.english: to make something easier or less complicated

name: lengthy
trans: adj.漫长的，冗长的；啰唆的

sentences.english: A lengthy period of training is required.
sentences.chinese: 需要很长一段时间的培训。

sentences.english: An accident is causing some lengthy delays.
sentences.chinese: 一起事故造成长时间的延误。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long time, often too long

name: brief
trans: n.摘要，简报；概要，诉书adj.简短的，简洁的；短暂的，草率的vt.简报，摘要；作…的提要

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

name: roughly
trans: adv.粗糙地；概略地

sentences.english: There were roughly 200 people there.
sentences.chinese: 那儿大约有200人。

sentences.english: Azaleas flower at roughly the same time each year.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃花每年的开花时间大致相同。

detailed_translations.english: not exactly

name: moral
trans: adj.道德的；精神上的；品性端正的n.道德；寓意

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: ethical
trans: n.处方药adj.伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

name: ethics
trans: n.伦理学；伦理观；道德标准

sentences.english: Refugee workers said such action was a violation of medical ethics.
sentences.chinese: 难民工作者称这种行为违背了医学道德。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理学；伦理观；道德标准
detailed_translations.english: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong

name: virtue
trans: n.美德；优点；贞操；功效

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

name: necessary
trans: adj.必要的；必需的；必然的n.必需品

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

name: unnecessary
trans: adj.不必要的；多余的，无用的

sentences.english: There’s no point in taking unnecessary risks.
sentences.chinese: 冒不必要的风险没什么意义。

sentences.english: We can’t afford any unnecessary delays.
sentences.chinese: 我们经不起无谓的耽搁。

sentences.english: Williams was found guilty of causing unnecessary suffering to animals.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯因无故虐待动物被判有罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不必要的；多余的，无用的
detailed_translations.english: not needed, or more than is needed

name: necessarily
trans: adv.必要地；必定地，必然地

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

name: necessity
trans: n.需要；必然性；必需品

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: entail
trans: vt.使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含n.引起；需要；继承

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含
detailed_translations.english: to involve something as a necessary part or result

name: source
trans: n.来源；水源；原始资料

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: resource
trans: n.资源，财力；办法；智谋

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: outsource
trans: vt.把…外包vi.外包

sentences.english: ...companies that outsource IT functions.
sentences.chinese: …将信息技术方面的工作外包的公司。

sentences.english: The company began looking for ways to cut costs, which led to the decision to outsource.
sentences.chinese: 该公司开始寻找降低成本的途径，这使他们决定外包。

detailed_translations.english: If a company outsources work or things, it pays workers from outside the company and often outside the country to do the work or supply the things

name: current
trans: n.（水，气，电）流；趋势；涌流adj.现在的；流通的，通用的；最近的；草写的

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: currently
trans: adv.当前；一般地

sentences.english: the products that are currently available
sentences.chinese: 目前供应的产品

sentences.english: He is currently working on his first novel.
sentences.chinese: 他目前正在创作他的第一本小说。

detailed_translations.english: at the present time

name: currency
trans: n.货币；通货

sentences.english: The bank can supply you with foreign currency .
sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.english: There are moves towards a single currency in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲有向单一货币发展的趋势。

sentences.english: The local currency is the Swiss franc.
sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

detailed_translations.english: the system or type of money that a country uses

name: occur
trans: vi.发生；出现；存在

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: occurrence
trans: n.发生；出现；事件；发现

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

name: recur
trans: vi.复发；重现；采用；再来；循环；递归

sentences.english: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
sentences.chinese: 这种病有复发的危险。

sentences.english: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指不好的事)一再发生；重现
detailed_translations.english: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

name: incur
trans: vt.招致，引发；蒙受

sentences.english: And operational downtime caused by reliability or performance problems can incur opportunity costs if customers are unable to access your system or the business is unable to do its work.
sentences.chinese: 并且如果顾客不能访问你的系统或业务不能进行工作，那么由可靠性或性能问题引起的运作停工就会招致机会成本。

detailed_translations.english: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

name: up-to-date
trans: adj.最新的，最近的；现代的，新式的

sentences.english: ...the most up-to-date information available on foods today.
sentences.chinese: …今日有关食品的最新消息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直到最近的， 现代的； 跟上时代的
detailed_translations.english: modern or fashionable

name: depend
trans: vi.依赖，依靠；取决于；相信，信赖

sentences.english: He depended on his writing for his income.
sentences.chinese: 他靠写作谋生。

sentences.english: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

detailed_translations.english: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc

name: dependency
trans: n.属国；从属；从属物

name: dependent
trans: n.依赖他人者；受赡养者adj.依靠的；从属的；取决于…的

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: independence
trans: n.独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: independent
trans: n.独立自主者；无党派者adj.独立的；单独的；无党派的；不受约束的

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: rely
trans: vi.依靠；信赖

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: reliance
trans: n.信赖；信心；受信赖的人或物

sentences.english: the country’s heavy reliance on trade
sentences.chinese: 该国对贸易的严重依赖

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is dependent on someone or something else

name: reliable
trans: n.可靠的人adj.可靠的；可信赖的

sentences.english: a birth control method that is cheap and reliable
sentences.chinese: 既便宜又可靠的避孕方法

sentences.english: Miller was a quiet and reliable man.
sentences.chinese: 米勒是个话不多且可靠的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

name: lean
trans: vi.倾斜；倚靠；倾向；依赖adj.瘦的；贫乏的，歉收的vt.使倾斜n.瘦肉；倾斜；倾斜度

sentences.english: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.english: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

detailed_translations.english: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

name: negative
trans: adj.负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的n.否定；负数；底片vt.否定；拒绝

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: positive
trans: n.正数；正片adj.积极的；正的，阳性的；确定的，肯定的；实际的，真实的；绝对的

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: positively
trans: adv.肯定地；明确地；断然地；乐观地

sentences.english: Some holiday destinations are positively dangerous .
sentences.chinese: 有些度假地真的很危险。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is true, especially when this seems surprising

name: neutral
trans: adj.中立的，中性的；中立国的；非彩色的n.中立国；中立者；非彩色；齿轮的空档

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.english: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

sentences.english: the neutral language of an official news report
sentences.chinese: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

detailed_translations.english: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement

name: neutrality
trans: n.中立；中性；中立立场

sentences.english: Net neutrality, or not?
sentences.chinese: 网络中立或不?

sentences.english: Some of the nations declared neutrality.
sentences.chinese: 有的国家宣布中立。

sentences.english: Yet in our view, the notion of “search neutrality” threatens innovation, competition and, fundamentally,your ability as a user to improve how you find information.
sentences.chinese: 但在我们看来“搜索中立”这个概念威胁创新，竞争和本质上的，你作为一个用户去提高你寻找信息的能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of not supporting either side in an argument or war

name: official
trans: adj.官方的；正式的；公务的n.官员；公务员；高级职员

sentences.english: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
sentences.chinese: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查

sentences.english: the official policy on education
sentences.chinese: 官方的教育政策

sentences.english: official statistics about illegal drug use
sentences.chinese: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据

sentences.english: You will have to get official permission first.
sentences.chinese: 你必须先得到正式许可。

sentences.english: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
sentences.chinese: 任命书终于来了，这样一切都名正言顺了。

detailed_translations.english: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government

detailed_translations.chinese: 官员， 行政人员， 高级人员
detailed_translations.english: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization

name: executive
trans: n.总经理；执行委员会；执行者；经理主管人员adj.行政的；经营的；执行的，经营管理的

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: authority
trans: n.权威；权力；当局

sentences.english: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
sentences.chinese: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

sentences.english: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 只有总统才有权宣战。

sentences.english: I need to speak to someone in authority (= who has a position of power ) .
sentences.chinese: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: [plural] the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area

name: authorization
trans: n.授权，认可；批准，委任

sentences.english: You need special authorization to park here.
sentences.chinese: 在此停车要有特别的许可。

sentences.english: Children may not leave the building without the authorization of the principal.
sentences.chinese: 没有校长的许可，孩子们不能离开这幢楼。

detailed_translations.english: official permission to do something, or the document giving this permission

name: authoritative
trans: adj.有权威的；命令式的；当局的

sentences.english: the most authoritative work on English surnames
sentences.chinese: 有关英语姓氏的最权威著作

detailed_translations.english: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject

name: responsibility
trans: n.责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: responsible
trans: adj.负责的，可靠的；有责任的

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: respond
trans: n.应答；唱和vi.回答；作出反应；承担责任vt.以…回答

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: response
trans: n.响应；反应；回答

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: correspond
trans: vi.符合，一致；相应；通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: correspondence
trans: n.通信；一致；相当

sentences.english: The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志无法答复有关医学方面的来信。

sentences.english: All correspondence between us must cease.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间的所有通信必须停止。

detailed_translations.english: the process of sending and receiving letters

name: although
trans: conj.尽管；虽然；但是；然而

sentences.english: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.chinese: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.english: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.english: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely

name: unless
trans: conj.除非，如果不prep.除…之外

sentences.english: Unless some extra money is found, the theatre will close.
sentences.chinese: 要是不能找到更多资金，剧院将要关闭。

sentences.english: I think you should complain – unless, of course, you are happy with the way things are.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你应该发发牢骚——当然，除非你对现状很满意。

sentences.english: He won’t go to sleep unless you tell him a story.
sentences.chinese: 要是你不给他讲故事他就不睡觉。

sentences.english: I can’t leave her unless I know she’s all right.
sentences.chinese: 除非我知道她没事，否则我不能离开她。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something will happen or be true if something else does not happen or is not true

name: whereas
trans: conj.然而；鉴于；反之

sentences.english: The old system was fairly complicated whereas the new system is really very simple.
sentences.chinese: 旧系统相当复杂，而新系统却很简单。

sentences.english: Whereas the city spent over $1 billion on its museums and stadium, it failed to look after its schools.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市花了十亿美元建造博物馆和体育馆，但是却忽略了对学校的建设。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that although something is true of one thing, it is not true of another

name: despite
trans: prep.尽管，不管n.轻视；憎恨；侮辱

sentences.english: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校，当局还是决定把它关闭。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it

name: otherwise
trans: adv.否则；另外；在其他方面adj.另外的；其他方面的；原本，本来conj.其他；如果不；然后

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: nevertheless
trans: adv.然而，不过；虽然如此conj.然而，不过

sentences.english: What you said was true. It was, nevertheless, a little unkind.
sentences.chinese: 你说的都是实话，只不过有点刻薄。

sentences.english: Although the market has been flat, residential property costs remain high. Nevertheless, the fall-off in demand has had an impact on resale values.
sentences.chinese: 尽管市场一直疲软，房价持续偏高。然而需求的减少还是对二手房价格产生了影响。

detailed_translations.english: You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said.
in spite of a fact that you have just mentioned

name: nonetheless
trans: adv.尽管如此，但是

sentences.english: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区非常漂亮，然而杰拉德却无法想象自己要在那里度过余生。

sentences.english: The paintings are complex, but have plenty of appeal nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 这些画复杂难懂，不过还是不乏吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽管如此， 依然， 然而
detailed_translations.english: in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned

name: knowledge
trans: n.知识，学问；知道，认识；学科

sentences.english: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
sentences.chinese: 他对美国历史所知不多。

sentences.english: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。

detailed_translations.english: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience

name: knowledgeable
trans: adj.知识渊博的，有知识的；有见识的；聪明的

sentences.english: Do you think you are more knowledgeable about life than your parents were at your age?
sentences.chinese: 父母在你这个年龄时，你认为你比他们更了解生活吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 知识渊博的，有知识的；有见识的；聪明的
detailed_translations.english: knowing a lot

name: acknowledge
trans: vt.承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: unacknowledged
trans: adj.不被承认的，未公开承认的；未答复的

name: sure
trans: adj.确信的；可靠的；必定的adv.当然；的确

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

name: ensure
trans: vt.保证，确保；使安全

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: insurance
trans: n.保险；保险费；保险契约；赔偿金

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged

name: insure
trans: vt.确保，保证；给…保险vi.确保；投保

sentences.english: Have you insured the contents of your home?
sentences.chinese: 你给家庭财产投保了吗？

sentences.english: facilities to insure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to buy insurance so that you will receive money if something bad happens to you, your family, your possessions etc

name: assure
trans: vt.保证；担保；使确信；弄清楚

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: mass
trans: n.块，团；群众，民众；大量，众多；质量adj.群众的，民众的；大规模的，集中的vi.聚集起来，聚集vt.使集合

sentences.english: a mass protest
sentences.chinese: 大规模的抗议

sentences.english: weapons of mass destruction
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the problem of mass unemployment
sentences.chinese: 大批人失业的问题

detailed_translations.english: involving or intended for a very large number of people
to come together, or to make people or things come together, in a large group

detailed_translations.chinese: 众多，大量；团，块，堆；群众；质量
detailed_translations.english: a large crowd

name: massive
trans: adj.大量的；巨大的，厚重的；魁伟的

sentences.english: The bell is massive, weighing over 40 tons.
sentences.chinese: 那口钟非常大，有40多吨重。

sentences.english: the castle’s massive walls
sentences.chinese: 城堡高大厚实的围墙

detailed_translations.chinese: (尺寸、数量、规模) 非常大的
detailed_translations.english: very large in size, quantity, or extent

name: biomass
trans: n.（单位面积或体积内的）生物量

name: substantial
trans: n.本质；重要材料adj.大量的；实质的；内容充实的

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.english: The document requires substantial changes.
sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可观的， 大量的； 物质的， 坚固的； 实质的， 真实的
detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

name: substantially
trans: adv.实质上；大体上；充分地

sentences.english: There are one or two minor differences, but they’re substantially the same text.
sentences.chinese: 这些文本有一两处细微差异，但大体上是一样的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that in many ways something is true, the same, different etc

name: array
trans: n.数组，阵列；排列，列阵；大批，一系列；衣服vt.排列，部署；打扮

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: series
trans: n.系列，连续；串联；级数；丛书

sentences.english: the series of events that led to the outbreak of war
sentences.chinese: 导致战争爆发的一系列事件

sentences.english: The police are investigating a series of attacks in the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方在调查该地区发生的一连串袭击事件。

sentences.english: There’s been a whole series of accidents on this road.
sentences.chinese: 这条路上发生了一连串的交通事故。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一系列， 连续； 丛书， 连续剧
detailed_translations.english: several events or actions of a similar type that happen one after the other

name: nation
trans: n.国家；民族；国民

sentences.english: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
sentences.chinese: 总统对全国的广播讲话

sentences.english: an independent nation
sentences.chinese: 独立的国家

sentences.english: the world’s leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 世界上的主要工业国

sentences.english: the Cherokee nation
sentences.chinese: 切罗基族

detailed_translations.english: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

name: national
trans: adj.国家的；国民的；民族的；国立的n.国民

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

name: nationalization
trans: n.国有化；同化，归化

sentences.english: Many people agree with nationalization.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都赞成国有化。

sentences.english: Parliament will debate the nationalization issue next week.
sentences.chinese: 议会将在下周辩论国有化议题。

sentences.english: A commitment to nationalization was the banner of British socialism.
sentences.chinese: 致力于国有化是英国社会主义的旗号。

name: nationwide
trans: adj.全国范围的；全国性的adv.在全国

sentences.english: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
sentences.chinese: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻

sentences.english: nationwide television
sentences.chinese: 全国性的电视节目

sentences.english: The figures show unemployment falling nationwide last month.
sentences.chinese: 数字显示，上个月失业数字正全国性地下降。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in every part of the country
Nationwide is also an adverb

name: international
trans: n.国际组织；国际体育比赛；外国居留者；国际股票adj.国际的；两国（或以上）国家的；超越国界的；国际关系的；世界的

sentences.english: the response of the international community
sentences.chinese: 国际社会的反响

sentences.english: the UN and other international organizations
sentences.chinese: 联合国和其他国际组织

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving more than one nation

name: multinational
trans: adj.跨国公司的；多国的n.跨国公司

sentences.english: a multinational media corporation
sentences.chinese: 跨国传媒公司

detailed_translations.english: a multinational company has factories, offices, and business activities in many different countries
a large company that has offices, factories etc in many different countries

name: accept
trans: vi.承认；同意；承兑vt.接受；承认；承担；承兑；容纳

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

name: acceptance
trans: n.接纳；赞同；容忍

sentences.english: He wrote a letter of acceptance (=  a letter in which you agree to accept a job, university place etc  ) to the university.
sentences.chinese: 他给那所大学写了一封接受函。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接受， 承认； 容忍
detailed_translations.english: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

name: acceptable
trans: adj.可接受的；合意的；可忍受的

sentences.english: Students who achieve an acceptable standard will progress to degree studies.
sentences.chinese: 达到一定程度的学生可以进一步攻读学位。

sentences.english: How do we reach an acceptable level of data security?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何使数据安全达到令人满意的程度？

detailed_translations.english: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

name: able
trans: adj.能；有能力的；能干的

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想学会讲日语。

sentences.english: one of my more able students
sentences.chinese: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

detailed_translations.english: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something

name: enable
trans: vt.使能够，使成为可能；授予权利或方法

sentences.english: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.
sentences.chinese: 新的检验使医生能在早期发现该种疾病。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it

name: ability
trans: n.能力，能耐；才能

sentences.english: the ability to walk
sentences.chinese: 行走的能力

sentences.english: The test measures your mathematical ability.
sentences.chinese: 这种测试考查的是数学能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to do something

name: disability
trans: n.残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件

sentences.english: Facilities for people with disabilities are still insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 供残疾人使用的设施仍然不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残疾；无能；无资格；不利条件
detailed_translations.english: A disability is a permanent injury, illness, or physical or mental condition that tends to restrict the way that someone can live their life

name: capable
trans: adj.能干的，能胜任的；有才华的

sentences.english: I don’t think he’s capable of murder.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他没有能力杀人。

sentences.english: The company isn’t capable of handling an order that large.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司没有能力应付那么大的订单。

sentences.english: I’m perfectly capable of looking after myself, thank you!
sentences.chinese: 我完全能够自己照顾自己，多谢了！

detailed_translations.english: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

name: incapable
trans: adj.不能的；无能力的；不能胜任的

sentences.english: He seemed incapable of understanding how she felt.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎不能理解她的感受。

sentences.english: Seventy-five percent of the electorate believe his party is incapable of government.
sentences.chinese: 75%的选民都认为他领导的政党无能力执政。

detailed_translations.english: not able to do something

name: capacity
trans: n.能力；容量；资格，地位；生产力

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: achieve
trans: vt.取得；获得；实现；成功vi.达到预期的目的，实现预期的结果，如愿以偿

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

name: achievement
trans: n.成就；完成；达到；成绩

sentences.english: His great achievement is to make all the players into a united team.
sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

sentences.english: As we climbed the final few metres, we felt a sense of achievement.
sentences.chinese: 我们攀登最后几米的时候，有一种成就感。

detailed_translations.english: something important that you succeed in doing by your own efforts

name: accomplish
trans: vt.完成；实现；达到

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: accomplishment
trans: n.成就；完成；技艺，技能

sentences.english: It was a major accomplishment for a player who had been injured so recently.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个刚受过伤的选手来说，这是很好的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: something successful or impressive that is achieved after a lot of effort and hard work

name: fulfil
trans: vt.履行；完成；实践；满足

sentences.english: There is little doubt that the scheme fulfils a need for our community.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，这计划会满足我们社区的需求。

sentences.english: Visiting Disneyland has fulfilled a boyhood dream.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼乐园之游使童年梦想成真。

detailed_translations.english: to do or provide what is necessary or needed

name: fulfill
trans: vt.履行；实现；满足；使结束（等于fulfil）

sentences.english: And that is why we can fulfill our destiny.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们能实现我们的命运。

sentences.english: What important dream have you yet to realize and fulfill?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么重要的梦想还没有实现和完成？

name: fulfilment
trans: n.实现；成就

sentences.english: ...professional fulfilment.
sentences.chinese: …职业成就感。

detailed_translations.english: when something you wanted happens or is given to you

name: fulfillment
trans: n.履行；实行

sentences.english: So fulfillment of desires is a prerequisite to unity.
sentences.chinese: 所以实现愿望是到达统一的先决条件。 。

sentences.english: Ensure an effective operation planning and process to support the order fulfillment and delivery requirement.
sentences.chinese: 确保有效的运作计划和流程来支持订单的履行和交货要求。

sentences.english: Who, I thought, wants to know about the other's earlier relationships, if he or she is not the fulfillment of their promise?
sentences.chinese: 如果他或她不只履行他们的承诺的话，我认为，谁想去知道别人以前跟另一个异性的关系呢？

name: break
trans: vi.打破；折断；弄坏；削弱vt.（使）破；打破（纪录）；（常指好天气）突变；开始vi.（嗓音）突变；突破；破晓；（价格）突然下跌n.破裂；间断；（持续一段时间的状况的）改变；间歇

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

name: outbreak
trans: n.（战争的）爆发；（疾病的）发作vi.爆发

sentences.english: a cholera outbreak
sentences.chinese: 霍乱的爆发

detailed_translations.english: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen

name: breakthrough
trans: n.突破；突破性进展

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: groundbreaking
trans: n.动工adj.开创性的

name: check
trans: n.<美>支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对vi.核实，查核；中止；打勾；将一军vt.检查，核对；制止，抑制；在…上打勾

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: examine
trans: vt.检查；调查；检测；考试vi.检查；调查

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: inspect
trans: vt.检查；视察；检阅vi.进行检查；进行视察

sentences.english: I got out of the car to inspect the damage.
sentences.chinese: 我下车查看损坏情况。

sentences.english: Police inspected the scene and interviewed all the staff.
sentences.chinese: 警察仔细检查了现场并询问了所有员工。

sentences.english: General Allenby arrived to inspect the troops.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦比将军前来检阅部队。

detailed_translations.english: to examine something carefully in order to find out more about it or to find out what is wrong with it

name: inspection
trans: n.视察，检查

sentences.english: An inspection was carried out at the school.
sentences.chinese: 有人来学校视察了一遍。

sentences.english: However, on closer inspection, a number of problems emerged.
sentences.chinese: 然而，经进一步检查，很多问题冒了出来。

detailed_translations.english: an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

name: inspector
trans: n.检查员；巡视员

sentences.english: ticket inspectors
sentences.chinese: 查票员

sentences.english: a Health and Safety inspector
sentences.chinese: 健康安全督察员

sentences.english: Standards of discipline at the school were strongly criticized in the inspector’s report.
sentences.chinese: 督察员在报告里狠狠地批评了这所学校的纪律水准。

detailed_translations.english: an official whose job is to check that something is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

name: scrutinise
trans: vt.详细检查，细看(scrutinize)vi.作详细检查，细阅

name: scrutinize
trans: n.仔细或彻底检查vt.详细检查；细看vi.细阅；作详细检查

sentences.english: He scrutinized the document.
sentences.chinese: 他细阅了这份文件。

sentences.english: She scrutinized his face.
sentences.chinese: 她细细端详他的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to examine someone or something very carefully

name: scrutiny
trans: n.详细审查；监视；细看；选票复查

sentences.english: Their activities have come under police scrutiny .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动受到警方的严密监视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细检查， 仔细观察
detailed_translations.english: careful and thorough examination of someone or something

name: identify
trans: vt.确定；鉴定；识别，辨认出；使参与；把…看成一样vi.确定；认同；一致

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

name: identifiable
trans: adj.可辨认的；可认明的；可证明是同一的

sentences.english: In the corridor were four dirty, ragged bundles, just identifiable as human beings.
sentences.chinese: 走廊里有4堆脏兮兮、衣衫褴褛的东西，依稀可辨出人形。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可辨认的；可认明的；可证明是同一的
detailed_translations.english: able to be recognized

name: identity
trans: n.身份；同一性，一致；特性；恒等式

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

name: recognise
trans: vt.认出；承认，认可；识别

name: recognize
trans: vt.认出，识别；承认vi.确认，承认；具结

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

name: recognition
trans: n.识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认

sentences.english: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.chinese: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

detailed_translations.english: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past

name: department
trans: n.部；部门；系；科；局

sentences.english: the personnel department
sentences.chinese: 人事部

sentences.english: the English department
sentences.chinese: 英语系

detailed_translations.english: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

name: bureau
trans: n.局，处；衣柜；办公桌

sentences.english: an employment bureau
sentences.chinese: 职业介绍所

sentences.english: the Citizens Advice Bureau
sentences.chinese: 公民咨询局

detailed_translations.english: an office or organization that collects or provides information

name: bureaucratic
trans: adj.官僚的；官僚政治的

sentences.english: Bureaucratic delays are inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 官僚主义所致的延误是不可避免的。

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of complicated official rules and processes

name: investment
trans: n.投资；投入；封锁

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

name: invest
trans: vi.投资，入股；花钱买vt.投资；覆盖；耗费；授予；包围

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

name: investor
trans: n.投资者

sentences.english: The main investor in the project is the French bank Credit National.
sentences.chinese: 该项目的主要投资方是法国国民信贷银行。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives money to a company, business, or bank in order to get a profit

name: relate
trans: vt.叙述；使…有联系vi.涉及；认同；符合；与…有某种联系

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: correlate
trans: n.相关物；相关联的人vt.使有相互关系；互相有关系adj.关联的vi.关联

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: correlation
trans: n.相关，关联；相互关系

sentences.english: ...the correlation between smoking and disease.
sentences.chinese: …吸烟和疾病之间的关联。

detailed_translations.english: a connection between two ideas, facts etc, especially when one may be the cause of the other

name: related
trans: v.叙述（relate过去式）adj.有关系的，有关联的；讲述的，叙述的

name: unrelated
trans: adj.无关的，不相干的

name: relation
trans: n.关系；叙述；故事；亲属关系

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: relationship
trans: n.关系；关联

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: relative
trans: n.亲戚；相关物；关系词；亲缘植物adj.相对的；有关系的；成比例的

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: relatively
trans: adv.相当地；相对地，比较地

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: relevant
trans: adj.相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

name: available
trans: adj.可获得的；可购得的；可找到的；有空的

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: availability
trans: n.可用性；有效性；实用性

sentences.english: the availability of cheap flights
sentences.chinese: 有廉价机票出售

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being at hand when needed

name: access
trans: n.进入；使用权；通路vt.使用；存取；接近

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: accessible
trans: adj.易接近的；可进入的；可理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: feature
trans: n.特色，特征；容貌；特写或专题节目vt.特写；以…为特色；由…主演vi.起重要作用

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: character
trans: n.性格，品质；特性；角色；字符vt.印，刻；使具有特征

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: characterise
trans: vt.是…的特征;以…为特征;描述（人或物）的特性;描绘

detailed_translations.chinese: 刻划……的性格；表示……的特性

name: characterize
trans: vt.描绘…的特性；具有…的特征vi.塑造人物

sentences.english: Bright colours characterize his paintings.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的色彩是他绘画作品的特点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征
detailed_translations.english: to describe the qualities of someone or something in a particular way

name: characteristic
trans: n.特征；特性；特色adj.典型的；特有的；表示特性的

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

name: typical
trans: adj.典型的；特有的；象征性的

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: reveal
trans: n.揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧vt.显示；透露；揭露；泄露

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: revelation
trans: n.启示；揭露；出乎意料的事；被揭露的真相

sentences.english: ...following the revelation of his affair with a former secretary.
sentences.chinese: …在他和前任秘书的风流韵事被揭露之后。

detailed_translations.english: a surprising fact about someone or something that was previously secret and is now made known

name: conceal
trans: vt.隐藏；隐瞒

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: disclose
trans: vt.公开；揭露

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: immigrant
trans: n.移民，侨民adj.移民的；迁入的

sentences.english: an illegal immigrant
sentences.chinese: 非法移民

sentences.english: a new wave of immigrants from the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 来自中东的一股新兴的移民浪潮

detailed_translations.english: someone who enters another country to live there permanently

name: immigration
trans: n.外来移民；移居

sentences.english: He called for a common European policy on immigration.
sentences.chinese: 他要求欧洲国家实施共同的移民政策。

detailed_translations.english: the process of entering another country in order to live there permanently

name: immigrate
trans: vi.移入vt.使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: migration
trans: n.迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: migrate
trans: vi.移动；随季节而移居；移往vt.使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
