sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: emigrate
trans: vi.移居；移居外国vt.移民

sentences.english: He emigrated to Belgium.
sentences.chinese: 他移民去了比利时。

detailed_translations.english: to leave your own country in order to live in another country

name: institution
trans: n.制度；建立；（社会或宗教等）公共机构；习俗

sentences.english: powerful institutions such as world banks
sentences.chinese: 诸如世界银行之类的强大机构

sentences.english: the Institution of Electrical Engineers
sentences.chinese: 电机工程师学会

detailed_translations.english: a large organization that has a particular kind of work or purpose

name: institutional
trans: adj.制度的；制度上的学会的；由来已久的；习以为常的公共机构的；慈善机构的

sentences.english: accusations of institutional racism in the police force
sentences.chinese: 对警察队伍中已形成风气的种族主义的谴责

detailed_translations.english: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad

name: institute
trans: n.学会，协会；学院vt.开始（调查）；制定；创立；提起（诉讼）

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: establish
trans: vi.植物定植vt.建立；创办；安置

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: establishment
trans: n.确立，制定；公司；设施

sentences.english: the establishment of NATO in 1949
sentences.chinese: 1949年北约组织的建立

detailed_translations.english: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

name: organise
trans: vi.组织起来；组织工会vt.组织（等于organize）；有机化；给予生机

sentences.english: Do they organise words around a principle of syntax?
sentences.chinese: 他们会按照一定的句法规则组织单词吗？

sentences.english: And where it is needed—to organise investment in infrastructure, for instance, and to regulate markets—it needs to become more open in its dealings.
sentences.chinese: 而在那些需要政府去组织投资、监管市场的方面（比如说基础设施部门），在管理过程中需要变得更为开放。

sentences.english: The team then started to organise a set of clinical trials of personalised treatments for lung and breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: 于是研究小组开始着手组织一套针对肺癌和乳腺癌病人的个人化治疗临床试验。

name: organize
trans: vt.组织；使有系统化；给予生机；组织成立工会等vi.组织起来；成立组织

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

name: organisation
trans: n.组织；团体（等于organization）

sentences.english: Please describe the goals your organisation is hoping to achieve through this partnership as well as any recognition you hope to receive for your partnership with the UN.
sentences.chinese: 请描述您的组织希望通过这个合作关系实现的目标，以及您希望从与联合国的合作关系得到的任何认可。

name: organization
trans: n.组织；机构；体制；团体

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

name: conduct
trans: n.进行；行为；实施vi.导电；带领vt.管理；引导；表现

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: conductor
trans: n.导体；售票员；领导者；管理人

sentences.english: He showed his ticket to the conductor and got on.
sentences.chinese: 他向检票员出示了车票，然后上了车。

sentences.english: The conductor's eyes darted to Wilfred, then fixed on Michael again.
sentences.chinese: 乐队指挥飞快地扫了威尔弗雷德一眼，然后视线又落回到迈克尔身上。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to collect payments from passengers on a bus

name: behave
trans: vi.表现；（机器等）运转；举止端正；（事物）起某种作用vt.使守规矩；使表现得…

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: behavior
trans: n.行为，举止；态度；反应

detailed_translations.chinese: 行为， 举止， 表现

name: behaviour
trans: n.行为；习性；运行状况（=behavior）

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

name: behavioral
trans: adj.行为的

sentences.english: It helps point out some of the behavioral barriers you have in making better food choices.
sentences.chinese: 而且当你在选择更好的食物的时候它也可以帮助你指出一些行为障碍。

sentences.english: Both my mother and grandmother were diagnosed with depression. I saw more behavioral symptoms in them, but I knew they were taking medication and they seemed to have it under control.
sentences.chinese: 我的母亲和曾祖母都曾被诊断为抑郁症，在她们身上我见得更多的是行为的异常，但我知道她们也用药并且症状控制得似乎不错。

sentences.english: From behavioral quirks to brain cancer, researchers have looked for any health risks associated with cellphone radiation for years.
sentences.chinese: 从行为怪癖到脑癌，数年来研究人员一直在寻找与手机辐射有关的健康风险。

name: behavioural
trans: adj.行为的；动作的

name: implement
trans: n.工具，器具；手段vt.实施，执行；实现，使生效

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: contribute
trans: vt.贡献，出力；投稿；捐献vi.贡献，出力；投稿；捐献

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: contribution
trans: n.贡献；捐献；投稿

sentences.english: All the money has been raised by voluntary contribution.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些钱都是靠自愿捐献筹集的。

detailed_translations.english: something that you give or do in order to help something be successful

name: attribute
trans: n.属性；特质vt.归属；把…归于

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: distribute
trans: vt.分配；散布；分开；把…分类

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: distribution
trans: n.分布；分配

sentences.english: a distribution centre
sentences.chinese: 经销中心

detailed_translations.english: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: redistribution
trans: n.重新分配

sentences.english: Sports motions can cause the redistribution of viscera blood flow.
sentences.chinese: 运动可引起内脏血流的重新分配。

sentences.english: It does have to do with class warfare — redistribution from the poor and the middle class to the wealthy is a consistent theme of all modern Republican policies.
sentences.chinese: 它的确跟阶级斗争有关——在穷人、中产阶级和富人之间重新分配财富一直是共和党所有现代政策的一个主题。

detailed_translations.english: the act of redistributing something, especially money or land

name: designate
trans: vt.指定；指派；标出；把…定名为adj.指定的；选定的

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: allocate
trans: vt.分配；拨出；使坐落于vi.分配；指定

sentences.english: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.
sentences.chinese: 票数有限，将分配给那些先申请的人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分配； 分派， 把…拨给
detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose, give something to a particular person etc, especially after an official decision has been made

name: allocation
trans: n.分配，配置；安置

sentences.english: Twelve hours a week seemed a generous allocation of your time.
sentences.chinese: 一周12个小时，这好像占用了你很多时间。

detailed_translations.english: the decision to allocate something, or the act of allocating it

name: devote
trans: vt.致力于；奉献

sentences.english: He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.
sentences.chinese: 他决定把余生奉献给科学研究。

detailed_translations.english: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

name: dedicate
trans: vt.致力；献身；题献

sentences.english: The actress now dedicates herself to children’s charity work.
sentences.chinese: 这名女演员现在致力于儿童慈善工作。

detailed_translations.english: to give all your attention and effort to one particular thing

name: exist
trans: vi.存在；生存；生活；继续存在

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: existence
trans: n.存在，实在；生存，生活；存在物，实在物

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

name: existential
trans: adj.存在主义的；有关存在的；存在判断的

sentences.english: Existential questions requiring religious answers still persist.
sentences.chinese: 需要宗教解答的生命问题持续存在着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 存在主义的；有关存在的；存在判断的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the existence of humans or to existentialism

name: gene
trans: n.基因，遗传因子

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: genetic
trans: adj.遗传的；基因的；起源的

sentences.english: genetic defects
sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

detailed_translations.english: relating to genes or genetics

name: genetically
trans: adv.从遗传学角度；从基因方面

sentences.english: You really cannot tell by looking at them that they are so different genetically.
sentences.chinese: 你真的不能通过观察他们得出他们的基因是如此不同的结论。

sentences.english: The initial quality, or type, of your skin is genetically determined – meaning that you are born with it.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤起初的肤质，类型都是基因决定的，这意味着你出生时就是这样的皮肤。

name: genetics
trans: n.遗传学

sentences.english: Genetics is also bringing about dramatic changes in our understanding of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学也正使我们对癌症的理解发生巨大的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the study of how the qualities of living things are passed on in their genes

name: genome
trans: n.基因组；染色体组

sentences.english: the human genome
sentences.chinese: 人类基因组

detailed_translations.english: all the  genes  in one type of living thing

name: lineage
trans: n.血统；家系，世系

sentences.english: a family of ancient lineage
sentences.chinese: 古老世家

detailed_translations.english: the way in which members of a family are descended from other members

name: paternal
trans: adj.父亲的；得自父亲的；父亲般的

name: paternity
trans: n.父权；父系；父系后裔

sentences.english: The paternity of the child is in dispute.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子的生父是谁尚有疑问。

name: supreme
trans: n.至高；霸权adj.最高的；至高的；最重要的

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

name: superb
trans: adj.极好的；华丽的；宏伟的

sentences.english: The food was superb.
sentences.chinese: 食物好吃极了。

sentences.english: superb weather
sentences.chinese: 极好的天气

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: superfluous
trans: adj.多余的；不必要的；奢侈的

sentences.english: a modern building with no superfluous decoration
sentences.chinese: 一栋没有多余装饰的现代建筑

detailed_translations.chinese: 多余的；不必要的；奢侈的
detailed_translations.english: more than is needed or wanted

name: maintain
trans: vt.维持；继续；维修；主张；供养

sentences.english: Careers Officers maintain contact with young people when they have left school.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人离开学校以后，职业指导员和他们保持联系。

sentences.english: Britain wants to maintain its position as a world power.
sentences.chinese: 英国想保持其世界强国的地位。

sentences.english: A lot depends on building and maintaining a good relationship with your customers.
sentences.chinese: 和顾客建立并保持良好关系很重要，很多事情要取决于此。

sentences.english: The hotel prides itself on maintaining high standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店以保持高标准而自豪。

sentences.english: How can we maintain control of spending?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何保持对开支的控制？

sentences.english: Critics maintain that these reforms will lead to a decline in educational standards.
sentences.chinese: 批评者坚称这些改革会导致教育标准下降。

detailed_translations.english: to make something continue in the same way or at the same standard as before

name: maintenance
trans: n.维护，维修；保持；生活费用

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

name: sustain
trans: vt.维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: sustainability
trans: n.持续性；永续性；能维持性

sentences.english: It’s not fair to my marriage, my ongoing success, and the sustainability of how I live.
sentences.chinese: 这对于我的婚姻、持续性的成功和我可持续性的生活来说都是不公平的。

name: sustainable
trans: adj.可以忍受的；足可支撑的；养得起的；可持续的

sentences.english: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。

sentences.english: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
sentences.chinese: 雨林资源的可持续利用

sentences.english: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。

sentences.english: environmentally sustainable development
sentences.chinese: 生态环境的可持续发展

detailed_translations.english: able to continue without causing damage to the environment

name: sustainably
trans: adv.支撑得住；能保持住地

name: ignore
trans: vt.驳回诉讼；忽视；不理睬

sentences.english: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.chinese: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。

sentences.english: Sam rudely ignored the question.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

detailed_translations.english: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something

name: ignorant
trans: adj.无知的；愚昧的

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: neglect
trans: vt.疏忽，忽视；忽略n.疏忽，忽视；怠慢

sentences.english: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
sentences.chinese: 她抽烟喝酒，既不照顾孩子，也不缝补衣服。

sentences.english: a neglected garden
sentences.chinese: 疏于打理的花园

sentences.english: The building has been badly neglected.
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

detailed_translations.english: to fail to look after someone or something properly

name: overlook
trans: vt.忽略；俯瞰；远眺；检查；高耸于…之上n.忽视；眺望

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: popular
trans: adj.流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: popularity
trans: n.普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

name: popularise
trans: vt.使受欢迎;普及;使通俗化;使易懂

detailed_translations.chinese: 推广，普及；使…通俗化（等于popularize）；使…受欢迎

name: popularize
trans: vt.普及；使通俗化vi.通俗化

sentences.english: Skinner was the psychologist who popularized behavior modification.
sentences.chinese: 斯金纳就是那位使行为矫正概念得到普及的心理学家。

detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult subject or idea able to be easily understood by ordinary people who have no special knowledge about it

name: prevailing
trans: adj.流行的；一般的，最普通的；占优势的；盛行很广的v.盛行，流行（prevail的现在分词形式）；获胜

sentences.english: The prevailing mood of public opinion remained hostile.
sentences.chinese: 公众仍普遍持敌对情绪。

sentences.english: the prevailing economic conditions in Northern Ireland
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰普遍的经济状况

detailed_translations.english: existing or accepted in a particular place or at a particular time

name: prevalent
trans: adj.流行的；普遍的，广传的

sentences.english: the prevalent belief in astrology
sentences.chinese: 对占星术的普遍相信

detailed_translations.english: common at a particular time, in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

name: function
trans: n.功能；函数；职责；盛大的集会vi.运行；活动；行使职责

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: functional
trans: adj.功能的

sentences.english: The two departments have slight functional differences.
sentences.chinese: 这两个部门功能稍有不同。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the purpose of something

name: manufacture
trans: n.制造；产品；制造业vt.制造；加工；捏造vi.制造

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: manufacturer
trans: n.制造商；厂商

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer’s instructions before using your new dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 使用新洗碗机之前，请先阅读厂家的说明书。

sentences.english: The fridge was sent back to the manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 那台冰箱被退还给厂家了。

detailed_translations.english: a company that makes large quantities of goods

name: manufacturing
trans: adj.制造的；制造业的n.制造业；工业v.制造；生产（manufacture的ing形式）

sentences.english: Thousands of jobs had been lost in manufacturing.
sentences.chinese: 制造行业已有数以千计的人失业。

sentences.english: the manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 制造业

sentences.english: They manufacture the class of plastics known as thermoplastic materials.
sentences.chinese: 他们生产被称为热塑材料的塑料类制品。

sentences.english: The first three models are being manufactured at the factory in Dayton.
sentences.chinese: 最初的3个型号正在代顿的工厂生产。

detailed_translations.english: the process or business of producing goods in factories
To manufacture something means to make it in a factory, usually in large quantities

name: forge
trans: n.熔炉，锻铁炉；铁工厂vt.伪造；锻造；前进vi.伪造；做锻工；前进

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: reality
trans: n.现实；实际；真实

sentences.english: the distinction between fantasy and reality
sentences.chinese: 幻想和现实之间的区别

sentences.english: TV is used as an escape from reality .
sentences.chinese: 电视成了逃避现实的一种方式。

sentences.english: I think the government has lost touch with reality (= no longer understands what is real or true ) .
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府已经脱离了现实。

sentences.english: political realities
sentences.chinese: 政治现实

sentences.english: The paperless office may one day become a reality .
sentences.chinese: 无纸化办公室有一天可能会成为现实。

detailed_translations.english: what actually happens or is true, not what is imagined or thought

name: realise
trans: vt.实现,认识到, 体会到,了解,认清,使显得逼真,变卖财产为现钱

sentences.english: In the first half they realise their boss is exploiting them and begin to understand the theory of surplus value.
sentences.chinese: 在前半部，工人们认识到他们的老板是在剥削他们，开始了解剩余价值理论。

sentences.english: I hope that as time goes on we will realise that it is important for us to talk openly about Aids, because it is the only way to make it appear normal, like cancer.
sentences.chinese: 我希望随着时间的推移，人们将认识到公开谈论艾滋病是一件重要的事情，因为这是唯一一条使它成为像癌症一样的正常疾病的途径。

name: realize
trans: vt.实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得，把(证券等)变成现钱；变卖

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

name: realistic
trans: adj.现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: stick
trans: n.棍；手杖；呆头呆脑的人vi.坚持；伸出；粘住vt.刺，戳；伸出；粘贴

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: stickiness
trans: n.粘性；胶粘

name: attach
trans: vi.附加；附属；伴随vt.使依附；贴上；系上；使依恋

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: attachment
trans: n.附件；依恋；连接物；扣押财产

sentences.english: a child’s attachment to its mother
sentences.chinese: 孩子对母亲的依恋

sentences.english: The vacuum cleaner has various attachments.
sentences.chinese: 这台真空吸尘器有各种附件。

sentences.english: the attachments that secure your boots firmly to the skis
sentences.chinese: 把靴子牢牢固定在滑雪板上的扣件

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you like or love someone or something and that you would be unhappy without them

name: bond
trans: n.债券；结合；约定；粘合剂；纽带vt.使结合；以…作保vi.结合，团结在一起

sentences.english: My father put all his money into stock market bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把他所有的钱都投在上市债券上。

sentences.english: furious trading on the bond market
sentences.chinese: 债券市场疯狂的交易

sentences.english: the emotional bond between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的感情纽带

detailed_translations.english: an official document promising that a government or company will pay back money that it has borrowed, often with interest

name: conjunction
trans: n.结合；连接词；同时发生

sentences.english: The conjunction of low inflation and low unemployment came as a very pleasant surprise.
sentences.chinese: 低通货膨胀与低失业的同时出现是一大惊喜。

sentences.english: The two clauses are joined by a conjunction.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分句由一个连词连在一起.

detailed_translations.english: a combination of events, etc., that causes a particular result

name: cling
trans: vi.坚持，墨守；紧贴；附着

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: adhere
trans: vi.坚持；依附；粘着；追随vt.使粘附

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

name: medical
trans: adj.医学的；药的；内科的n.医生；体格检查

sentences.english: medical research
sentences.chinese: 医学研究

sentences.english: medical staff
sentences.chinese: 医务人员

sentences.english: a medical student
sentences.chinese: 医科学生

sentences.english: a patient’s medical history
sentences.chinese: 患者的病史

sentences.english: medical or surgical treatment
sentences.chinese: 内科或外科疗法

detailed_translations.english: relating to medicine and the treatment of disease or injury

name: hygiene
trans: n.卫生；卫生学；保健法

sentences.english: the importance of personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 个人卫生的重要性

sentences.english: a food hygiene training course
sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

name: infection
trans: n.感染；传染；影响；传染病

sentences.english: The baby had an ear infection.
sentences.chinese: 宝宝耳朵感染了。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that affects a particular part of your body and is caused by bacteria or a virus

name: pandemic
trans: adj.（疾病等）（全国、全球i）流行的；普遍的n.流行性疾病

sentences.english: As announced earlier this month, the world is at the start of the 2009 influenza pandemic.
sentences.chinese: 正如我们在本月初宣布的那样，世界已进入2009年流感大流行初期。

sentences.english: WHO will be able to revise its estimate of pandemic vaccine supply once it has the new yield information.
sentences.chinese: 一旦有新的产量信息，世卫组织将能够修订其对大流行性流感疫苗供应的估算。

sentences.english: These recommendations are prudent measures which can limit the spread of many communicable diseases and not only the pandemic (H1N1) 2009 virus.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议均为审慎措施，可以限制许多传染病，不仅仅是2009年H1N1流感大流行病毒的传播。

name: respect
trans: n.尊敬，尊重；方面；敬意vt.尊敬，尊重；遵守

sentences.english: The boys showed a complete lack of respect for authority.
sentences.chinese: 这些男孩子根本无视权威。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of admiring someone or what they do, especially because of their personal qualities, knowledge, or skills
to admire someone because they have high standards and good qualities such as fairness and honesty

name: respectable
trans: n.可敬的人adj.值得尊敬的；人格高尚的；相当数量的

sentences.english: hard-working, respectable people
sentences.chinese: 勤勉可敬的人

sentences.english: a respectable family
sentences.chinese: 正经人家

sentences.english: Put a tie on - it’ll make you look more respectable.
sentences.chinese: 戴上领带，这样显得更体面。

detailed_translations.english: considered by society to be acceptable, good or correct

name: disrespect
trans: n.无礼，失礼，不敬

sentences.english: Damien has always had a healthy disrespect (= that you think is good ) for media opinion.
sentences.chinese: 达米安对媒体的观点从来都持合理的不以为然的态度。

sentences.english: It was said on the spur of the moment and I meant no disrespect to anybody.
sentences.chinese: 我一时冲口而出，无意冒犯任何人。

sentences.english: No disrespect to Phil, but the team has performed better since he left (= used to show you are not criticizing someone ) .
sentences.chinese: 我无意对菲尔不敬，不过自从他离开后球队表现更好了。

detailed_translations.english: lack of respect for someone or something

name: dignity
trans: n.尊严；高贵

sentences.english: We do this because we believe in the dignity and value of every person.
sentences.chinese: 我们这样做是因为我们相信每个人的尊严和价值。

sentences.english: They have to be treated well, with dignity.
sentences.chinese: 必须善待申请人，让人有尊严。

sentences.english: This award must be shared with everyone who strives for justice and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 我一定要与所有为正义和尊严奋斗的人分享此奖。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

name: esteem
trans: n.尊重；尊敬vt.尊敬；认为；考虑；估价

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: mock
trans: n.英国模拟考试（mocks）vt.愚弄，嘲弄adj.仿制的，模拟的，虚假的，不诚实的vt.不尊重，蔑视

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: academic
trans: n.大学生，大学教师；学者adj.学术的；理论的；学院的

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

name: academically
trans: adv.学术上；学业上

sentences.english: Challenge yourself academically, but give yourself plenty of time for fun as well.
sentences.chinese: 学业上要努力，但也要给自己充足的娱乐时间。

sentences.english: "Research in the UK shows those born at the start of the school year also do better academically and have more confidence," he said.
sentences.chinese: 班纳还说道：“英国的研究人员还发现，在学校学年开始时出生的人，会在学术上表现得较好，而且他们也更有自信。”

name: academy
trans: n.学院；研究院；学会；专科院校

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

name: intellectual
trans: n.知识分子；凭理智做事者adj.智力的；聪明的；理智的

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: intellect
trans: n.智力，理解力；知识分子；思维逻辑领悟力；智力高的人

sentences.english: He combined a formidable intellect with a talent for speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他不但智力超群，而且口才出众。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand things and to think intelligently

name: scholar
trans: n.学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

name: scholarly
trans: adj.博学的；学者风度的；学者派头的

sentences.english: a scholarly journal
sentences.chinese: 学术期刊

detailed_translations.chinese: 博学的；学者风度的；学者派头的
detailed_translations.english: relating to serious study of a particular subject

name: asset
trans: n.资产；优点；有用的东西；有利条件；财产；有价值的人或物

sentences.english: the value of a company’s assets
sentences.chinese: 公司的资产价值

detailed_translations.chinese: 资产， 财产； 有价值的特性或技能， 优点
detailed_translations.english: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

name: advantage
trans: n.优势；利益；有利条件vt.有利于；使处于优势vi.获利

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

name: disadvantage
trans: n.缺点；不利条件；损失

sentences.english: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

detailed_translations.english: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

name: merit
trans: n.优点，价值；功绩；功过vt.值得vi.应受报答

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: weakness
trans: n.弱点；软弱；嗜好

sentences.english: The legislation has a fundamental weakness.
sentences.chinese: 这项立法有一个根本性缺陷。

sentences.english: The plan has strengths and weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划既有优点又有缺点。

sentences.english: muscular weakness
sentences.chinese: 肌无力

sentences.english: weakness in the economy
sentences.chinese: 经济疲软

detailed_translations.english: a fault in someone’s character or in a system, organization, design etc

name: flaw
trans: n.瑕疵，缺点；一阵狂风；短暂的风暴；裂缝，裂纹v.使生裂缝，使有裂纹；使无效；使有缺陷vi.生裂缝；变的有缺陷

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: downside
trans: n.负面，缺点；下降趋势；底侧adj.底侧的

sentences.english: Digital cell phones offer more security, but the downside is that they have less power.
sentences.chinese: 数字手机安全性更好，但其劣势在于电力不足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 负面，缺点；下降趋势；底侧

name: cover
trans: n.封面，封皮；盖子；掩蔽物;幌子，借口vt.包括；采访，报导；涉及vi.覆盖；代替

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

name: discover
trans: vi.发现vt.发现；发觉

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: discovery
trans: n.发现，发觉；被发现的事物

sentences.english: the discovery of oil in Alaska
sentences.chinese: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

sentences.english: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

detailed_translations.english: when someone discovers something

name: recovery
trans: n.恢复，复原；痊愈；重获

sentences.english: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
sentences.chinese: 经济复苏的希望越来越渺茫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恢复， 痊愈； 追回， 寻回， 收复
detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: congress
trans: n.国会；代表大会；会议；社交

sentences.english: a congress of the ruling Labor Party
sentences.chinese: 执政党工党的代表大会

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, make decisions etc

name: congressional
trans: adj.国会的；会议的；议会的

sentences.english: The president explained his plans to congressional leaders.
sentences.chinese: 总统向国会领导人说明了他的计划。

detailed_translations.english: A congressional policy, action, or person relates to the U.S. Congress.

name: parliament
trans: n.议会，国会

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

name: council
trans: n.委员会；会议；理事会；地方议会；顾问班子

sentences.english: the council for civil liberties
sentences.chinese: 公民自由委员会

sentences.english: the UN Security Council
sentences.chinese: 联合国安全理事会

detailed_translations.english: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

name: senate
trans: n.参议院，上院；（古罗马的）元老院

sentences.english: The Senate approved the bill.
sentences.chinese: 参议院批准了这项议案。

detailed_translations.english: the smaller and more important of the two parts of the government with the power to make laws, in countries such as the US, Australia, and France

name: senator
trans: n.参议员；（古罗马的）元老院议员；评议员，理事

sentences.english: Senator Kennedy
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪参议员

detailed_translations.english: a member of the Senate or a senate

name: minister
trans: n.部长；大臣；牧师vi.执行牧师职务；辅助或伺候某人

sentences.english: a senior Cabinet minister
sentences.chinese: 资深的内阁部长

sentences.english: He concluded a deal with the Danish minister in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 他在华盛顿与丹麦公使达成了一项协议。

detailed_translations.english: a politician who is in charge of a government depart-ment, in Britain and some other countries

name: president
trans: n.总统；董事长；校长；主席

sentences.english: President Bush
sentences.chinese: 布什总统

sentences.english: the president of General Motors
sentences.chinese: 通用汽车公司总裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 总统；（某组织的）最高权力人
detailed_translations.english: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

name: presidential
trans: adj.总统的；首长的；统辖的

sentences.english: a presidential election
sentences.chinese: 总统大选

sentences.english: the party’s presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 该党的总统候选人

detailed_translations.english: relating to a president

name: criticism
trans: n.批评；考证；苛求

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: critic
trans: n.批评家，评论家；爱挑剔的人

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: critical
trans: adj.鉴定的；临界的；批评的，爱挑剔的；危险的；决定性的；评论的

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

name: critically
trans: adv.精密地；危急地；严重地；批评性地；用钻研眼光地；很大程度上；极为重要地

sentences.english: Mike looked at her critically.
sentences.chinese: 迈克挑剔地打量着她。

sentences.english: He has spoken critically of the government’s refusal to support the industry.
sentences.chinese: 他谈到政府拒绝支持这个行业时颇有微词。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that shows you are criticizing someone or something

name: criticise
trans: vt.批评；吹毛求疵；非难vi.批评；吹毛求疵；非难

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

name: criticize
trans: vi.批评；评论；苛求vt.批评；评论；非难

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

name: critique
trans: n.批评；评论文章vt.批判；评论

sentences.english: She had brought a book, a feminist critique of Victorian lady novelists.
sentences.chinese: 她带来了一本书，一本从女权主义角度对维多利亚时期女小说家进行的评论。

detailed_translations.english: a detailed explanation of the problems of something such as a set of political ideas
to say how good or bad a book, play, painting, or set of ideas is

name: condemn
trans: vt.谴责；判刑，定罪；声讨

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: blame
trans: n.责备；责任；过失vt.责备；归咎于

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: promise
trans: n.许诺，允诺；希望vt.允诺，许诺；给人以…的指望或希望vi.许诺；有指望，有前途

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: compromise
trans: n.妥协，和解；折衷vt.妥协；危害vi.妥协；让步

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: guarantee
trans: n.保证；担保；保证人；保证书；抵押品vt.保证；担保

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: pledge
trans: n.保证，誓言；抵押；抵押品，典当物vt.保证，许诺；用……抵押；举杯祝……健康

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: warrant
trans: n.根据；证明；正当理由；委任状vt.保证；担保；批准；辩解

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

name: range
trans: n.范围；幅度；排；山脉vt.漫游；放牧；使并列；归类于；来回走动vi.（在...内）变动；平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: scope
trans: n.范围；余地；视野；眼界；导弹射程vt.审视

sentences.english: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
sentences.chinese: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

detailed_translations.english: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

name: boundary
trans: n.边界；范围；分界线

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。

sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: spectrum
trans: n.光谱；频谱；范围；余象

sentences.english: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: territory
trans: n.领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: realm
trans: n.领域，范围；王国

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: domain
trans: n.领域；域名；产业；地产

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: acreage
trans: n.面积，英亩数

sentences.english: The Palestinians would balk at that as far too much, even if they got the equivalent acreage back, perhaps adjacent to the Gaza Strip.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦方对于这个提议望而却步，即便他们能换回同样多的英亩数，还有可能得到加沙地带的邻近区域。

sentences.english: The prevailing price levels for critical commodities should see a significant acreage response in the coming months as countries begin their cultivation cycles.
sentences.chinese: 现行价格水平为关键的商品应该会看到一个显着的反应面积在未来数月随着各国开始他们的培养周期。

detailed_translations.english: the area of a piece of land measured in acres

name: district
trans: n.区域；地方；行政区

sentences.english: a house in a pleasant suburban district
sentences.chinese: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

detailed_translations.english: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

name: region
trans: n.地区；范围；部位

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 给这个地区带来和平的努力

detailed_translations.english: a large area of a country or of the world, usually without exact limits

name: purchase
trans: n.购买；紧握；起重装置vt.购买；赢得vi.购买东西

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

name: afford
trans: vt.给予，提供；买得起

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

name: affordable
trans: adj.负担得起的

sentences.english: ...the availability of affordable housing.
sentences.chinese: …多数人支付得起的房产的供应。

detailed_translations.english: If something is affordable, most people have enough money to buy it

name: auction
trans: n.拍卖vt.拍卖；竞卖

sentences.english: Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week.
sentences.chinese: 法国艺术家让·科克托的8幅画作将在下周拍卖。

detailed_translations.english: to sell something at an auction
a public meeting where land, buildings, paintings etc are sold to the person who offers the most money for them

name: auctioneer
trans: n.拍卖商vt.拍卖

sentences.english: He tried to pass off a false Dagas on the auctioneer.
sentences.chinese: 他试着把假的德加的画卖给拍卖人。

sentences.english: The most talkative is the least intelligent, and there is hardly a difference between an orator and an auctioneer.
sentences.chinese: 话最多的人是最不聪明的人，在一个演说家和一个拍卖人之间，几乎没有分别。

sentences.english: The auctioneer shall state the drawbacks of auction targets to the bidders.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖人应当向竞买人说明拍卖标的的瑕疵。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is in charge of selling the things at an auction and who calls out how much money has already been offered for something

name: bid
trans: n.出价；叫牌；努力争取vi.投标；吩咐vt.投标；出价；表示；吩咐

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: struggle
trans: n.努力，奋斗；竞争vt.使劲移动；尽力使得vi.奋斗，努力；挣扎

sentences.english: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 他们不得不同各种困境斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

name: battle
trans: n.战役；斗争vt.与…作战vi.斗争；作战

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

name: combat
trans: n.战斗；争论adj.战斗的；为…斗争的vi.战斗；搏斗vt.反对；与…战斗

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: defeat
trans: n.失败的事实；击败的行为vt.击败，战胜；挫败；使…失败

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

name: victory
trans: n.胜利；成功；克服

sentences.english: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖们在争取工作场所权利的斗争中正迈向胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

name: triumph
trans: n.胜利，凯旋；欢欣vi.获得胜利，成功

sentences.english: All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 凯利在一生中遭遇了种种艰巨任务与挑战，但成功了。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle
an important victory or success after a difficult struggle

name: military
trans: adj.军事的；军人的；适于战争的n.军队；军人

sentences.english: a military helicopter
sentences.chinese: 军用直升机

sentences.english: military equipment
sentences.chinese: 军事设备

sentences.english: The government has threatened to take military action if the rebels do not withdraw from the area.
sentences.chinese: 政府警告说，如果叛乱分子不从该地区撤出，就要采取军事行动。

sentences.english: The United States is prepared to use military force to achieve its aims.
sentences.chinese: 美国准备动用武力达成目的。

sentences.english: a raid by European military forces
sentences.chinese: 欧洲军事力量发动的袭击

detailed_translations.english: used by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, or airforce
the military forces of a country

name: content
trans: n.内容，目录；满足；容量adj.满意的vt.使满足

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: satisfy
trans: vi.令人满意；令人满足vt.满足；说服，使相信；使满意，使高兴

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

name: satisfied
trans: v.使满意（satisfy的过去式）adj.感到满意的

sentences.english: a satisfied smile
sentences.chinese: 满意的微笑

sentences.english: They have plenty of satisfied customers .
sentences.chinese: 他们的许多客户都很满意。

sentences.english: Will she ever be satisfied?
sentences.chinese: 她何时才能满足？

detailed_translations.english: feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want

name: satisfaction
trans: n.满意，满足；赔偿；乐事；赎罪

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

name: dissatisfaction
trans: n.不满；令人不满的事物

sentences.english: 30% of customers expressed dissatisfaction with the service.
sentences.chinese: 30%的顾客对服务表示不满意。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of not being satisfied

name: gratification
trans: n.满意；喜悦；使人满意之事

sentences.english: So even to-day, when we fail to see the truth of religion, we seek in its observance an artistic gratification.
sentences.chinese: 所以，甚至在今天，在我们还看不到宗教的真理时，我们只能从宗教的仪式里去寻求艺术的满足。

sentences.english: We live in a culture of instant gratification.
sentences.chinese: 我们生活在即时满足的文化中。

name: cater
trans: vt.投合，迎合；满足需要；提供饮食及服务

sentences.english: We cater to an exclusive clientele.
sentences.chinese: 我们满足一个特殊客户群的需求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投合，迎合；满足需要；提供饮食及服务
detailed_translations.english: to provide and serve food and drinks at a party, meeting etc, usually as a business

name: complex
trans: n.复合体；综合设施adj.复杂的；合成的

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: complexity
trans: n.复杂，复杂性；复杂错综的事物

sentences.english: a design of great complexity
sentences.chinese: 一项非常复杂的设计

detailed_translations.english: the state of being complicated

name: complicated
trans: adj.难懂的，复杂的

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

name: intricate
trans: adj.复杂的；错综的，缠结的

sentences.english: intricate patterns
sentences.chinese: 繁复的图案

detailed_translations.chinese: 错综复杂的， 复杂精细的
detailed_translations.english: containing many small parts or details that all work or fit together

name: intricacy
trans: n.错综，复杂；难以理解

sentences.english: the intricacies of private banking
sentences.chinese: 私人银行业务的错综复杂

detailed_translations.english: the complicated details of something

name: sophisticated
trans: adj.复杂的；精致的；久经世故的；富有经验的v.使变得世故；使迷惑；篡改（sophisticate的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

name: generate
trans: vt.使形成；发生；生殖；产生物理反应

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

name: generation
trans: n.一代；产生；一代人；生殖

sentences.english: Like most of my generation, I had never known a war.
sentences.chinese: 和我们这一代的大多数人一样，我并没有经历过战争。

sentences.english: In my generation the divorce rate is very high.
sentences.chinese: 我们这一代人离婚率很高。

sentences.english: the need to preserve the planet for future generations
sentences.chinese: 为子孙后代保护地球的必要性

sentences.english: The story has been handed down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是一代一代传下来的。

sentences.english: the generation of electricity
sentences.chinese: 发电

detailed_translations.english: all people of about the same age

name: generational
trans: adj.一代的；生育的

sentences.english: generational conflict
sentences.chinese: 两代人之间的冲突

sentences.english: generational divisions
sentences.chinese: 两代人之间的分歧

detailed_translations.english: connected with a particular generation or the relationship between different generations

name: generative
trans: adj.生殖的；生产的；有生殖力的；有生产力的

sentences.english: the generative power of the life force
sentences.chinese: 生命力的生成能力

detailed_translations.english: able to produce something

name: millennial
trans: adj.一千年的；千禧年的

name: liberal
trans: adj.自由主义的；慷慨的；不拘泥的；宽大的n.自由主义者

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

name: illiberal
trans: adj.偏执的；吝啬的；粗鄙的；狭隘的；缺乏文化素养的

sentences.english: illiberal and undemocratic policies
sentences.chinese: 专制、不民主的政策

detailed_translations.chinese: 偏执的， 思想狭隘的

name: liberate
trans: vt.解放；放出；释放

sentences.english: A few days later, our armies liberated the city.
sentences.chinese: 几天以后，我军解放了这座城市。

detailed_translations.english: to free prisoners, a city, a country etc from someone’s control

name: liberty
trans: n.自由；许可；冒失

sentences.english: the fight for liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 争取自由和平等的斗争

detailed_translations.english: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority

name: manage
trans: vt.管理；经营；控制；设法vi.处理；应付过去

sentences.english: He was asked to manage a new department.
sentences.chinese: 他被要求去管理一个新的部门。

sentences.english: Managing a football team is harder than you think.
sentences.chinese: 管理一支足球队比你想象的要难。

sentences.english: The company had been very badly managed.
sentences.chinese: 公司管理非常糟糕。

sentences.english: I don’t know how I’ll manage it , but I’ll be there.
sentences.chinese: 我还不知道怎么去，但我会去的。

sentences.english: I don’t know how she manages with seven children.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道七个孩子她是怎么应付的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理；设法；成功应付，对付
detailed_translations.english: to direct or control a business or department and the people, equipment, and money involved in it

name: management
trans: n.管理；管理人员；管理部门；操纵；经营手段

sentences.english: a lack of management skills
sentences.chinese: 缺乏管理技巧

sentences.english: a management consultant
sentences.chinese: 一个管理顾问

sentences.english: management training courses
sentences.chinese: 管理培训课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 管理； 处理； 管理部门， 管理人员
detailed_translations.english: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does

name: memory
trans: n.记忆，记忆力；内存，存储器；回忆

sentences.english: He has lots of happy memories of his stay in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 他对在日本逗留的那段时光有许多美好的回忆。

sentences.english: The data is stored in the computer’s memory.
sentences.chinese: 数据储存在电脑的存储器里

detailed_translations.english: something that you remember from the past about a person, place, or experience

name: memorable
trans: adj.显著的，难忘的；值得纪念的

sentences.english: We want to make this a truly memorable day for the children.
sentences.chinese: 我们想让今天成为孩子们永远难忘的日子。

detailed_translations.english: very good, enjoyable, or unusual, and worth remembering

name: memorization
trans: n.记住；暗记

name: regard
trans: n.注意；尊重；问候；凝视vi.注意，注重；注视vt.注重，考虑；看待；尊敬；把…看作；与…有关

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: regarding
trans: prep.关于，至于

sentences.english: Regarding your recent inquiry, I have enclosed a copy of our new brochure.
sentences.chinese: 关于你最近的咨询，我随信附上一本我们最新的手册。

detailed_translations.english: a word used especially in letters or speeches to introduce the subject you are writing or talking about

name: disregard
trans: n.忽视；不尊重vt.忽视；不理；漠视；不顾

sentences.english: He ordered the jury to disregard the witness’s last statement.
sentences.chinese: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。

sentences.english: his disregard for her feelings
sentences.chinese: 他对她情感的忽略

detailed_translations.english: to ignore something or treat it as unimportant
when someone ignores something that they should not ignore

name: regardlessof
trans: prep.不管；不顾；不理会不论；无论；不注意

name: explore
trans: vi.探索；探测；探险vt.探索；探测；探险

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

name: exploration
trans: n.探测；探究；踏勘

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it

name: excavation
trans: n.挖掘，发掘

sentences.english: A second excavation, in 1985, lasted a year and was cut short for technical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 第二次挖掘是在1985年，因为技术原因持续了一年就突然停止了。

sentences.english: If he thinks I’m particular about excavation records, you should see him taking pictures!
sentences.chinese: 如果他觉得我对挖掘纪录很挑剔，你应该看看他是怎么拍照的。

sentences.english: Blue flags define the excavation perimeter, while yellow ones mark the location of fossils or stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 蓝旗用来显示发掘地的周长，而黄旗用来标明发掘出化石或石制工具的地点。

name: express
trans: n.快车，快递，专使；捷运公司vt.表达；快递adj.明确的；迅速的；专门的

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: expression
trans: n.表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: expressive
trans: adj.表现的；有表现力的；表达…的

sentences.english: You can train people to be more expressive.
sentences.chinese: 你可以培训人们使其更富于表现力。

sentences.english: ...the present fashion for intuitive, expressive painting.
sentences.chinese: …当前凭直觉的、富于表现力的绘画风尚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions

name: convey
trans: vt.传达；运输；让与

sentences.english: All this information can be conveyed in a simple diagram.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些信息可以通过一张简单的图表来表示。

sentences.english: Ads convey the message that thin is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 广告传递的信息是: 瘦就是美。

sentences.english: He was sent to convey a message to the UN Secretary General.
sentences.chinese: 他被派去向联合国秘书长传达一条信息。

detailed_translations.english: to communicate or express something, with or without using words

name: utterance
trans: n.表达；说话；说话方式

sentences.english: These two utterances communicate the same message.
sentences.chinese: 这两句话传递同样的信息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意见, 说话, 发表
detailed_translations.english: the action of saying something

name: gasp
trans: n.喘气vi.喘气；喘息；渴望vt.气喘吁吁地说；喘着气说话

sentences.english: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
sentences.chinese: “我的腿！”他倒抽一口气喊道，“我觉得腿断了！”

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain

name: predict
trans: vi.作出预言；作预料，作预报vt.预报，预言；预知

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: predictable
trans: adj.可预言的

sentences.english: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
sentences.chinese: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。

sentences.english: an entertaining but predictable film
sentences.chinese: 一部有趣但老套的电影

sentences.english: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
sentences.chinese: 洛根的反应可想而知。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval

name: predictably
trans: adv.可预言地

detailed_translations.chinese: 可预言地, 不出所料地

name: prediction
trans: n.预报；预言

sentences.english: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
sentences.chinese: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

detailed_translations.english: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

name: anticipate
trans: vt.预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: forecast
trans: n.预测，预报；预想vt.预报，预测；预示vi.进行预报，作预测

sentences.english: The weather forecast is good for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说明天是晴天。

sentences.english: Rain was forecast for the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 预报周末有雨。

detailed_translations.english: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now
to make a statement saying what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

name: foreseeable
trans: adj.可预知的；能预测的

sentences.english: The judge found that it was not foreseeable that the fuel would catch fire.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁定，燃料着火是无法预料的。

sentences.english: foreseeable risk
sentences.chinese: 可预料的风险

detailed_translations.english: foreseeable difficulties, events etc should be planned for because they are very likely to happen in the future

name: foreshadow
trans: vt.预示；成为…的前兆n.预兆

sentences.english: The revolution foreshadowed an entirely new social order.
sentences.chinese: 这场革命预示着一种全新的社会秩序将要出现。

detailed_translations.english: to show or say that something will happen in the future

name: prevent
trans: vt.预防，防止；阻止vi.妨碍，阻止

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: prevention
trans: n.预防；阻止；妨碍

sentences.english: a fire prevention officer
sentences.chinese: 消防官员

sentences.english: You know what they say, prevention is better than cure (= it is better to stop something bad from happening than to remove the problem once it has happened ) .
sentences.chinese: 正所谓预防胜于治疗。

detailed_translations.english: when something bad is stopped from happening

name: hinder
trans: vt.阻碍；打扰adj.后面的vi.成为阻碍

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

name: curb
trans: n.抑制；路边；勒马绳vt.控制；勒住

sentences.english: measures to curb the spread of the virus
sentences.chinese: 控制病毒扩散的措施

detailed_translations.english: to control or limit something in order to prevent it from having a harmful effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 控制， 约束； 路缘
detailed_translations.english: an influence which helps to control or limit something

name: barrier
trans: n.障碍物，屏障；界线vt.把…关入栅栏

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: obstacle
trans: n.障碍，干扰；妨害物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: similar
trans: n.类似物adj.相似的

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: similarity
trans: n.类似；相似点

sentences.english: They are both blonde, but there the similarity ends .
sentences.chinese: 他们俩都是金发，但相同之处也就仅此而已。

detailed_translations.english: if there is a similarity between two things or people, they are similar in some way

name: resemble
trans: vt.类似，像

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。
