sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: likewise
trans: adv.同样地；也

sentences.english: Nanny put on a shawl and told the girls to do likewise.
sentences.chinese: 南妮披上披肩，并叫女孩们也这样做。

sentences.english: The clams were delicious. Likewise, the eggplant was excellent.
sentences.chinese: 蛤蜊味道鲜美，茄子也同样美味。

sentences.english: ‘You’re always welcome at our house.’ ‘Likewise.’
sentences.chinese: “欢迎你随时来我家做客。”“你也一样。

detailed_translations.english: in the same way

name: analogy
trans: n.类比；类推；类似

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: analogous
trans: adj.类似的；同功的；可比拟的

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似的；[昆] 同功的；可比拟的
detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

name: aim
trans: n.目的；目标；对准vt.目的在于；引导；把…对准vi.打算；对准目标；瞄准

sentences.english: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛举枪瞄准，但是没有射击。

sentences.english: My criticism wasn't aimed at you.
sentences.chinese: 我的批评不是针对你的。

sentences.english: They are aiming to reduce unemployment by 50%.
sentences.chinese: 他们正力求使失业人数下降50%。

detailed_translations.english: to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc. at sb/sth

name: purpose
trans: n.目的；用途；意志vt.决心；企图；打算

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: attract
trans: vt.吸引；引起vi.吸引；有吸引力

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: attraction
trans: n.吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: expansion
trans: n.膨胀；阐述；扩张物

sentences.english: The industry underwent a period of rapid expansion.
sentences.chinese: 该产业经历了一轮快速扩张。

detailed_translations.english: when something increases in size, range, amount etc

name: diffuse
trans: vt.扩散；传播；漫射adj.弥漫的；散开的vi.传播；四散

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: diffusionism
trans: 弥漫说

name: transmit
trans: vt.传输；传播；发射；传达；遗传vi.传输；发射信号

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: suffer
trans: vi.遭受，忍受；受痛苦；经验；受损害vt.遭受；忍受；经历

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: confront
trans: vt.面对；遭遇；比较

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

name: encounter
trans: n.遭遇，偶然碰见vi.遭遇；偶然相遇vt.遭遇，邂逅；遇到

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: slave
trans: n.奴隶；从动装置vi.苦干；拼命工作

sentences.english: a slave to fashion
sentences.chinese: 时尚的奴隶

detailed_translations.english: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money
to work very hard with little time to rest

name: slavery
trans: n.奴役；奴隶制度；奴隶身份

sentences.english: attempts to abolish slavery
sentences.chinese: 废除奴隶制的努力

detailed_translations.english: the system of having slaves

name: enslavement
trans: n.奴役

name: colonial
trans: n.殖民地居民adj.殖民地的，殖民的

sentences.english: the struggle against colonial rule
sentences.chinese: 反抗殖民统治的斗争

sentences.english: Britain was the largest colonial power .
sentences.chinese: 英国曾是最大的殖民强国。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a country that controls and rules other countries, usually ones that are far away

name: patient
trans: n.病人；患者adj.有耐心的，能容忍的

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: patience
trans: n.耐性，耐心；忍耐，容忍

sentences.english: He doesn't have the patience to wait.
sentences.chinese: 他没有耐心等。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to stay calm and accept a delay or sth annoying without complaining

name: impatience
trans: n.急躁；无耐心

sentences.english: A note of impatience had entered his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他的语气开始透出一丝不耐烦。

detailed_translations.english: annoyance at having to accept delays, other people’s weaknesses etc

name: assess
trans: vt.评定；估价；对…征税

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: assessment
trans: n.评定；估价

sentences.english: a reading assessment test
sentences.chinese: 阅读评估测试

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you make a judgment about a person or situation, or the judgment you make

name: estimate
trans: n.估计，估价；判断，看法vt.估计，估量；判断，评价vi.估计，估价

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: overestimate
trans: vt.对……评价过高；对……估计过高n.估计过高；评价过高；出价过高vi.估计过高；评价过高

sentences.english: He tends to overestimate his own abilities.
sentences.chinese: 他往往高估自己的能力。

sentences.english: The importance of training in health and safety cannot be overestimated (= is extremely important ).
sentences.chinese: 对健康和安全方面的培训极为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think something is better, more important etc than it really is

name: underestimate
trans: n.低估vt.低估；看轻

sentences.english: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
sentences.chinese: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

sentences.english: Never underestimate the power of the press.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

detailed_translations.english: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

name: evaluate
trans: vt.评价；估价；求…的值vi.评价；估价

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

detailed_translations.english: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

name: evaluation
trans: n.评价；评估；估价；求值

sentences.english: We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.
sentences.chinese: 我们要对新系统进行合理的评估。

sentences.english: They took some samples of products for evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 他们抽取了一些产品样本以作评估。

detailed_translations.english: a judgment about how good, useful, or successful something is

name: bias
trans: n.偏见；偏爱；斜纹；乖离率adj.偏斜的vt.使存偏见adv.偏斜地

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

trans: adj.有偏见的；结果偏倚的，有偏的

sentences.english: Of course I’m biased, but I thought my daughter’s paintings were the best.
sentences.chinese: 当然我有偏心，但我还是认为我女儿的画最好。

sentences.english: racially biased attitudes
sentences.chinese: 带种族偏见的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 有偏见的；结果偏倚的，有偏的
detailed_translations.english: unfairly preferring one person or group over another

name: unbiased
trans: adj.公正的；无偏见的

sentences.english: We aim to provide a service that is balanced and unbiased.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是提供一种公平公正的服务。

sentences.english: an unbiased observer
sentences.chinese: 一名公正的观察员

name: stereotype

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

name: stereotypical
trans: adj.老一套的；陈规的

sentences.english: These are men whose masculinity does not conform to stereotypical images of the unfeeling male.
sentences.chinese: 这些阳刚的男人不符合那种冷血男人的成见形象。

name: discrimination
trans: n.歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: prejudice
trans: n.偏见；侵害vt.损害；使有偏见

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

name: desire
trans: n.欲望；要求，心愿；性欲vt.想要；要求；希望得到…vi.渴望

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

a strong hope or wish

trans: n.合意的人或事物adj.令人满意的；值得要的

sentences.english: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
sentences.chinese: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。

sentences.english: a desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 理想的社区

sentences.english: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
sentences.chinese: 应该对电脑有所熟悉，这是很有益处的。

sentences.english: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
sentences.chinese: 把成本控制得越低越好。

trans: adj.渴望的；热切的；热心的

sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

trans: n.渴望；热心

sentences.chinese: 有时我在儿童和十几岁的孩子们的脸上见到过这种相同的渴望和信念，在想到我自己时，感觉这情形使我回想起同样的悲哀。

sentences.english: Expectancy - Come before God with anticipation and eagerness.
sentences.chinese: 盼望 -  来到神面前要有期待和渴望。

name: aspire
trans: vi.渴望；立志；追求

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: aspiration
trans: n.渴望；抱负；送气；吸气；吸引术

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负

name: appetite

sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

name: expect
trans: vi.期待；预期vt.期望；指望；认为；预料

sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: unexpected
trans: adj.意外的，想不到的

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

name: expectation
trans: n.期待；预期；指望

sentences.chinese: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.english: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.english: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.chinese: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

detailed_translations.english: what you think or hope will happen

name: direct
trans: adj.直接的；直系的；亲身的；恰好的vt.管理；指挥；导演；指向adv.直接地；正好；按直系关系vi.指导；指挥

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: direction
trans: n.方向；指导；趋势；用法说明

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: directly
trans: conj.一…就adv.直接地；立即；马上；正好地；坦率地

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: director
trans: n.主任，主管；导演；人事助理

sentences.english: The company is run by a board of directors (= a group of directors ) .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司由董事会管理。

sentences.english: the director of education
sentences.chinese: 教育局局长

detailed_translations.chinese: 理事；导演；指导者；负责人
detailed_translations.english: someone who controls or manages a company

name: indirect
trans: adj.间接的；迂回的；非直截了当的

sentences.english: Losing weight is an indirect result of smoking cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟间接导致体重减轻。

sentences.english: The indirect effects of climate change may be profound.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化造成的间接影响可能是深远的。

sentences.english: George’s comments were an indirect way of blaming me.
sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

detailed_translations.english: not directly caused by something

name: bearing
trans: n.轴承；关系；方位；举止v.忍受（bear的ing形式）

sentences.english: learning to take a compass bearing
sentences.chinese: 学习用罗盘辨别方向

sentences.english: An oil seal was replaced, along with both front wheel bearings.
sentences.chinese: 换了一个油封和两个前轮轴承

detailed_translations.chinese: 方位；（机器的）承座；轴承；忍受
detailed_translations.english: a direction or angle that is shown by a  compass

name: orient
trans: vt.使适应；确定方向；使朝东n.东方；东方诸国adj.东方的vi.向东

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: doubt
trans: n.怀疑；疑问；疑惑v.怀疑；不信；恐怕；拿不准

sentences.english: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

sentences.english: Kim never doubted his story.
sentences.chinese: 例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

name: doubtless
trans: adj.无疑的；确定的adv.无疑地；确定地；大概，多半

sentences.english: Doubtless there would be lots of rumours.
sentences.chinese: 无疑会谣言四起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无疑地；确定地；大概，多半
detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something is almost certain to happen or be true

name: undoubtedly
trans: adv.确实地，毋庸置疑的

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: suspect
trans: n.嫌疑犯adj.可疑的；不可信的vi.怀疑；猜想vt.怀疑；猜想

sentences.english: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。

sentences.english: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
sentences.chinese: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: suspicion
trans: n.怀疑；嫌疑；疑心；一点儿vt.怀疑

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: suspicious
trans: adj.可疑的；怀疑的；多疑的

sentences.english: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
sentences.chinese: 他不愿回答我的问题，这引起我的怀疑。

sentences.english: She gave him a suspicious glance.
sentences.chinese: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。

sentences.english: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
sentences.chinese: 你真是疑心太重！

detailed_translations.english: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: skeptical
trans: adj.怀疑的；怀疑论的，不可知论的

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

name: sceptical
trans: adj.怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的

sentences.english: Others here are more sceptical about the chances for justice being done.
sentences.chinese: 这里的其他人更为怀疑正义能否得到伸张。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的；怀疑论的；习惯怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it

name: skepticism
trans: n.怀疑论；怀疑的态度

sentences.english: I know there are those who don’t believe we can do all these things. I understand the skepticism.
sentences.chinese: 我知道有些人不相信我们可以完成所有这些事情，我理解他们所持的怀疑态度。

sentences.english: Therefore, I do not think we should go in for complete skepticism, but for a doctrine of degrees of probability.
sentences.chinese: 因而我绝不认为我们应当赞成彻底的怀疑主义，而是赞成可能性程度的学说。

sentences.english: I understand that skepticism, which is why this recovery plan must and will include unprecedented measures that will allow the American people to hold my Administration accountable for these results.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这些怀疑，这也是为什么复苏计划一定要包括这些前所未有的措施，即将会允许美国人民要我的政府对这些计划的结果负责。

name: scepticism
trans: n.怀疑；怀疑论；怀疑主义

sentences.english: A survey reflects business scepticism about the strength of the economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 一份调查反映出商业界对经济恢复能力的怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: an attitude of doubting that particular claims or statements are true or that something will happen

name: challenge
trans: n.挑战；怀疑vt.向…挑战；对…质疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: ease
trans: n.轻松，舒适；安逸，悠闲vt.减轻，缓和；使安心vi.减轻，缓和；放松；灵活地移动

sentences.english: She lived a life of ease.
sentences.chinese: 她过着悠闲自在的生活。

sentences.english: The plan should ease traffic congestion in the town.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划对城里的交通拥挤状况应该有所缓解。

detailed_translations.english: lack of difficulty
to become or to make sth less unpleasant, painful, severe, etc.

name: relieve
trans: vt.解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: relief
trans: n.救济；减轻，解除；安慰；浮雕

sentences.english: Marijuana can provide pain relief for some cancer patients.
sentences.chinese: 大麻可以为一些癌症患者减轻疼痛。

sentences.english: money raised for the relief effort
sentences.chinese: 为赈灾筹集的钱款

detailed_translations.english: when something reduces someone’s pain or unhappy feelings

name: assuage
trans: vt.平息；缓和；减轻

sentences.english: Nothing could assuage his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 什么都不能减轻他的内疚。

detailed_translations.english: to make an unpleasant feeling less painful or severe

name: alleviate
trans: vt.减轻，缓和

sentences.english: measures to alleviate poverty
sentences.chinese: 扶贫措施

detailed_translations.english: to make something less painful or difficult to deal with

name: release
trans: n.释放；发布；让与vt.释放；发射；让与；允许发表

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: unleash
trans: vt.发动；解开…的皮带；解除…的束缚vi.不受约束；自由自在；放荡不羁

sentences.english: Lefèvre’s comments unleashed a wave of protest.
sentences.chinese: 勒菲弗的评论引发了一波抗议的浪潮。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly let a strong force, feeling etc have its full effect

name: rid
trans: vt.使摆脱；使去掉

sentences.english: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
sentences.chinese: 销毁本国核武器的承诺

detailed_translations.english: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it

name: essential
trans: n.本质；要素；要点；必需品adj.基本的；必要的；本质的；精华的

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: essentially
trans: adv.本质上；本来

sentences.english: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.english: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

detailed_translations.english: used when stating the most basic facts about something

name: essence
trans: n.本质，实质；精华；香精

sentences.english: In essence his message was very simple.
sentences.chinese: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

detailed_translations.english: the most basic and important quality of something

name: indispensable
trans: n.不可缺少之物；必不可少的人adj.不可缺少的；绝对必要的；责无旁贷的

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: fundamental
trans: n.基本原理；基本原则adj.基本的，根本的

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: fundamentally
trans: adv.根本地，从根本上；基础地

sentences.english: The conclusions of the report are fundamentally wrong .
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的结论从根本上来说就是错误的。

sentences.english: The political culture of the US is fundamentally different .
sentences.chinese: 美国的政治文化迥然不同。

detailed_translations.english: in every way that is important or basic

name: underlying
trans: adj.潜在的；根本的；在下面的；优先的v.放在…的下面；为…的基础；优先于（underlie的ing形式）

sentences.english: To stop a problem you have to understand its underlying causes.
sentences.chinese: 要解决问题，你得了解其潜在原因。

detailed_translations.english: The underlying features of an object, event, or situation are not obvious, and it may be difficult to discover or reveal them

name: centre
trans: n.中心adj.中央的vt.集中；将…放在中央vi.以…为中心

sentences.english: lines radiating out from the centre
sentences.chinese: 从中心向外辐射的线条

sentences.english: chocolates with soft centres
sentences.chinese: 软夹心巧克力

sentences.english: The title isn’t quite centred on the page, is it?
sentences.chinese: 标题并不在这页的正中间，是吗？

detailed_translations.english: the middle of a space, area, or object, especially the exact middle
to move something to a position at the centre of something else

name: center
trans: n.中心，中央；中锋；中心点adj.中央的，位在正中的vt.集中，使聚集在一点；定中心vi.居中，被置于中心

sentences.english: In this example, you rotate a square on its center, but do not fill the square.
sentences.chinese: 在这个例子中，您会以中心为原点旋转一个正方形，但不填充这个正方形。

detailed_translations.chinese: 圆心， 正中； 中心

name: central
trans: n.电话总机adj.中心的；主要的；中枢的

sentences.english: He lives in central London.
sentences.chinese: 他住在伦敦市中心。

sentences.english: The roof is supported by a central column.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶由一根中心柱支撑着。

sentences.english: Owen played a central role in the negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 欧文在谈判中担任了重要角色。

detailed_translations.english: in the middle of an area or an object

name: centerpiece
trans: n.中心装饰品；放在餐桌中央的摆饰

name: rich
trans: adj.富有的；肥沃的；昂贵的adj.油腻的，含有很多脂肪

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

name: richness
trans: n.丰富；富裕；肥沃；华美

sentences.english: But I would like to suggest enough of them to impress upon you the richness and complexity of my background.
sentences.chinese: 但我仍会给出足够多的建议让你对我的背景留下丰富而富有综合性的印象。

detailed_translations.english: if something has richness, it contains a lot of interesting things

name: enrich
trans: vt.使充实；使肥沃；使富足

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: abundant
trans: adj.丰富的；充裕的；盛产

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

name: abundance
trans: n.充裕，丰富

sentences.english: an abundance of wavy red hair
sentences.chinese: 浓密的红色鬈发

sentences.english: One quality the team possessed in abundance was fighting spirit.
sentences.chinese: 该队的一大特点是斗志昂扬。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity of something

name: sufficient
trans: adj.足够的；充分的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: insufficient
trans: adj.不足的，不充足的；不胜任的；缺乏能力的n.不足；缺乏

sentences.english: Insufficient resources have been devoted to the health service.
sentences.chinese: 用于医疗保健服务的资源不足。

detailed_translations.english: not enough, or not great enough

name: sufficiency
trans: n.足量，充足；自满

sentences.english: The war has affected the country’s economic sufficiency.
sentences.chinese: 战争已经影响到了这个国家的经济富足。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being or having enough

name: abound
trans: vi.富于；充满

sentences.english: Rumors of such coordination abound, but as with many rumors, they have no basis in fact.
sentences.chinese: 关于这类协调的谣传很多；但如同许多其他谣传一样，它们没有事实根据。

sentences.english: Finally, offer this closing prayer to the Lord: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 最后，将结束的祷告告诉主：愿在你拥有信仰的时候希望的上帝用快乐与和平充满你的人生，让你在圣灵的力量下富于希望。

name: ideal
trans: n.理想；典范adj.理想的；完美的；想象的；不切实际的

sentences.english: advice on how to reach your ideal weight
sentences.chinese: 如何达到理想体重的建议

sentences.english: The scheme offers an ideal opportunity for youngsters to get training.
sentences.chinese: 该计划为年轻人提供了获得培训的极好机会。

sentences.english: With so much rain, conditions are far from ideal.
sentences.chinese: 雨水这么多，天气情况很不理想。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be
a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

name: idealised
trans: vt.（英）把…理想化（等于idealize）vi.形成理想；理想化地表现

name: idealized
trans: adj.理想化的v.把…理想化；以理想的形式表现事物（idealize的过去分词）

name: perform
trans: vt.执行；完成；演奏vi.执行，机器运转；表演

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: performance
trans: n.性能；绩效；表演；执行；表现

sentences.english: This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的演出8点开始。

sentences.english: the performance of his official duties
sentences.chinese: 履行他的职务

sentences.english: Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩在学校的表现进步很大。

detailed_translations.english: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

name: performer
trans: n.演出者；执行者；演奏者

sentences.english: circus performers
sentences.chinese: 马戏演员

sentences.english: He was a better songwriter than performer.
sentences.chinese: 他更擅长写歌，而不是演唱。

detailed_translations.english: an actor, musician etc who performs to entertain people

name: press
trans: n.压；按；新闻；出版社；印刷机vt.压；按；逼迫；紧抱vi.压；逼；重压

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: suppress
trans: vt.抑制；镇压；废止

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

name: depressed
trans: adj.沮丧的；萧条的；压低的v.使沮丧；使萧条（depress的过去式和过去分词形式）；压低

sentences.english: Britain’s depressed housing market
sentences.chinese: 英国不景气的房产市场

sentences.english: She felt lonely and depressed .
sentences.chinese: 她感到孤独和沮丧。

detailed_translations.english: an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity

name: depression
trans: n.沮丧；洼地；不景气；忧愁；低气压区

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

name: squeeze
trans: n.压榨；紧握；拥挤；佣金vt.挤；紧握；勒索vi.压榨

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

name: separate
trans: n..分开；抽印本adj.单独的；分开的；不同的；各自的；vt.使分离；使分开；使分居vi.分开；隔开；分居

sentences.english: The gym and the sauna are in separate buildings.
sentences.chinese: 健身房和桑拿浴室在不同的大楼里。

detailed_translations.english: not joined to or touching something else

name: separation
trans: n.分离，分开；间隔，距离；分居；缺口

sentences.english: the separation of church and state
sentences.chinese: 政教分离

detailed_translations.chinese: 分离，分开；间隔，距离；[法] 分居；缺口
detailed_translations.english: when something separates or is separate

name: divide
trans: n.分水岭，分水线vt.划分；除；分开；使产生分歧vi.分开；意见分歧

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: division
trans: n.除法；部门；分配；分割；师（军队）；赛区

sentences.english: the division sign (÷)
sentences.chinese: 除号

sentences.english: the Computer Services Division
sentences.chinese: 电脑维修部

detailed_translations.english: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another

name: split
trans: n.劈开；裂缝adj.劈开的vt.分离；使分离；劈开；离开；分解vi.离开；被劈开；断绝关系

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

name: apart
trans: adj.分离的；与众不同的adv.相距；与众不同地；分离着

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: isolate
trans: n.隔离种群vt.使隔离；使孤立；使绝缘adj.隔离的；孤立的vi.隔离；孤立

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: isolated
trans: adj.孤立的；分离的；单独的；绝缘的v.使孤立；使绝缘；脱离（isolate的过去分词）

sentences.english: small isolated communities
sentences.chinese: 偏僻的小社区

sentences.english: Not many people visit this isolated spot.
sentences.chinese: 没有多少人到这个偏僻的地方来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 隔离的， 分离的； 与世隔绝的， 偏僻的； 孤立的， 孤独的； 个别的
detailed_translations.english: an isolated building, village etc is far away from any others

name: consume
trans: vt.消耗，消费；使…着迷；挥霍vi.耗尽，毁灭；耗尽生命

sentences.english: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.chinese: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

detailed_translations.english: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc

name: consumer
trans: n.消费者；用户，顾客

sentences.english: Consumers will soon be paying higher airfares.
sentences.chinese: 不久消费者就要支付更高的机票价了。

sentences.english: It will offer a wider choice of goods for the consumer (= consumers in general ).
sentences.chinese: 它将为消费者提供更多的商品选择。

sentences.english: Consumer demand led to higher imports of manufactured goods.
sentences.chinese: 消费者需求促使制造商品的进口量增加了。

sentences.english: Consumer spending was down by 0.1% last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月消费支出下降了0.1%。

sentences.english: sources of consumer advice
sentences.chinese: 给予消费者建议的信息来源

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and uses products and services

name: consumption
trans: n.消费；消耗；肺痨

sentences.english: Vigorous exercise increases oxygen consumption.
sentences.chinese: 剧烈运动增加氧的消耗。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

name: assume
trans: vt.僭取；篡夺；夺取；擅用；侵占vi.假定；设想；承担；采取

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: assumption
trans: n.假定；设想；担任；采取

sentences.english: You would be making an assumption that's not based on any fact that you could report.
sentences.chinese: 你会做出不以你能报道的任何事实为依据的一种假设。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

name: imply
trans: vt.意味；暗示；隐含

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: implicit
trans: adj.含蓄的；暗示的；盲从的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: implication
trans: n.含义；暗示；牵连，卷入；可能的结果，影响

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: explicit
trans: adj.明确的；清楚的；直率的；详述的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: explicitly
trans: adv.明确地；明白地

sentences.english: You have to grant us control explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 你们必须允许我们明确地控制。

sentences.english: Tell them explicitly you want to continue the friendship.
sentences.chinese: 明确地告诉他们你想继续这段友谊。

sentences.english: Therefore, you need to include these in your source files explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 因此，您需要将这些都明确地包含进源文件中。

name: celebrity
trans: n.名人；名声

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

name: reputation
trans: n.名声，名誉；声望

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: fame
trans: n.名声，名望；传闻，传说vt.使闻名，使有名望

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

name: famed
trans: adj.著名的

sentences.english: the famed literary critic Nathan Hall
sentences.chinese: 著名的文学评论家内森•霍尔

detailed_translations.english: well-known

name: prominent
trans: adj.突出的，显著的；杰出的；卓越的

sentences.english: a prominent Russian scientist
sentences.chinese: 杰出的俄罗斯科学家

sentences.english: The World Cup will have a prominent place on the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

sentences.english: a prominent nose
sentences.chinese: 高鼻子

detailed_translations.english: important

name: prestige
trans: n.威望，声望；声誉

sentences.english: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
sentences.chinese: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。

sentences.english: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
sentences.chinese: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
sentences.chinese: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

detailed_translations.english: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

name: notoriously
trans: adv.众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地

sentences.english: Derrida famously, notoriously, said "there is nothing outside the text," right? What he meant by that, of course, is that there's nothing but text.
sentences.chinese: 德里达著名地，恶名昭彰地，说道，文本之外什么都没有“,是吧，当然，他意思就是说，需要考虑的只有文本。

name: prepare
trans: vt.准备；使适合；装备；起草vi.预备；做好思想准备

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: unprepared
trans: adj.无准备的；即席的；尚未准备好的

name: preparation
trans: n.预备；准备

sentences.english: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜适合宴会，因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

sentences.english: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
sentences.chinese: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。

sentences.english: a course in food service and food preparation
sentences.chinese: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

detailed_translations.english: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

name: readiness
trans: n.敏捷，迅速；准备就绪；愿意

sentences.english: ...their readiness to co-operate with the new U.S. envoy.
sentences.chinese: …他们乐意与美国的新特使合作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 敏捷，迅速；准备就绪；愿意
detailed_translations.english: when you are prepared for something, or when something is ready to be used

name: reluctant
trans: adj.不情愿的；勉强的；顽抗的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: primary
trans: n.原色；最主要者adj.主要的；初级的；基本的

sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: primarily
trans: adv.首先；主要地，根本上

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: prime
trans: n.初期；青年；精华；全盛时期adj.主要的；最好的；基本的vt.使准备好；填装vi.作准备adv.极好地

sentences.english: Smoking is the prime cause of lung disease.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是引发肺部疾病的首要原因。

sentences.english: Our prime concern is providing jobs for all young school leavers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是为所有的年轻毕业生提供工作。

sentences.english: He was named as the prime suspect in the murder investigation.
sentences.chinese: 在那宗谋杀案的调查中他被定为主要嫌疑人。

sentences.english: Good management is of prime importance in business.
sentences.chinese: 良好的经营管理在商业领域尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: most important
the time in your life when you are strongest and most active
to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

name: refer
trans: vt.涉及；委托；归诸于；使…求助于vi.参考；涉及；提到；查阅

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: reference
trans: n.参考，参照；涉及，提及；参考书目；介绍信；证明书vt.引用vi.引用

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: transfer
trans: n.转让；转移；传递；过户vt.使转移；调任vi.转让；转学；换车

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: transferability
trans: n.可转移性；可转让性

name: consult
trans: vi.请教；商议；当顾问vt.查阅；商量；向…请教

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

name: reflect
trans: vt.反映；反射，照出；表达；显示;反省vi.反射，映现；深思

sentences.english: The drop in consumer spending reflects concern about the economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费支出的下降反映出人们对经济的担忧。

detailed_translations.english: if a person or a thing is reflected in a mirror, glass, or water, you can see an image of the person or thing on the surface of the mirror, glass, or water

name: reflection
trans: n.反射；沉思；映象

sentences.english: Can you see your reflection in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: ...the reflection of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

sentences.english: Inhibition in adulthood seems to be a reflection of a person's experiences as a child.
sentences.chinese: 成年期的压抑似乎是一个人童年经历的一种反映。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: reflexion
trans: n.<主英>反射，反射光;反射作用（等于reflection）

sentences.english: Can you see your reflexion in the glass?
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 你能看到玻璃里你的影像吗？

sentences.english: His speech was an accurate reflexion of the public mood.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 他的讲话是公众情绪的准确反映

sentences.english: ...the reflexion of a beam of light off a mirror.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:  …一束光线在镜面上的反射。

detailed_translations.english: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

name: reflective
trans: adj.反射的；反映的；沉思的

sentences.english: Stick reflective tape on your school bag.
sentences.chinese: 给你的书包贴上反光带。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深思熟虑的；反映的，反射的
detailed_translations.english: a reflective surface reflects light

name: strategy
trans: n.战略，策略

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: strategic
trans: adj.战略上的，战略的

sentences.english: UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队作了战略性撤退。

sentences.english: strategic planning meetings
sentences.chinese: 战略计划会议

sentences.english: a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
sentences.chinese: 把生产转至匈牙利的战略决定

detailed_translations.english: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation

name: tactic
trans: n.策略，战略adj.按顺序的，依次排列的

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

name: skilful
trans: adj.灵巧的;熟练的;技术好的

sentences.english: a skilful footballer
sentences.chinese: 技巧娴熟的足球运动员

detailed_translations.english: good at doing something, especially something that needs special ability or training

name: skillful
trans: adj.熟练的；巧妙的

sentences.english: With a skillful movement he rounded the small fishing-boat.
sentences.chinese: 他以灵巧的动作使小渔船调过头来。

sentences.english: I like making things by hand because my mother is very skillful, and I liked staying with her when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢亲手作一些东西，这是因为我母亲的手非常巧，而且我小的时候喜欢同她在一起。

sentences.english: They understand that development is a difficult social activity that can be conquered not by a silver bullet, but rather by dedicated, skillful practitioners who know and leverage proven techniques.
sentences.chinese: 开发是一项有难度的社会活动，不仅不能够通过银弹来征服，而是由理解并实施可靠技术的那些专注且熟练的人们来解决。

name: trouble
trans: n.麻烦；烦恼；故障；动乱vt.麻烦；使烦恼；折磨vi.费心，烦恼

sentences.english: Recent stock market losses point to trouble ahead.
sentences.chinese: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: problems or difficulties
to say something or ask someone to do something which may use or waste their time or upset them

name: dilemma
trans: n.困境；进退两难；两刀论法

sentences.english: a moral dilemma
sentences.chinese: 道德上进退两难的窘境

sentences.english: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。

sentences.english: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

name: weigh
trans: n.权衡；称重量vt.权衡；考虑；称…重量vi.重量为…；具有重要性；成为…的重荷；起锚

sentences.english: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
sentences.chinese: 雏鸟重量只有几克。

sentences.english: Do you know how much it weighs?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它的重量吗？

sentences.english: (= how much ) do you weigh?
sentences.chinese: 你的体重是多少？

sentences.english: The box was full of books and weighed a ton (= was very heavy ).
sentences.chinese: 这箱子里放满了书，重得很。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular weight

name: weight
trans: n.重量，重力；负担；砝码；重要性vt.加重量于，使变重

sentences.english: The average weight of a baby at birth is just over seven pounds.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿的平均出生体重是七磅多一点。

sentences.english: It can be sewn into curtain hems to weight the curtain and so allow it to hang better.
sentences.chinese: 可以把它缝在窗帘的摺边里以增加窗帘的重量，使之更有下垂感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重量，重力；负担；砝码；重要性
detailed_translations.english: how heavy something is when you measure it
If you weight something, you make it heavier by adding something to it, for example, in order to stop it from moving easily

name: outweigh
trans: vt.比…重（在重量上）；比…重要；比…有价值

sentences.english: The advantages of this deal largely outweigh the disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这笔交易的利远大于弊。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing outweighs another, the first thing is of greater importance, benefit, or significance than the second thing

name: overweight
trans: adj.超重的；过重的vt.使负担过重n.超重

sentences.english: I wonder if this letter is overweight.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道这封信是否超重。

sentences.english: If your luggage is overweight, you'll have to pay extra.
sentences.chinese: 假如你的行李过重了， 你得付额外的运费。

sentences.english: Why are so many of us overweight?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我们中的许多人会超重？

name: obese
trans: adj.肥胖的，过胖的

sentences.english: Obese people tend to have higher blood pressure than lean people.
sentences.chinese: 肥胖的人往往比瘦人血压高。

detailed_translations.english: very fat in a way that is unhealthy

name: obesity
trans: n.肥大，肥胖

sentences.english: So, what of the future of obesity in America?
sentences.chinese: 那么，未来美国的肥胖状况会怎么发展呢？

sentences.english: Dr.Watson is great on exercise as a cure for obesity.
sentences.chinese: 沃森医生把运动看做是治疗肥胖症的良方。

sentences.english: What is obesity?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肥胖？

detailed_translations.english: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

name: worth
trans: n.价值；财产adj.值…的

sentences.english: One of the pictures is worth £50,000.
sentences.chinese: 其中一幅画值5万英镑。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

detailed_translations.english: having a value in money, etc.
how good or useful something is or how important it is to people

name: worthwhile
trans: adj.值得做的，值得花时间的

sentences.english: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
sentences.chinese: 他想做有意义的工作。

sentences.english: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (= one that helps people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

detailed_translations.english: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

name: participate
trans: vi.参与，参加；分享vt.分享；分担

sentences.english: Some members refused to participate.
sentences.chinese: 有些会员拒绝参加。

detailed_translations.english: to take part in an activity or event

name: participant
trans: n.参与者；关系者adj.参与的；有关系的

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

name: participation
trans: n.参与；分享；参股

sentences.english: Thank you for your participation.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的参与。

sentences.english: entertainment with plenty of audience participation
sentences.chinese: 有许多观众参与的娱乐活动

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking part in an activity or event

name: attend
trans: vi.出席；致力于；照料；照顾vt.出席；上（大学等）；照料；招待；陪伴

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: attendance
trans: n.出席；到场；出席人数；考勤

sentences.english: We have an average attendance of 4,000 fans per game.
sentences.chinese: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。

sentences.english: Last year’s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.
sentences.chinese: 去年的交易会有3.2万人参加。

detailed_translations.chinese: 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤
detailed_translations.english: the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc

name: discuss
trans: vt.讨论；论述，辩论

sentences.english: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
sentences.chinese: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。

sentences.english: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想进一步讨论此事，请打电话给我。

sentences.english: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something

name: discussion
trans: n.讨论，议论

sentences.english: class discussions
sentences.chinese: 课堂讨论

sentences.english: the topics suggested for discussion
sentences.chinese: 建议讨论的话题

sentences.english: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

detailed_translations.english: when you discuss something

name: negotiate
trans: vt.谈判，商议；转让；越过vi.谈判，交涉

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: negotiation
trans: n.谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: propose
trans: vi.建议；求婚；打算vt.建议；打算，计划；求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: proposal
trans: n.提议，建议；求婚

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: advise
trans: vt.建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告vi.建议；与…商量

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: advice
trans: n.建议；忠告；劝告；通知

sentences.english: You should have followed my advice.
sentences.chinese: 你真该听我的建议。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion you give someone about what they should do

name: advisable
trans: adj.明智的，可取的，适当的

sentences.english: I deem it advisable to buy property now.
sentences.chinese: 我认为现在购置房地产是明智的。

sentences.english: It would't be advisable for us to kiss off their objections.
sentences.chinese: 对人家的意见不予理睬是不明智的。

name: recommend
trans: vt.推荐，介绍；劝告；使受欢迎；托付vi.推荐；建议

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recommendation
trans: n.推荐；建议；推荐信

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: survive
trans: vi.幸存；活下来vt.幸存；生还；幸免于；比...活得长

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: survival
trans: n.幸存，残存；幸存者，残存物

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

name: vivid
trans: adj.生动的；鲜明的；鲜艳的

sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: revive
trans: vt.使复兴；使苏醒；回想起；重演，重播vi.复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: revival
trans: n.复兴；复活；苏醒；恢复精神；再生效

sentences.english: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
sentences.chinese: 美国和英国对经济复苏有所期待。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something becomes active or strong again

name: outlive
trans: vt.比…活得长；比…经久；经受住；渡过…而存在

sentences.english: She outlived her husband by 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 她比她丈夫多活了20年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比…活得长；比…经久；经受住；渡过…而存在

name: renaissance
trans: n.文艺复兴（欧洲14至17世纪）

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

name: connect
trans: vt.连接；联合；关连vi.连接，连结；联合

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: disconnect
trans: vt.拆开，使分离vi.断开

sentences.english: The family agreed to disconnect her life support system.
sentences.chinese: 家人同意切断她的生命维持系统。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the supply of power, gas, water etc from a machine or piece of equipment

name: connection
trans: n.连接；关系；人脉；连接件

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: connexion
trans: n.连接，联系（等于connection）

sentences.english: The connexion is not a simple derivation.
sentences.chinese: 这种连接并不只是衍生性的。

sentences.english: Syntactics is a subject to study abstract formal connexion among the signs.
sentences.chinese: 符号学是研究符号之间的抽象形式联系的学科。

sentences.english: Frequently consider the connexion of all things in the universe and their relation to one another.
sentences.chinese: 经常考虑宇宙中所有事物的联系和它们的相互关系。

name: combine
trans: n.联合收割机；联合企业vt.使化合；使联合，使结合vi.联合，结合；化合

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: combination
trans: n.结合；组合；联合；化合

sentences.english: a combination nightclub and café
sentences.chinese: 夜总会兼咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

name: contact
trans: n.接触，联系vt.使接触，联系vi.使接触，联系

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

name: constituent
trans: n.成分；选民；委托人adj.构成的；选举的

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

name: joint
trans: n.关节；接缝；接合处，接合点；（牛，羊等的腿）大块肉adj.共同的；连接的；联合的，合办的vt.连接，贴合；接合；使有接头vi.贴合；生节

sentences.english: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

detailed_translations.english: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

name: competition
trans: n.竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: compete
trans: vi.竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: competitive
trans: adj.竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: competitor
trans: n.竞争者，对手

sentences.english: Last year they sold twice as many computers as their competitors.
sentences.chinese: 去年他们的计算机销量是竞争对手的两倍。

detailed_translations.english: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

name: competent
trans: adj.胜任的；有能力的；能干的；足够的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

name: rival
trans: n.对手；竞争者adj.竞争的vt.与…竞争；比得上某人vi.竞争

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

name: employ
trans: n.使用；雇用vt.使用，采用；雇用；使忙于，使从事于

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: employee
trans: n.雇员；从业员工

sentences.english: a government employee
sentences.chinese: 政府雇员

detailed_translations.english: someone who is paid to work for someone else

name: employer
trans: n.雇主，老板

sentences.english: The shoe factory is the largest employer in this area.
sentences.chinese: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

detailed_translations.english: a person, company, or organization that employs people

name: unemployed
trans: adj.失业的；未被利用的

sentences.english: an unemployed actor
sentences.chinese: 没戏演的演员

sentences.english: I’ve only been unemployed for a few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 我只失业了几个星期。

detailed_translations.english: without a job

name: employment
trans: n.使用；职业；雇用

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

name: unemployment
trans: n.失业；失业率；失业人数

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: recruit
trans: n.招聘；新兵；新成员vi.复原；征募新兵；得到补充；恢复健康vt.补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: engineer
trans: n.工程师；工兵；火车司机vt.设计；策划；精明地处理vi.设计；建造
