to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

name: elect
trans: n.被选的人；特殊阶层；上帝的选民adj.选出的；当选的；卓越的vi.作出选择；进行选举vt.选举；选择；推选

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: election
trans: n.选举；当选；选择权；上帝的选拔

sentences.english: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.english: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
sentences.chinese: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

detailed_translations.english: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

name: electoral
trans: adj.选举的；选举人的

name: candidate
trans: n.候选人，候补者；应试者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: confidence
trans: n.信心；信任；秘密adj.（美）诈骗的；骗得信任的

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

name: confident
trans: adj.自信的；确信的

sentences.english: Despite her disability, Philippa is very confident.
sentences.chinese: 菲莉帕虽然有残疾，却很自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确信的， 肯定的； 自信的
detailed_translations.english: sure that something will happen in the way that you want or expect

name: boast
trans: n.自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物vi.自吹自擂vt.夸口说，自吹自擂说；以有…而自豪

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: disease
trans: n.病，疾病；弊病vt.传染；使…有病

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: epidemic
trans: n.传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行adj.流行的；传染性的

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: symptom
trans: n.症状；征兆

sentences.english: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.
sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

name: virus
trans: n.病毒；恶毒；毒害

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: vaccine
trans: n.疫苗；牛痘苗adj.疫苗的；牛痘的

sentences.english: a polio vaccine
sentences.chinese: 小儿麻痹症疫苗

sentences.english: Doctors worried that there would not be enough vaccine for everyone who needed it.
sentences.chinese: 医生担心没有足够的疫苗给每个需要的人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance which contains a weak form of the bacteria or virus that causes a disease and is used to protect people from that disease

name: divorce
trans: n.离婚；分离vt.使离婚，使分离；与…离婚vi.离婚

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: marry
trans: vt.嫁；娶；与……结婚vi.结婚

sentences.english: He married Bea in 1925.
sentences.chinese: 他在1925年娶了贝亚。

sentences.english: I’m going to ask her to marry me on St Valentine’s Day.
sentences.chinese: 我打算在情人节向她求婚。

sentences.english: She married young (= at a young age ) .
sentences.chinese: 她结婚早。

sentences.english: People in higher social classes are more likely to marry late (= when they are older than is usual ) .
sentences.chinese: 社会阶层较高的人士倾向于晚婚。

sentences.english: Sophia had, in a sense, married beneath her (= married someone of a lower social class than her ) .
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在某种意义上是下嫁了。

detailed_translations.english: if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife
if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife

name: marriage
trans: n.结婚；婚姻生活；密切结合，合并

sentences.english: She has three daughters from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她前一次婚姻生了三个女儿。

sentences.english: The marriage took place at St Bartholomew’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼是在圣巴托罗缪教堂举行的。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship between two people who are married, or the state of being married

name: intermarriage
trans: n.联姻，异族结婚；近亲结婚

name: except
trans: conj.除了；要不是prep.除…之外vt.不计；把…除外vi.反对

sentences.english: They were all there except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外他们都在那里。

sentences.english: We all went except him.
sentences.chinese: 除他以外， 我们都去了。

sentences.english: They all howled with laughter except me.
sentences.chinese: 除了我以外，他们全都哈哈大笑起来。

name: exception
trans: n.例外；异议

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: exceptional
trans: n.超常的学生adj.异常的，例外的

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: besides
trans: prep.除…之外adv.此外；而且

sentences.english: I need the money. And besides, when I agree to do something, I do it.
sentences.chinese: 我需要这笔钱，而且，我一旦答应做什么事情就会做到。

sentences.english: The area has stunning scenery, beautiful beaches, and much more besides.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有迷人的景色、美丽的沙滩，除此之外还有很多很多。

detailed_translations.english: used when adding another reason

name: era
trans: n.时代；年代；纪元

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: epochal
trans: adj.划时代的；新纪元的

sentences.english: This led to the next epochal shift.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了下一个划时代的转变。

sentences.english: Any system able to do that would be a truly epochal achievement, but such a miracle is not on the agenda of even the most advanced machine translation developers.
sentences.chinese: 如果有翻译系统能翻译出这些因素，这将是划时代的成就；要知道，即使现在最先进的机器翻译研发机构也不敢将此作为研究目标。

sentences.english: To see why, consider another epochal shift in the development of a rising economic power.
sentences.chinese: 来看看为什么。 考虑到在政府日益增长的经济实力下的另一个划时代的转变。

name: ban
trans: n.禁令，禁忌vt.禁止，取缔

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: prohibit
trans: vt.阻止，禁止

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: exactly
trans: adv.恰好地；正是；精确地；正确地

sentences.english: It’s exactly half past five.
sentences.chinese: 一分不差，正好5点半。

sentences.english: The figures may not be exactly right, but they’re close enough.
sentences.chinese: 那些数字可能不是非常精确，但也相当接近。

sentences.english: That’s exactly what we’ve been trying to tell you.
sentences.chinese: 那正是我们一直想告诉你的。

detailed_translations.english: used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail

name: precisely
trans: adv.精确地；恰恰

sentences.english: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
sentences.chinese: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。

sentences.english: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
sentences.chinese: 她正是我们要找的那种人。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct

name: accurate
trans: adj.精确的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: accuracy
trans: n.精确度，准确性

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: incentive
trans: n.动机；刺激adj.激励的；刺激的

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: propel
trans: vt.推进；驱使；激励；驱策

sentences.english: a boat propelled by a small motor
sentences.chinese: 由小马达驱动的小船

sentences.english: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有名学生无法把她的轮椅推上坡道。

detailed_translations.english: to move, drive, or push something forward

name: motivate
trans: vt.刺激；使有动机；激发…的积极性

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: motivation
trans: n.动机；积极性；推动

name: demotivate
trans: vt.使失去动力；使变得消极

name: stimulate
trans: vi.起刺激作用；起促进作用vt.刺激；鼓舞，激励

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: stimulus
trans: n.刺激；激励；刺激物

sentences.english: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

name: momentum
trans: n.势头；动量；动力；冲力

sentences.english: incentives to maintain the momentum of European integration
sentences.chinese: 保持欧洲一体化发展势头的激励措施

sentences.english: Governments often lose momentum in their second term of office.
sentences.chinese: 政府往往会在第二届任期中丧失冲劲。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

name: literary
trans: adj.文学的；书面的；精通文学的

sentences.english: a literary prize
sentences.chinese: 文学奖

detailed_translations.english: relating to literature

name: literacy
trans: n.读写能力；精通文学

sentences.english: a new adult literacy campaign
sentences.chinese: 新一轮成人识字[扫盲]运动

detailed_translations.chinese: 识字， 有文化， 读写能力
detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to read and write

name: literally
trans: adv.照字面地；逐字地；不夸张地；正确地；简直

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: literate
trans: adj.受过教育的；精通文学的n.学者

sentences.english: The drawback of the internet is that you have to be literate to use it.
sentences.chinese: 互联网的缺点就是人们必须得有文化才能使用它。

detailed_translations.english: able to read and write

name: illiterate
trans: n.文盲adj.文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的

sentences.english: It was an illiterate letter, full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 这封信文笔拙劣，错误连篇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is illiterate has not learned to read or write
someone who has not learned to read or write

name: literature
trans: n.文学；文献；文艺；著作

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

name: nuclear
trans: adj.原子能的；细胞核的；中心的；原子核的

sentences.english: France’s reliance on nuclear energy
sentences.chinese: 法国对核能的依赖

sentences.english: a nuclear power station
sentences.chinese: 核电站

sentences.english: a nuclear-powered submarine
sentences.chinese: 核动力潜艇

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involving the nucleus of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom

name: core
trans: 找不到解释

sentences.english: Remove the cores, and bake the apples for 40 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 去除果心，然后把苹果烤40分钟。

sentences.english: Debt is at the core of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 债务是问题的关键。

detailed_translations.english: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

name: origin
trans: n.起源；原点；出身；开端

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: original
trans: n.原件；原作；原物；原型adj.原始的；最初的；独创的；新颖的

sentences.english: The land was returned to its original owner.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地归还给了原主。

sentences.english: The kitchen still has many original features (= parts that were there when the house was first built ).
sentences.chinese: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。

sentences.english: the original meaning of the word
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的原意

sentences.english: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
sentences.chinese: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening first, before other people or things

name: originally
trans: adv.最初，起初；本来

sentences.english: The family originally came from France.
sentences.chinese: 这个家族最初来自法国。

sentences.english: The building was originally used as a prison.
sentences.chinese: 这幢建筑最初用作监狱。

sentences.english: We originally intended to stay for just a few days.
sentences.chinese: 我们原先打算只逗留几天。

sentences.english: Originally, we had planned a tour of Scotland but we didn’t go in the end.
sentences.chinese: 起先我们计划到苏格兰旅游，但最后没有成行。

detailed_translations.english: in the beginning, before other things happened or before other things changed

name: originate
trans: vt.引起；创作vi.发源；发生；起航

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

name: derive
trans: vt.源于；得自；获得vi.起源

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: stem
trans: n.干；茎；船首；血统vt.阻止；除去…的茎；给…装柄vi.阻止；起源于某事物；逆行

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: perceive
trans: vt.察觉，感觉；理解；认知vi.感到，感知；认识到

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: perception
trans: n.知觉；感觉；看法；洞察力；获取

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

name: detect
trans: vt.察觉；发现；探测

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: strict
trans: adj.严格的；绝对的；精确的；详细的

sentences.english: a strict teacher
sentences.chinese: 严格的老师

detailed_translations.english: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say

name: rigid

sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.chinese: 马丁揭示，在哪些可以追溯到祖先的线粒体基因上，有75%或更多的成分来自当时外来的细菌而非宿主细胞。

sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

name: dominance
trans: n.优势；统治；支配

sentences.chinese: 最近的战斗似乎是冲突各方在试图争夺控制权。

name: confused
trans: v.困惑（confuse的过去式）adj.困惑的；混乱的；糊涂的

name: confusing
trans: v.使迷惑；使混乱不清；使困窘（confuse的ing形式）adj.混乱的；混淆的；令人困惑的

name: chaos
trans: n.混沌，混乱

sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

name: convinced
trans: v.使确信（convince的过去分词）；说服adj.确信的；深信的

name: convincing
trans: v.使相信；使明白（convince的现在分词）adj.令人信服的；有说服力的

sentences.english: convincing evidence of his guilt
sentences.chinese: 证明他有罪的有力证据

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that something is true or right

name: persuade
trans: vt.说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事adj.空闲的，有闲的vi.说服；被说服

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: persuasion
trans: n.说服；说服力；信念；派别

sentences.english: After a little gentle persuasion , Debbie agreed to let us in.
sentences.chinese: 好言劝说了几句后，黛比就同意让我们进去了。

sentences.english: It had taken a great deal of persuasion to get him to accept.
sentences.chinese: 费尽了口舌才让他接受。

sentences.english: She used all her powers of persuasion (= skill at persuading people ) to convince Tilly that it was the right thing to do.
sentences.chinese: 她使尽浑身解数，才劝服蒂莉应该那么做。

detailed_translations.english: the act of persuading someone to do something

name: persuasive
trans: adj.有说服力的；劝诱的，劝说的

sentences.english: In either case it is persuasive because there is somebody whom it persuades.
sentences.chinese: 不管在那种情况下，它之所以有说服力，是因为有人被说服了。

sentences.english: Providing examples of what others are saying about your suitability and skills is extremely persuasive and the more you have, the more your influence rises.
sentences.chinese: 举例说明别人对你的适合性和技能的评价十分有说服力，这样的例子越多，你的影响力增长的就越大。

name: electronic
trans: adj.电子的n.电子电路；电子器件

sentences.english: electronic games
sentences.chinese: 电子游戏

sentences.english: an electronic organizer (= a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc )
sentences.chinese: 电子记事本

detailed_translations.english: electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc

name: electric
trans: n.电；电气车辆；带电体adj.电的；电动的；发电的；导电的；令人震惊的

sentences.english: an electric blanket
sentences.chinese: 电热毯

detailed_translations.english: needing electricity to work, produced by electricity, or used for carrying electricity

name: electricity
trans: n.电力；电流；强烈的紧张情绪

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: electrical
trans: adj.有关电的；电气科学的

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: electrify
trans: vt.使电气化；使充电；使触电；使激动

sentences.english: She would sit at the piano and sing, electrifying us all.
sentences.chinese: 她会边弹钢琴边唱歌，使我们大家兴奋不已。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使电气化；使充电；使触电；使激动
detailed_translations.english: if a performance or a speech electrifies people, it makes them feel very interested or excited

name: entire
trans: adj.全部的，整个的；全体的

sentences.english: It was the worst day in my entire life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。

sentences.english: The entire staff agreed.
sentences.chinese: 全体员工都同意了。

sentences.english: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
sentences.chinese: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc

name: entirely
trans: adv.完全地，彻底地

sentences.english: Our situation is entirely different.
sentences.chinese: 我们的处境完全不同。

sentences.english: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
sentences.chinese: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。

sentences.english: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
sentences.chinese: 她的理由不是很明确。

detailed_translations.english: completely and in every possible way

name: overall
trans: adj.全部的；全体的；一切在内的adv.全部地；总的说来n.工装裤；罩衫

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: holistic
trans: adj.整体的；全盘的

sentences.english: a holistic approach to design
sentences.chinese: 设计的整体方法

detailed_translations.english: considering a person or thing as a whole, rather than as separate parts

name: wholly
trans: adv.完全地；全部；统统

sentences.english: a wholly satisfactory solution
sentences.chinese: 完全令人满意的解决办法

sentences.english: The report claimed that the disaster was wholly unavoidable.
sentences.chinese: 报告称这场灾难完全无法避免。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: absolute
trans: n.绝对；绝对事物adj.绝对的；完全的；专制的

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: engage
trans: vi.从事；答应，保证；交战；啮合vt.吸引，占用；使参加；雇佣；使订婚；预定

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: engagement
trans: n.婚约；约会；交战；诺言n.参与度（指用户点赞、转发、评论、下载文档、观看视频、咨询等交互行为）

sentences.english: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。

sentences.english: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。

detailed_translations.english: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

name: occupy
trans: vt.占据，占领；居住；使忙碌

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: occupation
trans: n.职业；占有；消遣；占有期

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

name: object
trans: n.目标；物体；客体；宾语vt.提出…作为反对的理由vi.反对；拒绝

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: objection
trans: n.异议，反对；缺陷，缺点；妨碍；拒绝的理由

sentences.english: Her objection was that he was too young.
sentences.chinese: 她反对的理由是他太小。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 异议； 反对的理由
detailed_translations.english: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

name: objective
trans: adj.客观的；目标的；宾格的n.目的；目标；物镜；宾格

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: objectivity
trans: n.客观；客观性

name: target
trans: n.目标；靶子vt.把……作为目标；规定……的指标；瞄准某物

sentences.english: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time
to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

name: refuse
trans: n.垃圾；废物vi.拒绝vt.拒绝；不愿；抵制

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: reject
trans: n.被弃之物或人；次品vt.拒绝；排斥；抵制；丢弃

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: rejection
trans: n.抛弃；拒绝；被抛弃的东西；盖帽

sentences.english: They sent me a rejection letter.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我发了一封回绝信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of not accepting, believing in, or agreeing with something

name: deny
trans: vi.否认；拒绝vt.否定，否认；拒绝给予；拒绝…的要求

sentences.english: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

name: vary
trans: vi.变化；变异；违反vt.改变；使多样化；变奏

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: variation
trans: n.变化；变异，变种

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

name: variety
trans: n.多样；种类；杂耍；变化，多样化

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

name: variable
trans: n.变量；可变物，可变因素adj.变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，畸变的

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: varying
trans: adj.不同的；变化的v.变化，改变（vary的现在分词）

name: various
trans: adj.各种各样的；多方面的

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: diverse
trans: adj.不同的；多种多样的；变化多的

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: diversity
trans: n.多样性；差异

sentences.english: ...the cultural diversity of Latin America.
sentences.chinese: …拉丁美洲文化的多样性。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of including many different types of people or things

name: poverty
trans: n.贫困；困难；缺少；低劣

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: antipoverty
trans: adj.反贫穷的n.反贫穷的<美>（尤指政府倡议的）反贫穷计划

name: impoverished
trans: adj.穷困的；用尽了的，无创造性的v.使贫困（impoverish的过去分词）

sentences.english: It is the lament of an impoverished peasant.
sentences.chinese: 它是一个已贫穷化的农民的哀词。

sentences.english: He dropped the gold down the chimney to save face for the impoverished father.
sentences.chinese: 他将黄金扔进烟囱以保留这位穷困的父亲的脸面。

sentences.english: The grants did give new opportunities to many impoverished farmers from the East and Midwest, but much of the land granted under the Homestead Act fell quickly into the hands of speculators.
sentences.chinese: 这些赠拨确实了为来自东部和中西部穷困潦倒的农民带来了一个新的机遇，但是大部分《宅地法》赠拨的土地很快落入了投机者的手中。

name: optimistic
trans: adj.乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: optimism
trans: n.乐观；乐观主义

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

name: optimist
trans: n.乐观主义者；乐天派

sentences.english: He’s an eternal optimist (= he always believes that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 他是个永远的乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that good things will happen

name: optimise
trans: vt.使优化；充分利用vi.表示乐观

sentences.english: Even the positioning of a window to optimise daylight can help save energy.
sentences.chinese: 连充分利用日光的窗户都是节能的。

name: optimize
trans: vt.使最优化，使完善vi.优化；持乐观态度

sentences.english: They need to optimize the use of available resources.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要充分利用手上的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the way that something is done or used so that it is as effective as possible

name: pessimistic
trans: adj.悲观的，厌世的；悲观主义的

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

name: modify
trans: vt.修改，修饰；更改vi.修改

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: modification
trans: n.修改，修正；改变

sentences.english: They have used the same process for almost 50 years with only minor modifications.
sentences.chinese: 同样的工序他们用了将近50年，期间只做过很小的改动。

detailed_translations.english: a small change made in something such as a design, plan, or system

name: revise
trans: n.修订；校订vi.修订；校订；复习功课vt.修正；复习；校订

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: revision
trans: n.修正；复习；修订本

sentences.english: I know I haven’t done enough revision for tomorrow’s exam.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我对明天的考试准备不足。

detailed_translations.english: the process of changing something in order to improve it by correcting it or including new information or ideas

name: amendment
trans: n.修正案；改善；改正

sentences.english: constitutional amendments
sentences.chinese: 宪法修正案

detailed_translations.english: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this

name: sight
trans: n.视力；景象；眼界；见解adj.见票即付的；即席的vt.看见；瞄准vi.瞄准；观看

sentences.english: Anne’s sight is very good for someone of her age.
sentences.chinese: 安妮的视力对于她这个年龄的人来说算是非常好的。

sentences.english: He began to lose his sight six years ago.
sentences.chinese: 六年前他开始视力衰退。

sentences.english: an emergency operation to save his sight
sentences.chinese: 挽救他视力的紧急手术

sentences.english: You will get a free sight test if you are under 16.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不满16岁，可以免费检查视力。

detailed_translations.english: the physical ability to see
to see something from a long distance away, or see something you have been looking for

name: insight
trans: n.洞察力；洞悉

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: horizon
trans: n.地平线；视野；眼界；范围

sentences.english: In the distance, the dot of a boat appeared on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 远处小黑点般的一条小船出现在地平线上。

sentences.english: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
sentences.chinese: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

detailed_translations.english: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

name: active
trans: n.主动语态；积极分子adj.积极的；活跃的；主动的；有效的；现役的

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: activate
trans: vt.刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性vi.激活；有活力

sentences.english: Cooking fumes may activate the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 烹调时的油烟可能会触发警报器。

sentences.english: The yeast’s growth is activated by sugar and warmth.
sentences.chinese: 糖分和温暖的环境会激发酵母菌的生长。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激；使活动；使活泼；使产生放射性
detailed_translations.english: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

name: liveliness
trans: n.活泼；热烈；鲜明

sentences.english: We need to consolidate and develop the current political situation of democracy, solidarity, liveliness, stability and harmony.
sentences.chinese: 我们要巩固和发展民主团结、生动活泼、安定和谐的政治局面。

sentences.english: His understanding and opinions all please me; he wants nothing but a little more  liveliness, and that, if he marry  prudently, his wife may teach him.
sentences.chinese: 他的见识，他的言论，我都很喜欢。 他没有任何缺点，只不过稍欠活泼；关于这一点，只要他结婚结得当心一些，娶个好太太，他也许会让她给教好的。

sentences.english: She was really but a child, fresh, vivacious and aloof; it seemed that she always shook off every unpleasant thought with a liveliness that was, at once, charming, ingenuous and roguish.
sentences.chinese: 她确实还只是个孩子，容光焕发，性情活泼，而又态度孤傲；似乎她随时能用她那娇媚、天真、淘气的活泼抖落掉一切不愉快的心思。

name: adapt
trans: vi.适应vt.使适应；改编

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: adaptable
trans: adj.适合的；能适应的；可修改的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

name: adjust
trans: vt.调整，使…适合；校准vi.调整，校准；适应

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

name: readjust
trans: vt.使…重新调整；使…重新适应vi.再调整；重新适应

sentences.english: It takes time to readjust after a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 离婚后需要时间重新适应。

detailed_translations.english: to get used to a new situation, job, or way of life

name: adjustment
trans: n.调整，调节；调节器

sentences.english: a period of adjustment
sentences.chinese: 一段调整期

detailed_translations.english: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation

name: adopt
trans: vi.采取；过继vt.采取；接受；收养；正式通过

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: adoption
trans: n.采用；收养；接受

sentences.english: She decided to put the baby up for adoption .
sentences.chinese: 她决定让人收养那个婴儿。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of adopting a child

name: adoptive
trans: adj.采用的；有收养关系的

sentences.english: He was brought up by adoptive parents in Kentucky.
sentences.chinese: 他是被他在肯塔基州的养父母抚养大的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收养关系的； 采用的
detailed_translations.english: an adoptive parent is one who has adopted a child

name: delay
trans: n.延期；耽搁；被耽搁或推迟的时间vt.延期；耽搁vi.延期；耽搁

sentences.english: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
sentences.chinese: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。

sentences.english: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
sentences.chinese: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上，他推迟作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to wait until a later time to do something

name: defer
trans: vt.使推迟；使延期vi.推迟；延期；服从

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

name: postpone
trans: vt.使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面vi.延缓，延迟；延缓发作

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: fix
trans: n.困境；方位；贿赂vt.使固定；修理；安装；准备vi.固定；注视

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: instalment
trans: n.分期付款；装设；就职

sentences.english: the second instalment of a loan
sentences.chinese: 一项贷款的第二期还款

sentences.english: They’re letting me pay for the washing machine by monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 他们允许我以每月分期付款的方式买下这台洗衣机。

detailed_translations.english: one of a series of regular payments that you make until you have paid all the money you owe

name: installment
trans: n.安装；分期付款；部分；就职

sentences.english: Now she can reduce the installment size that she can afford to pay, by extending the loan period.
sentences.chinese: 现在，她就可通过展延贷款周期来减小自己有能力支付的分期付款的规模。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分期付款， 分期交付； 部分

name: privilege
trans: n.特权；优待vt.给与…特权；特免

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: prioritise
trans: vt.给予...优先权；按优先顺序处理vi.把事情按优先顺序排好（等于prioritize）

name: prioritize
trans: vt.把…区分优先次序vi.把事情按优先顺序排好

sentences.english: You need to prioritize your tasks.
sentences.chinese: 你需要按照轻重缓急安排自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to put several things, problems etc in order of importance, so that you can deal with the most important ones first

name: priority
trans: n.优先；优先权；优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: prior
trans: adj.优先的；在先的，在前的adv.在前，居先

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: react
trans: vi.反应；影响；反抗；起反作用vt.使发生相互作用；使起化学反应

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: reaction
trans: n.反应，感应；反动，复古；反作用

sentences.english: What was Jeff’s reaction when you told him about the job?
sentences.chinese: 你告诉杰夫这个工作时，他是什么反应？

detailed_translations.english: something that you feel or do because of something that has happened or been said

name: reactor
trans: n.反应器；反应堆；起反应的人

sentences.english: Where do you all live? Do you live near a reactor?
sentences.chinese: 你们都住在哪，你们接近一个反应堆吗？

sentences.english: Then you have, in terms of the barrier integrity, reactor cooling systems activity, cladding failure.
sentences.chinese: 然后你们会有，在屏障完整性，反应堆冷却系统行为，覆盖层失效。

sentences.english: For almost three years, AECL went through its calculations, but nothing changed: if its model of how the reactor functioned was correct, the PCR should be negative.
sentences.chinese: 在将近三年中，AECL仔细检查了枫叶的计算过程，但结果仍然如此：如果它的反应堆运行模式无误，那么PCR就应该是负值。

detailed_translations.english: a  nuclear reactor

name: religion
trans: n.宗教；宗教信仰

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: religious
trans: n.修道士；尼姑adj.宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；修道的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: ritual
trans: n.仪式；惯例；礼制adj.仪式的；例行的；礼节性的

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: sacred
trans: adj.神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: pilgrim
trans: n.朝圣者；漫游者；（美）最初的移民vi.去朝圣；漫游

sentences.english: pilgrims visiting a holy shrine
sentences.chinese: 祭拜圣庙的朝圣者

detailed_translations.chinese: 朝圣者；漫游者；（美）最初的移民
detailed_translations.english: a religious person who travels a long way to a holy place

name: Catholicism
trans: n.天主教；天主教义

sentences.english: ...her conversion to Catholicism.
sentences.chinese: … 她对天主教的皈依。

detailed_translations.english: Catholicism is the traditions, the behaviour, and the set of Christian beliefs that are held by Catholics

name: doctrine
trans: n.主义；学说；教义；信条

sentences.english: traditional doctrines of divine power
sentences.chinese: 神力的传统教义

sentences.english: Marxist doctrine
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义学说

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

name: stable
trans: n.马厩；牛棚adj.稳定的；牢固的；坚定的vt.赶入马房vi.被关在马厩

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: stability
trans: n.稳定性；坚定，恒心

sentences.english: a period of relative stability
sentences.chinese: 相对稳定的一段时期

detailed_translations.english: the condition of being steady and not changing

name: stabilise
trans: vt.使…坚固；使…安定；装稳定器（等于stablize）vi.稳定；安定

sentences.english: However, after three weeks of cold exposure, body weight began to stabilise.
sentences.chinese: 不过，暴露在寒冷中三周后，体重就开始稳定下来。

sentences.english: But these will not stabilise levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide — only slow the rate of increase.
sentences.chinese: 但是这无法稳定大气中的二氧化碳水平——而只能降低增加的速率。

name: stabilize
trans: vt.使稳固，使安定vi.稳定，安定

sentences.english: The patient’s condition has now stabilized.
sentences.chinese: 病人的情况现已稳定下来了。

sentences.english: an attempt to stabilize the economy
sentences.chinese: 稳定经济的努力

detailed_translations.english: to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something firm or steady

name: steady
trans: n.关系固定的情侣；固定支架adj.稳定的；不变的；沉着的vt.使稳定；稳固；使坚定adv.稳定地；稳固地vi.稳固

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

name: suit
trans: n.诉讼；恳求；套装，西装；一套外衣vt.适合；使适应vi.合适；相称

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: suitable
trans: adj.适当的；相配的

sentences.english: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

detailed_translations.english: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation

name: appropriate
trans: adj.适当的；恰当的；合适的vt.占用，拨出

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: proper
trans: adj.适当的；本身的；特有的；正派的adv.完全地

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

name: properly
trans: adv.适当地；正确地；恰当地

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: file
trans: n.文件；档案；文件夹；锉刀vt.提出；锉；琢磨；把…归档vi.列队行进；用锉刀锉

sentences.english: We will keep your details on file (= store them for later use ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们将把你的详细资料存档。

sentences.english: The contracts are filed alphabetically.
sentences.chinese: 这些合同是按字母顺序归档的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject
to keep papers, documents etc in a particular place so that you can find them easily

name: upset
trans: n.混乱；翻倒；颠覆adj.心烦的；混乱的；弄翻的vt.使心烦；颠覆；扰乱vi.翻倒

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?

sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: permit
trans: n.许可证，执照vt.许可；允许vi.许可；允许

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: permission
trans: n.允许，许可

sentences.english: He asked permission to leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 他请求离开房间的许可。

sentences.english: They cannot leave the country without permission.
sentences.chinese: 没有许可他们不得离开这个国家。

detailed_translations.english: the act of allowing sb to do sth, especially when this is done by sb in a position of authority

name: permissive
trans: adj.许可的；自由的；宽容的；（两性关系）放纵的

sentences.english: parents who are too permissive
sentences.chinese: 太过放任的父母

sentences.english: a permissive society
sentences.chinese: 放纵的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 许可的；自由的；宽容的；（两性关系）放纵的
detailed_translations.english: not strict, and allowing behaviour that many other people would disapprove of

name: admission
trans: n.承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: license
trans: n.执照，许可证；特许vt.许可；特许；发许可证给

sentences.english: No special license will be regranted to anyone from now on.
sentences.chinese: 特殊许可证今后不得向任何人再行发放。

sentences.english: Remind me to renew the driver's license.It will lapse next month.
sentences.chinese: 提醒我更换驾驶执照，它下个月就失效了。

sentences.english: The next time the client connects to the server, it will obtain another license.
sentences.chinese: 在客户端下一次连接到服务器时，它将获得另一个许可证。

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

name: licence
trans: n.许可证，执照；特许vt.特许，许可；发给执照

sentences.english: The dealers applied for an export licence.
sentences.chinese: 经销商申请了出口许可证。

sentences.english: He was arrested for driving without a license.
sentences.chinese: 他因无照驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: The Tennessee Valley Authority applied for a license to operate the facility.
sentences.chinese: 田纳西河谷管理局申请了这个场所的经营执照。

sentences.english: The owner of land could grant a licence to cut and remove timber.
sentences.chinese: 土地所有者可发执照授权砍伐和运走木材。

sentences.english: I forgot to renew my licence.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记去办理执照展期了。

sentences.english: Persistent offenders face losing their licence.
sentences.chinese: 多次违规者将会被没收执照。

detailed_translations.english: an official document giving you permission to own or do something for a period of time

name: modest
trans: adj.谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: moderate
trans: adj.稳健的，温和的；适度的，中等的；有节制的vi.变缓和，变弱vt.节制；减轻

sentences.english: Even moderate amounts of alcohol can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒即使不多也会有危险。

sentences.english: a moderate degree of success
sentences.chinese: 一定程度上的成功

sentences.english: a student of moderate ability
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

sentences.english: Moderate exercise, such as walking, is recommended.
sentences.chinese: 建议适度锻炼，比如散步。

sentences.english: Bake the pie for 30 minutes in a moderate oven.
sentences.chinese: 馅饼用中火烘烤30分钟。

sentences.english: moderate to strong winds
sentences.chinese: 中到大风

detailed_translations.english: not very large or very small, very hot or very cold, very fast or very slow etc
someone whose opinions or beliefs, especially about politics, are not extreme and are considered reasonable by most people
to make something less extreme or violent, or to become less extreme or violent

name: proportion
trans: n.比例，占比；部分；面积；均衡vt.使成比例；使均衡；分摊

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: disproportionately
trans: adv.不成比例地

sentences.english: Johnson’s aversion to this tax was part of his reluctance to ask for any sacrifices for the Vietnam War -- except from the disproportionately blue-collar army that was fighting it.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对这项税的反感，部分是因为除了浴血奋战的不成比例的蓝领军人外，他犹豫要不要要求其他人为越战做出一点点牺牲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比例不均地，不成比例地

name: percent
trans: n.百分比，百分率；部分；百分数adj.百分之…的adv.以百分之…地

sentences.english: At the end of the day, add up the percent DVs.
sentences.chinese: 在一天结束后，把所有营养素的百分比加起来。

sentences.english: Machines are delivering up to only 25 percent of the fuel they combust.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转效率只能达到所耗燃料的百分之二十五。

sentences.english: But there are billions more people out there who are not in the top one percent, and they’re not in the top two or three either.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有十亿多的人不在其中，他们不在其中的百分之一，也不再其中的两百分之一或者三百分之一的其中。

name: percentage
trans: n.百分比；百分率，百分数

sentences.english: Interest rates fell by six percentage points (= 6% ) .
sentences.chinese: 利息下降了6个百分点。

sentences.english: The numbers are small in percentage terms (= when calculated as a percentage ) .
sentences.chinese: 按百分比来看，这些数字很小。

detailed_translations.english: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

name: schedule
trans: n.时间表；计划表；一览表vt.安排，计划；编制目录；将……列入计划表

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: agenda
trans: n.议程；日常工作事项；日程表

sentences.english: The Republicans have stuck to their conservative agenda.
sentences.chinese: 共和党人坚持自己的保守议题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 议程；日常工作事项；日程表
detailed_translations.english: a list of problems or subjects that a government, organization etc is planning to deal with

name: strain
trans: n.张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘vt.拉紧；滥用；滤去；竭力vi.拉紧；尽力n.（植物、动物的）品种；种类

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: constrain
trans: vt.驱使；强迫；束缚

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: constraint
trans: n.约束；局促，态度不自然；强制

sentences.english: the constraints of family life
sentences.chinese: 家庭生活的约束

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 约束；局促，态度不自然；强制
detailed_translations.english: something that limits your freedom to do what you want

name: restrain
trans: vt.抑制，控制；约束；制止

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: restraint
trans: n.抑制，克制；约束

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

name: bind
trans: n.捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓vt.绑；约束；装订；包扎；凝固vi.结合；装订；有约束力；过紧

sentences.english: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
sentences.chinese: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧
detailed_translations.english: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓
detailed_translations.english: an annoying or difficult situation

name: trait
trans: n.特性，特点；品质；少许

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: portrait
trans: n.肖像；描写；半身雕塑像

sentences.english: a family portrait
sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.english: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person

name: portray
trans: vt.描绘；扮演

sentences.english: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.english: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
sentences.chinese: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

detailed_translations.english: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

name: furthermore
trans: adv.此外；而且

sentences.english: He is old and unpopular. Furthermore, he has at best only two years of political life ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 他年纪已老，又不得人心，而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

detailed_translations.english: in addition to what has already been said

name: moreover
trans: adv.而且；此外

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: emission
trans: n.（光、热等的）发射，散发；喷射；发行

sentences.english: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 向大气排放二氧化碳

sentences.english: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
sentences.chinese: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

detailed_translations.english: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

name: emit
trans: vt.发出，放射；发行；发表

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: launch
trans: vt.发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使…下水vi.开始；下水；起飞n.发射；发行，投放市场；下水；汽艇

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: entitle
trans: vt.称做…；定名为…；给…称号；使…有权利

sentences.english: They understood that our power alone cannot protect us, nor does it entitle us to do as we please.
sentences.chinese: 他们懂得单凭实力无法保护我们的安全，实力也并不赋予我们随心所欲的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the official right to do or have something

name: subtitle
trans: n.副标题；说明或对白的字幕vt.在…上印字幕；给…加副标题

sentences.english: a French film with English subtitles
sentences.chinese: 附有英语字幕的法国电影

sentences.english: "Lorna Doone" is subtitled "a Romance of Exmoor."
sentences.chinese: 《洛娜·杜恩》的副标题是《埃克斯穆尔的一个浪漫故事》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副标题；说明或对白的字幕
detailed_translations.english: the words printed over a film in a foreign language to translate what is being said by the actors

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…上印字幕；给…加副标题
detailed_translations.english: If you say how a book or play is subtitled, you say what its subtitle is

name: hijack
trans: n.劫持；威逼；敲诈vt.抢劫；揩油vi.拦路抢劫

sentences.english: The airliner was hijacked by a group of terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 该航班被一帮恐怖分子劫持。

detailed_translations.english: to use violence or threats to take control of a plane, vehicle, or ship
when a plane, vehicle etc is hijacked

name: poach
trans: vt.水煮；偷猎；窃取；把…踏成泥浆vi.偷猎；侵犯；剽窃

sentences.english: Deer have been poached here for years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来这里一直有人偷偷地猎鹿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 水煮；偷猎；窃取；把…踏成泥浆
detailed_translations.english: to illegally catch or shoot animals, birds, or fish, especially on private land without permission

name: imitate
trans: vt.模仿，仿效；仿造，仿制

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

name: imitation
trans: n.模仿，仿造；仿制品adj.人造的，仿制的

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

name: inflation
trans: n.膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: inflate
trans: vt.使充气；使通货膨胀vi.膨胀；充气

sentences.english: It took us half an hour to inflate the dinghy.
sentences.chinese: 我们用了半小时给橡皮筏充好气。

sentences.english: Her life jacket failed to inflate.
sentences.chinese: 她的救生衣未能充进去气。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something with air or gas so it becomes larger, or to become filled with air or gas

name: fluctuate
trans: vi.波动；涨落；动摇vt.使波动；使动摇

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: fluctuant
trans: adj.变动的；波动的；起伏的

name: fluctuation
trans: n.起伏，波动

sentences.english: Prices are subject to fluctuation.
sentences.chinese: 价格可能会有波动。

detailed_translations.english: a change in a price, amount, level etc

name: afloat
trans: adj.在海上的；飘浮的；浸满水的；在传播的adv.在海上；飘浮著；浸满水

sentences.english: They talked modestly of their valiant efforts to keep the tanker afloat.
sentences.chinese: 他们谦虚地谈论了他们为让油轮保持不沉而付出的英勇努力。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something is afloat, they remain partly above the surface of water and do not sink

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂浮的；有偿债能力的，能维持下去的
detailed_translations.english: floating on water

name: circulation
trans: n.流通，传播；循环；发行量

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: biological
trans: adj.生物的；生物学的

sentences.english: the biological functions of the body
sentences.chinese: 人体的生物机能

sentences.english: Depression is both biological and psychological.
sentences.chinese: 抑郁症与生理和心理都有关系。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the natural processes performed by living things

name: biologically
trans: adv.生物学上，生物学地

sentences.english: We also, biologically, don't compensate for these calories when we eat.
sentences.chinese: 而且，生物学上，我们在吃时不赔偿这些卡路里。

sentences.english: But she pointed out that dreams arise biologically from the human mind, while video games are technologically driven by computers and gaming consoles.
sentences.chinese: 但是，她指出从生物学上讲梦来自于人的思维，而视频游戏在技术角度上由电脑和游戏终端来驱动的。

sentences.english: While the authors speculate that an increased risk could be biologically plausible given that calcium is connected with hardening of the arteries, another expert thinks not.
sentences.chinese: 然而作者们觉得增加的风险在生物学上似乎是可信的，他们指出钙跟动脉硬化有关系，另一名专家却不这样认为。

name: biologist
trans: n.生物学家

sentences.english: Similarly, every time a biologist discovers a new species, there is the opportunity to honour someone or something.
sentences.chinese: 类似地，每次一位生物学家发现一个新物种，就又有了一个纪念某人或某事的机会。

sentences.english: One biologist developed a formula for how much genetic material would have to be to saved in the act of altruism for it to be worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家发展了一套公式，用来计算到底有多少遗传物质可以被保留下来的时候，利他的行为才是值得的。

sentences.english: An evolutionary biologist would say physical activity is the only voluntary means you have of varying or regulating your energy expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 一个进化生物学家会说体力活动是唯一的志愿就是你的不同或管理您的能源开支的。

sentences.chinese: 一件真正的大师之作

sentences.chinese: 博士论文

sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.

sentences.chinese: 全部运算在三秒内完成。

sentences.chinese: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。
