sentences.english: computers which can be used by untrained operators
sentences.chinese: 未经训练的操作者也可使用的电脑

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a telephone switchboard, who you can call for help

name: sponsor
trans: n.赞助者；主办者；保证人vt.赞助；发起

sentences.english: When you define the project, you make sure that you have an agreement with the project sponsor on what work should be completed in this project.
sentences.chinese: 在你定义项目的时候，你要确保和项目发起人在项目应该完成的所有工作内容上达成一致意见。

sentences.english: It is important that your sponsor be truly committed to the value of the project to ensure that funds and support are not in jeopardy if adoption is not immediate.
sentences.chinese: 发起人必须真正认可项目的价值，这一点很重要，只有这样才能确保在推广没有立即见效时资金和支持不会随之消失。

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law

name: sponsorship
trans: n.赞助；发起；保证人的地位；教父母身份

name: mere
trans: adj.仅仅的；只不过的n.小湖；池塘

sentences.english: She lost the election by a mere 20 votes.
sentences.chinese: 她仅仅以20票之差落选。

name: merely
trans: adv.仅仅，只不过；只是

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

name: bare
trans: adj.空的；赤裸的，无遮蔽的vt.露出，使赤裸

sentences.english: a ragged child with bare feet
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛、光着脚的小孩

sentences.english: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

sentences.english: He got 40% – a bare pass.
sentences.chinese: 他得了40分，勉强及格。

detailed_translations.english: not covered by clothes

name: barely
trans: adv.仅仅，勉强；几乎不；公开地；贫乏地

sentences.english: She was barely aware of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 她几乎没有注意到他的存在。

sentences.english: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
sentences.chinese: 乔和他哥哥几乎不说话。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: trace
trans: n.痕迹，踪迹；微量；迹线；缰绳vt.追踪，查探；描绘；回溯vi.追溯；沿路走

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: track
trans: n.轨道；足迹，踪迹；小道vt.追踪；通过；循路而行；用纤拉vi.追踪；走；留下足迹

sentences.english: Police have been tracking the four criminals all over Central America.
sentences.chinese: 警方一直在中美洲到处追捕这四名罪犯。

detailed_translations.english: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc
a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

name: hint
trans: n.暗示；线索vt.暗示；示意vi.示意

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

name: cue
trans: n.提示，暗示；线索vt.给…暗示

sentences.english: She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.chinese: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

detailed_translations.english: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance

name: intuitive
trans: adj.直觉的；凭直觉获知的

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: intuition
trans: n.直觉；直觉力；直觉的知识

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

name: illusion
trans: n.幻觉，错觉；错误的观念或信仰

sentences.english: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.chinese: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.english: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.chinese: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.english: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.english: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.chinese: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幻想， 错误的观念； 错觉， 幻觉， 假象
detailed_translations.english: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

name: illusory
trans: adj.错觉的；幻影的；虚假的；产生幻觉的

sentences.english: First impressions can often prove illusory.
sentences.chinese: 第一印象往往被证明是不真实的。

detailed_translations.english: false but seeming to be real or true

name: platform
trans: n.平台；月台，站台；坛；讲台

sentences.english: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
sentences.chinese: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.english: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.chinese: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.english: an oil exploration platform
sentences.chinese: 石油勘探平台

detailed_translations.english: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

name: plateau
trans: n.高原n.普拉托n.（活动或进程中的）稳定阶段，停滞时期adj.高原印第安人的

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

name: default
trans: n.违约；缺席；缺乏；系统默认值vt.不履行；不参加（比赛等）；对…处以缺席裁判vi.拖欠；不履行；不到场

sentences.english: Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.
sentences.chinese: 按揭借款违约在近一年里呈上升趋势。

sentences.english: to default on a loan/debt
sentences.chinese: 拖欠借款 / 债务

detailed_translations.english: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

name: betray
trans: vt.背叛；出卖；泄露（秘密）；露出…迹象

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: summit
trans: n.顶点；最高级会议；最高阶层adj.最高级的；政府首脑的

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: peak
trans: n.山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌adj.最高的；最大值的vt.使达到最高点；使竖起vi.消瘦；到达最高点；变憔悴

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: odd
trans: adj.奇数的；古怪的；剩余的；临时的；零散的n.奇数；怪人；奇特的事物

sentences.english: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.english: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

detailed_translations.english: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

name: odds
trans: n.几率；胜算；不平等；差别

sentences.english: (= it is likely ) that he will commit the same crime again.
sentences.chinese: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

sentences.english: (= how likely is it ) that they will mess up?
sentences.chinese: 他们失败的可能性有多大？

sentences.english: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded (= it was not likely to succeed, but it did )
sentences.chinese: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

detailed_translations.english: how likely it is that something will or will not happen

name: weird
trans: n.（苏格兰）命运；预言adj.怪异的；不可思议的；超自然的

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: cooperate
trans: vi.合作，配合；协力

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: cooperation
trans: n.合作，协作；协力

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

name: cooperative
trans: n.合作社adj.合作的；合作社的

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

name: collaborate
trans: vi.合作；勾结，通敌

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: collaboration
trans: n.合作；勾结；通敌

sentences.english: The company is building the centre in collaboration with the Institute of Offshore Engineering.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正与海洋工程学院合建这座中心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合作， 协作； 勾结
detailed_translations.english: when you work together with another person or group to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: collaborative
trans: adj.合作的，协作的

sentences.english: ...a collaborative research project.
sentences.chinese: …一个合作研究项目。

detailed_translations.english: a job or piece of work that involves two or more people working together to achieve something

name: provoke
trans: vt.驱使；激怒；煽动；惹起

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: evoke
trans: vt.引起，唤起；博得

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: advocate
trans: n.提倡者；支持者；律师vt.提倡，主张，拥护

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: trigger
trans: n.扳机；触发器；制滑机vt.引发，引起；触发vi.松开扳柄

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: spark
trans: n.火花；朝气；闪光vt.发动；鼓舞；求婚vi.闪烁；发火花；求婚

sentences.english: sparks from the fire
sentences.chinese: 火里飞出的火星

sentences.english: The scrape of metal on metal sent up a shower of sparks .
sentences.chinese: 金属之间互相摩擦，迸出一串火星。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together
a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

name: fortune
trans: n.财富；命运；运气vt.给予财富vi.偶然发生

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

name: fortunate
trans: adj.幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

name: unfortunate
trans: adj.不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的

sentences.english: When we entered the room, the teacher was yelling at some unfortunate student.
sentences.chinese: 我们进教室的时候，老师正在对着一个倒霉的学生吼叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is unfortunate has something bad happen to them

name: fortunately
trans: adv.幸运地

sentences.english: Fortunately, everything worked out all right in the end.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，最后一切顺利。

detailed_translations.english: happening because of good luck

name: unfortunately
trans: adv.不幸地

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

name: destiny
trans: n.命运，定数，天命

sentences.english: Nancy wondered whether it was her destiny to live in England and marry Melvyn.
sentences.chinese: 南希想知道她生活在英格兰又嫁给梅尔文是不是命运的安排。

sentences.english: We are masters of our own destiny.
sentences.chinese: 我们是自己命运的主人。

detailed_translations.english: the things that will happen to someone in the future, especially those that cannot be changed or controlled

name: fate
trans: n.命运vt.注定

sentences.english: I wouldn’t wish such a fate on my worst enemy.
sentences.chinese: 就算是我不共戴天的仇敌，我也不希望他遭遇这样的命运。

detailed_translations.english: the things that happen to someone or something, especially unpleasant things that end their existence or end a particular period

name: rare
trans: adj.稀有的；稀薄的；半熟的adj.杰出的；极度的；非常好的adv.非常；极其vi.用后腿站起；渴望

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: rarely
trans: adv.很少地；难得；罕有地

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: rarity
trans: n.罕见；珍贵；珍品（需用复数）；稀薄

sentences.english: Visitors were a rarity in the village.
sentences.chinese: 村里极少有外人来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 罕见；珍贵；珍品（需用复数）；稀薄
detailed_translations.english: to not happen or exist very often

name: alert
trans: n.警戒，警惕；警报adj.警惕的，警觉的；留心的vt.警告；使警觉，使意识到

sentences.english: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
sentences.chinese: 那只动物突然警觉地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
sentences.chinese: 记笔记是听课时集中注意力的最佳方法之一。

detailed_translations.english: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
to make someone realize something important or dangerous

detailed_translations.chinese: 警戒， 戒备； 警报
detailed_translations.english: a warning to be ready for possible danger

name: alarm
trans: n.闹钟；警报，警告器；惊慌vt.警告；使惊恐

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger

trans: vt.使自动化，使自动操作vi.自动化，自动操作

sentences.chinese: 柜员机使银行的两个基本功能——存款和取款自动化了。

detailed_translations.english: to start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

name: automatically
trans: adj.不经思索的adv.自动地；机械地；无意识地

sentences.english: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
sentences.chinese: 现在加入，立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

detailed_translations.english: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more

name: automation
trans: n.自动化；自动操作

sentences.english: They phrase in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 他们逐步采用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: This factory has phased in new machinery for increased automation.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂已开始逐渐使用新机器以提高自动化程度。

sentences.english: Then you could have your test automation read, parse, and use the data in this file.
sentences.chinese: 然后您可以让您的测试自动化读取、解析和使用该文件中的数据。

detailed_translations.english: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

name: automatic
trans: n.自动机械；自动手枪adj.自动的；无意识的；必然的

sentences.english: an automatic weapon
sentences.chinese: 自动武器

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox
sentences.chinese: 自动变速箱

sentences.english: My camera is fully automatic .
sentences.chinese: 我的照相机是全自动的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自动的； 必然发生的； 无意识的
detailed_translations.english: an automatic machine is designed to work without needing someone to operate it for each part of a process
a weapon that can fire bullets continuously

name: superior
trans: n.上级，长官；优胜者，高手；长者adj.上级的；优秀的，出众的；高傲的

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

name: superiority
trans: n.优越，优势；优越性

sentences.english: the intellectual superiority of humans over other animals
sentences.chinese: 人类相比其他动物所具有的智力优势

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

name: senior
trans: n.上司；较年长者；毕业班学生adj.高级的；年长的；地位较高的；年资较深的，资格较老的

sentences.english: Seniors can get a 10% discount.
sentences.chinese: 老年人可以享受10%的折扣。

detailed_translations.english: a  senior citizen

name: inferior
trans: n.下级；次品adj.差的；自卑的；下级的，下等的

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization

name: inferiority
trans: n.自卑；下属；次等；下部

sentences.english: This kind of sentiment is a very interesting combination of superiority and inferiority.
sentences.chinese: 这种情感是非常有趣的，是一种高傲和自卑的结合体。

sentences.english: My sense of inferiority, my fear of handicaps, dropped away.
sentences.chinese: 我的自卑和我对困难的恐惧都消失了。

name: humble
trans: adj.谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的vt.使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: decay
trans: n.衰退，衰减；腐烂，腐朽vt.使腐烂，使腐败；使衰退，使衰落vi.衰退，衰减；腐烂，腐朽

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: collapse
trans: n.倒塌；失败；衰竭vt.使倒塌，使崩溃；使萎陷；折叠vi.倒塌；瓦解；暴跌

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: crash
trans: n.撞碎；坠毁；破产；轰隆声；睡觉vi.摔碎；坠落；发出隆隆声；(金融企业等)破产vt.打碎；使坠毁、撞坏；擅自闯入

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产

a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

name: leak
trans: n.泄漏；漏洞，裂缝vt.使渗漏，泄露vi.漏，渗；泄漏出去

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

name: leakage
trans: n.泄漏；渗漏物；漏出量

sentences.english: a leakage of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物的泄漏入海

sentences.english: Check bottles for leakage before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前应检查瓶子是否渗漏。

detailed_translations.english: when gas, water etc leaks in or out, or the amount of it that has leaked

name: hostile
trans: n.敌对adj.敌对的，敌方的；怀敌意的

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

name: hostility
trans: n.敌意；战争行动

sentences.english: The last decade has witnessed a serious rise in the levels of racism and hostility to black and ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 过去的10年里，种族主义及对黑人和少数民族的敌意变得更加严重了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

name: resentment
trans: n.愤恨，怨恨

sentences.english: She expressed resentment at being interviewed by a social worker.
sentences.chinese: 她对于被一个社会工作者面试表示了怨恨。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of anger because something has happened that you think is unfair

name: sketch
trans: n.素描；略图；梗概vt.画素描或速写vi.画素描或速写

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail

name: profile
trans: n.侧面；轮廓；外形；剖面；简况vt.描…的轮廓；扼要描述vi.给出轮廓

sentences.english: Dani has a lovely profile.
sentences.chinese: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

detailed_translations.chinese: 侧面；人物简介；轮廓，形象；姿态，引人注目的状态
detailed_translations.english: a side view of someone’s head
to write or give a short description of someone or something

name: high-profile
trans: adj.高调的；备受瞩目的；知名度高的

sentences.english: a high-profile public figure
sentences.chinese: 一位引人注目的公众人物

name: fascinating
trans: adj.迷人的；吸引人的；使人神魂颠倒的v.使…着迷；使…陶醉（fascinate的ing形式）

sentences.english: a fascinating book
sentences.chinese: 一本引人入胜的书

sentences.english: That sounds absolutely fascinating .
sentences.chinese: 那听起来极具吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迷人的， 有极大吸引力的
detailed_translations.english: extremely interesting

name: fantasy
trans: n.幻想；白日梦；幻觉adj.虚幻的vt.空想；想像vi.耽于幻想；奏幻想曲（等于phantasy）

sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: fantastic
trans: n.古怪的人adj.奇异的；空想的；异想天开的；古怪的；极好的，极出色的；不可思议的；不切实际的

sentences.english: You look fantastic!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去棒极了！

sentences.english: It’s a fantastic place, really beautiful!
sentences.chinese: 这真是个好地方，漂亮极了！

detailed_translations.chinese: 极好的， 极出色的， 了不起的； 极大的； 难以相信的； 异想天开的， 不实际的； 奇异的， 古怪的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good, attractive, enjoyable etc

name: fantastical
trans: adj.空想的；捕风捉影的

sentences.english: fantastical creatures with golden wings and lions’ faces
sentences.chinese: 金翅狮面的怪兽

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇异的， 幻想的， 异想天开的；极好的
detailed_translations.english: strange, unreal, and magical

name: mysterious
trans: adj.神秘的；不可思议的；难解的

sentences.english: The police are investigating the mysterious deaths of children at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在调查这家医院的儿童神秘死亡事件。

sentences.english: Benson later disappeared in mysterious circumstances .
sentences.chinese: 本森后来就神秘地失踪了。

sentences.english: There’s something mysterious going on.
sentences.chinese: 出了件怪事。

detailed_translations.english: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

name: decent
trans: adj.正派的；得体的；相当好的

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.

name: distort
trans: vt.扭曲；使失真；曲解vi.扭曲；变形

sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: twist
trans: n.扭曲；拧；扭伤vt.捻；拧；扭伤；编织；使苦恼vi.扭动；弯曲

sentences.english: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手开始拧她拎着的那个包的拎柄。

sentences.chinese: 他笑了，嘴巴慢慢一歪，带着嘲笑的意味。

name: embarrassed
trans: v.使...困窘；使...局促不安（embarrass的过去分词形式）adj.尴尬的；窘迫的

sentences.english: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌，她就会难为情。

sentences.english: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
sentences.chinese: 我问他去了哪里，他显得很窘迫。

name: embarrassment
trans: n.窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: awkward
trans: adj.尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

name: nutrition
trans: n.营养，营养学；营养品

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: nurture
trans: vt.养育；鼓励；培植n.养育；教养；营养物

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: exaggerate
trans: vt.使扩大；使增大vi.夸大；夸张

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: exaggeration
trans: n.夸张；夸大之词；夸张的手法

sentences.english: It would be an exaggeration to say that we were close friends.
sentences.chinese: 说我们是密友不免言过其实了。

sentences.english: It is no exaggeration to say that everyone will be affected by the new policy.
sentences.chinese: 说人人都会受到新政策的影响一点也不夸张。

sentences.english: The situation can be described, without exaggeration, as disastrous.
sentences.chinese: 可以毫不夸张地说，这是灾难性的局面。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or way of saying something that makes something seem better, larger etc than it really is

name: alarmist
trans: n.杞人忧天者；大惊小怪者adj.危言耸听的；忧虑的

name: tempt
trans: vt.诱惑；引起；冒…的风险；使感兴趣

sentences.english: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

name: temptation
trans: n.引诱；诱惑物

sentences.english: Resist the temptation to buy the item until you’re certain you need it.
sentences.chinese: 要抵挡住购买的诱惑，除非你确有需要。

sentences.english: I finally gave in to the temptation and had a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 我最终还是屈从诱惑，抽了一支烟。

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not

name: lure
trans: n.诱惑；饵；诱惑物vt.诱惑；引诱

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵

name: coax
trans: vt.哄；哄诱；慢慢将…弄好vi.哄骗；劝诱

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: mutual
trans: adj.共同的；相互的，彼此的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: unilateral
trans: adj.单边的；单侧的；单方面的；单边音；（父母）单系的

sentences.english: a unilateral declaration of independence
sentences.chinese: 单方面宣布独立

detailed_translations.chinese: 单边的；[植] 单侧的；单方面的；单边音；（父母）单系的
detailed_translations.english: a unilateral action or decision is done by only one of the groups involved in a situation

name: deploy
trans: n.部署vt.配置；展开；使疏开vi.部署；展开

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

trans: n.处置；性情；部署；倾向

sentences.english: The rides are unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition.
sentences.chinese: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.english: a map showing the disposition of American forces
sentences.chinese: 显示美军部署的地图

sentences.english: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.

detailed_translations.chinese: 顽固的；不可弯曲的；不屈挠的；不能转变的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to make even the slightest change in your attitudes, plans etc

name: intense
trans: adj.强烈的；紧张的；非常的；热情的

sentences.english: Young people today are under intense pressure to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 如今的年轻人面临要出人头地的巨大压力。

sentences.english: the intense heat of the desert
sentences.chinese: 沙漠的炽热

sentences.english: The pain was so intense I couldn’t sleep.
sentences.chinese: 疼得我都睡不着觉。

sentences.english: He took an intense interest in all religious matters.
sentences.chinese: 他对所有宗教事宜都很感兴趣。

sentences.english: a look of intense dislike
sentences.chinese: 极端厌恶的表情

sentences.english: The job demands intense concentration.
sentences.chinese: 这工作需要全神贯注。

detailed_translations.english: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

name: intensify
trans: vt.使加强，使强化；使变激烈vi.增强，强化；变激烈

sentences.english: In Junethe civil war intensified.
sentences.chinese: 6月份内战更加激烈了。

sentences.english: His mother’s death intensified his loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 母亲的过世使他感到更加孤单。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in degree or strength, or to make something do this

name: intensity
trans: n.强度；强烈；亮度；紧张

sentences.english: The intensity of the hurricane was frightening.
sentences.chinese: 飓风的猛烈程度令人恐惧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈，剧烈；〔光、声等的〕强度
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect

name: intensive
trans: n.加强器adj.加强的；集中的；透彻的；加强语气的

sentences.english: a one-week intensive course in English
sentences.chinese: 为期一周的英语强化课程

sentences.english: a day of intensive negotiations
sentences.chinese: 紧张谈判的一天

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time

name: consolidate
trans: vt.巩固，使固定；联合vi.巩固，加强

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

name: solid
trans: n.固体；立方体adj.固体的；可靠的；立体的；结实的；一致的

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

name: intervene
trans: vi.干涉；调停；插入

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: intervention
trans: n.介入；调停；妨碍

sentences.english: government intervention to regulate prices
sentences.chinese: 政府介入控制物价

detailed_translations.english: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: interference
trans: n.干扰，冲突；干涉

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

name: intimate
trans: n.知己；至交adj.亲密的；私人的；精通的；有性关系的vt.暗示；通知；宣布

sentences.english: an intimate friend of Picasso’s
sentences.chinese: 毕加索的一个密友

sentences.english: an intimate relationship
sentences.chinese: 亲密的关系

sentences.english: She’s on intimate terms with people in government.
sentences.chinese: 她与政府官员关系密切。

detailed_translations.english: having an extremely close friendship
a close personal friend
to make people understand what you mean without saying it directly

name: intimately
trans: adv.熟悉地；亲切地；私下地

sentences.english: Maybe your relationships will be your primary focus for a period of life, as well as learning how to cultivate them more intimately and intelligently.
sentences.chinese: 或许生活中的一段时期，你的主要焦点是人际关系，了解怎样聪明地培养人际亲密关系成为了关注点。

name: loom
trans: n.织布机；若隐若现的景象vi.可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见vt.在织布机上织

sentences.english: Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.
sentences.chinese: 文森特赫然出现在我面前，脸色苍白阴沉得像块墓碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 织布机；若隐若现的景象
detailed_translations.english: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕地出现；朦胧地出现；隐约可见
detailed_translations.english: to appear as a large unclear shape, especially in a threatening way

name: upcoming
trans: adj.即将来临的

sentences.english: the upcoming elections
sentences.chinese: 即将举行的选举

detailed_translations.english: happening soon

name: musical
trans: adj.音乐的；悦耳的n.音乐片

sentences.english: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
sentences.chinese: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版

sentences.english: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
sentences.chinese: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

detailed_translations.english: relating to music or consisting of music

name: musician
trans: n.音乐家

sentences.english: a talented young musician
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的年轻音乐家

detailed_translations.english: a person who plays a musical instrument or writes music, especially as a job

name: orchestra
trans: n.管弦乐队；乐队演奏处

sentences.english: He directed an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥一个管弦乐队。

sentences.english: She conducted an orchestra of forty instruments.
sentences.chinese: 她在一个拥有40种乐器的管弦乐队里当指挥。

name: philharmonic
trans: n.交响乐团；音乐爱好者；爱乐团体adj.交响乐团的；爱好音乐的

name: precede
trans: vt.领先，在…之前；优于，高于vi.领先，在前面

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

name: predecessor
trans: n.前任，前辈

sentences.english: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who had your job before you started doing it

name: unprecedented
trans: adj.空前的；无前例的

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: renew
trans: vt.使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申vi.更新；重新开始

sentences.english: The window frames need to be renewed.
sentences.chinese: 窗框需要换新的。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something that is old or broken and put a new one in its place
to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

name: renewal
trans: n.更新，恢复；复兴；补充；革新；续借；重申

sentences.english: Mark’s contract comes up for renewal at the end of this year.
sentences.chinese: 马克的合同将在今年年末到期，需要续签。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更新，恢复；复兴；补充；革新；续借；重申
detailed_translations.english: when an activity, situation, or process begins again after a period when it had stopped

name: renewable
trans: n.再生性能源adj.可再生的；可更新的；可继续的

sentences.english: It’s a six-month lease but it’s renewable.
sentences.chinese: 租期六个月，但是可以续签。

sentences.english: a renewable visa
sentences.chinese: 可延期的签证

detailed_translations.english: if an agreement or official document is renewable, you can make it continue for a further period of time after it ends

name: refresh
trans: vt.更新；使……恢复；使……清新；消除……的疲劳vi.恢复精神；喝饮料，吃点心；补充给养

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

name: restore
trans: vi.恢复；还原vt.恢复；修复；归还

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: sharp
trans: n.尖头；骗子；内行adj.急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的vt.磨快；把音调升高adv.急剧地；锐利地；突然地vi.打扮；升音演奏

sentences.english: Make sure you use a good sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要用锋利的好刀。

sentences.english: Its teeth are razor sharp (= very sharp ) .
sentences.chinese: 它的牙齿非常锋利。

sentences.english: Do not cross the bridge but turn sharp left to go down on to the towpath.
sentences.chinese: 不要过桥，而是向左急转下到纤道上去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
detailed_translations.english: having a very thin edge or point that can cut things easily
Sharp is also an adverb

name: sharpen
trans: vt.削尖；磨快；使敏捷；加重vi.尖锐；变锋利

sentences.english: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛一亮，好像看到了不寻常的东西。

sentences.english: He will need to sharpen his diplomatic skills in order to work with Congress.
sentences.chinese: 他将需要增强外交技巧以与国会打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 削尖， 磨快； 使敏锐， 使敏捷
detailed_translations.english: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something

name: acute
trans: adj.严重的，急性的；敏锐的；激烈的；尖声的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: drastic
trans: n.烈性泻药adj.激烈的；猛烈的

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

name: drastically
trans: adv.彻底地；激烈地

sentences.english: Output has been drastically reduced.
sentences.chinese: 产量已急剧下降。

sentences.english: Things have started to go drastically wrong.
sentences.chinese: 情况变得完全失控。

name: dramatic
trans: adj.戏剧的；急剧的；引人注目的；激动人心的

sentences.english: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。

sentences.english: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。

sentences.english: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

detailed_translations.chinese: 引人注目的， 激动人心的； 戏剧的
detailed_translations.english: exciting or impressive

name: dramatically
trans: adv.戏剧地；引人注目地adv.显著地，剧烈地

name: steep
trans: n.峭壁；浸渍adj.陡峭的；不合理的；夸大的；急剧升降的vt.泡；浸；使…充满vi.泡；沉浸

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

name: stiff
trans: adj.呆板的；坚硬的；严厉的；拘谨的adv.僵硬地；彻底地n.死尸；令人讨厌者；流通票据；劳动者vt.诈骗；失信

sentences.english: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.
sentences.chinese: 三十岁之前，我训练后从不会感到身体发僵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 呆板的；坚硬的；严厉的；拘谨的
detailed_translations.english: a stiff punishment is great or severe

detailed_translations.chinese: 死尸；令人讨厌者；流通票据；劳动者
detailed_translations.english: the body of a dead person

name: stiffly
trans: adv.生硬地；顽固地；呆板地

sentences.english: They greeted each other stiffly, without affection.
sentences.chinese: 他们生硬地打着招呼，没有一丝爱意。

name: overly
trans: adv.过度地；极度地

sentences.english: Employers may become overly cautious about taking on new staff.
sentences.chinese: 雇主在雇用新员工的问题上可能会过于谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: Overly means more than is normal, necessary, or reasonable

name: overwhelm
trans: vt.淹没；压倒；受打击；覆盖；压垮

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

name: overwhelming
trans: adj.压倒性的；势不可挡的v.压倒；淹没（overwhelm的ing形式）；制服

sentences.english: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
sentences.chinese: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。

sentences.english: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
sentences.chinese: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。

sentences.english: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
sentences.chinese: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。

sentences.english: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
sentences.chinese: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利，但还是完成了任务。

detailed_translations.english: very large or greater, more important etc than any other

name: overwhelmingly
trans: adv.压倒性地；不可抵抗地

name: constitute
trans: vt.组成，构成；建立；任命

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: component
trans: n.成分；组件；元件adj.组成的，构成的

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: compound
trans: n.化合物；混合物；复合词adj.复合的；混合的v.合成；混合；恶化，加重；和解，妥协

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: composition
trans: n.作文，作曲，作品；构成；合成物；成分

sentences.english: Some minerals have complex chemical compositions.
sentences.chinese: 有些矿物的化学构成很复杂。

sentences.english: a composition by jazzman Dave Brubeck, called ‘Chromatic Fantasy’
sentences.chinese: 爵士音乐家戴夫•布鲁贝克的作品《半音阶幻想曲》

sentences.english: The Journals contain accounts of literary composition.
sentences.chinese: 《期刊》中有关于文学创作的报道。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is made up of different parts, things, or members

name: element
trans: n.元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境

sentences.english: Business and management elements are built into the course.
sentences.chinese: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

sentences.english: Hydrogen is a one-valence element.
sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

detailed_translations.english: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

name: ultimate
trans: n.终极；根本；基本原则adj.最终的；极限的；根本的

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: ultimately
trans: adv.最后；根本；基本上

sentences.english: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.chinese: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.english: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.chinese: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

detailed_translations.english: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

name: honor
trans: n.荣誉；信用；头衔vt.尊敬（等于honour）；给…以荣誉

sentences.english: For the French team, winning tomorrow’s game is a matter of national honor.
sentences.chinese: 对法国队来说，打赢明天的比赛事关国家荣誉。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

name: honour
trans: n.荣誉；尊敬；勋章vt.尊敬；承兑；承兑远期票据

sentences.english: He was showered with honours – among them an Oscar.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了很多荣誉–其中包括奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone with special respect

name: dishonor
trans: n.拒付；不名誉；丢脸vt.使蒙羞；玷辱

name: dishonour
trans: n.拒付；不名誉vt.拒付；使丢脸；拒绝承兑；不履行（诺言等）

sentences.english: He dishonored the uniform and did not deserve to be a marine.
sentences.chinese: 他玷污了这身军服，不配当一名海军陆战队士兵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒付；使丢脸；拒绝承兑；不履行（诺言等）
detailed_translations.english: if a bank dishonours a cheque, it refuses to pay out money for it

trans: n.猛咬；劈啪声；突然折断adj.突然的vt.突然折断，拉断；猛咬；啪地关上vi.咬；厉声说；咯嗒一声关上

a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion

sentences.chinese: 纽曼在拟定新法的过程中发挥了主要作用。

sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something changes to a worse condition

name: upgrade
trans: n.升级；上升；上坡vt.使升级；提升；改良品种adj.向上的adv.往上

sentences.english: Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized.
sentences.chinese: 直升机已经升级并且装上现代化设备。

detailed_translations.english: to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things

name: disgrace
trans: n.耻辱；丢脸的人或事；失宠vt.使……失宠；给……丢脸；使……蒙受耻辱；贬黜

sentences.english: Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
sentences.chinese: 事情发生之后，史密斯声名狼藉。

sentences.english: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为让家人蒙羞。

sentences.english: How could you disgrace us all like that?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能这样丢我们大家的脸呢？

detailed_translations.english: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
to do something so bad that you make other people feel ashamed

name: stain
trans: n.污点；瑕疵；着色剂vt.沾污；败坏；给…着色vi.污染；被沾污；被染污

sentences.english: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

name: innovate
trans: vi.创新；改革；革新vt.改变；创立；创始；引人

sentences.english: the need for large businesses to innovate
sentences.chinese: 大公司革新的需要

sentences.english: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

detailed_translations.english: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions

name: innovation
trans: n.创新，革新；新方法

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: innovative
trans: adj.革新的，创新的；新颖的；有创新精神的

sentences.english: an innovative approach to language teaching
sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.english: innovative schemes for recycling waste materials
sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

detailed_translations.english: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: innovativeness
trans: n.创新性，创新精神

name: novelty
trans: n.新奇；新奇的事物；新颖小巧而廉价的物品

sentences.english: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
sentences.chinese: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外，别无吸引力。

sentences.english: Then the Internet was still something of a novelty.
sentences.chinese: 那时因特网还是个挺新鲜的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

name: marvel
trans: n.奇迹vt.对…感到惊异vi.感到惊讶

sentences.english: ‘The man is a genius,’ marvelled Claire.
sentences.chinese: “这人是个天才。”克莱尔赞叹道。

sentences.english: The whale, like the dolphin, has become a symbol of the marvels of creation.
sentences.chinese: 鲸，和海豚一样，已经成为造物杰作的象征。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
You can describe something or someone as a marvel to indicate that you think that they are wonderful

name: astonish
trans: vt.使惊讶

sentences.english: Her reply astonished me.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: It astonished him that she had changed so little.
sentences.chinese: 他很惊讶，她几乎没怎么变。

sentences.english: What astonishes me most is his complete lack of fear.
sentences.chinese: 最令我吃惊的是，他什么都不怕。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: astonishing
trans: adj.惊人的；令人惊讶的v.使…惊讶；使…诧异（astonish的ing形式）

sentences.english: an astonishing decision
sentences.chinese: 令人惊讶的决定

sentences.english: their astonishing success
sentences.chinese: 他们惊人的成功

detailed_translations.english: so surprising that it is difficult to believe

name: maximise
trans: vt.把…增加到最大限度；尽量增大（等于maximize）

detailed_translations.chinese: 使增加到最大限度， 最佳化； 充分利用

name: maximize
trans: vt.取…最大值；对…极为重视vi.尽可能广义地解释；达到最大值

sentences.english: We need to maximize the space.
sentences.chinese: 我们要充分利用空间。

detailed_translations.english: to  click  on a special part on a window on a computer screen so that it becomes as big as the screen

name: maximum
trans: n.极大，最大限度；最大量adj.最高的；最多的；最大极限的

sentences.english: The car has a maximum speed of 120 mph.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车的最高时速为120英里。

sentences.english: They made maximum use of the resources available.
sentences.chinese: 他们充分利用可获取的资源。

sentences.english: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.
sentences.chinese: 要想获得最佳的效果，这些运动要做得慢一点。

sentences.english: Display the hologram under a strong light for maximum effect.
sentences.chinese: 把立体全息图放在强光下展示以得到最佳效果。

sentences.english: The plant is operating at maximum capacity .
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂正在开足马力生产。

sentences.english: The award will consist of a lump sum to a maximum value of $5,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖学金最高将是5,000美元，一次性给付。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最大的； 最高的； 顶点的
detailed_translations.english: the maximum amount, quantity, speed etc is the largest that is possible or allowed
the largest number or amount that is possible or is allowed

name: maximal
trans: adj.最高的，最大的；最全面的

name: minimise
trans: vt.使缩到最小；成极小；求最小值

detailed_translations.chinese: 使减到最低限度； 最小化

name: minimize
trans: vt.使减到最少；小看，极度轻视vi.最小化

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: minimum
trans: n.最小值；最低限度；最小化；最小量adj.最小的；最低的

sentences.english: This will take a minimum of one hour.
sentences.chinese: 这最少要用一个小时。

sentences.english: The minimum number of students we need to run the course is fifteen.
sentences.chinese: 我们开这门课程最少要有15个学生。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary
the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed

name: minimal
trans: adj.最低的；最小限度的

sentences.english: The storm caused only minimal damage.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。

sentences.english: The cost to taxpayers would be minimal.
sentences.chinese: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。

sentences.english: This is a practical course, with only a minimal amount of theory.
sentences.chinese: 这是实践课程，只有少量理论。

detailed_translations.english: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

name: symbolic
trans: adj.象征的；符号的；使用符号的

sentences.english: Each element of the ceremony has a symbolic meaning .
sentences.chinese: 仪式的每一个元素都具有象征意义。

detailed_translations.english: a symbolic action is important because of what it represents but may not have any real effect

name: symbolise
trans: vt.象征，代表（等于symbolize）

sentences.english: DAKAR, NewsCore - Wearing white to symbolise purity, worshippers throughout this African capital gathered to pray on one of the final nights of Ramadan.
sentences.chinese: 达喀尔，新闻报导—这个非洲国家的礼拜者们穿上代表纯洁的白色衣服聚集在首都，一起在斋月的最后一天祷告。

name: symbolize
trans: vt.象征；用符号表现vi.采用象征；使用符号；作为…的象征

sentences.english: Crime often symbolizes a wider social problem.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪问题往往反映出更广泛的社会问题。

sentences.english: Growing discontent has been symbolized by the protests.
sentences.chinese: 与日俱增的不满通过一次又一次的抗议表现出来。

detailed_translations.english: if something symbolizes a quality, feeling etc, it represents it

name: dwelling
trans: n.住处；寓所v.居住（dwell的现在分词）

sentences.english: Some 3,500 new dwellings are planned for the area.
sentences.chinese: 大约三千五百套新住宅计划在这个地区新建。

detailed_translations.english: a house, apartment etc where people live

name: dweller
trans: n.居民，居住者

sentences.english: City dwellers suffer higher pollution levels.
sentences.chinese: 城市居民承受的污染程度更严重。

detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that lives in a particular place

name: resident
trans: n.居民；住院医生adj.居住的；定居的

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: residence
trans: n.住宅，住处；居住

sentences.english: Rome was his main place of residence.
sentences.chinese: 罗马是他的主要居住地。

sentences.english: the ambassador’s official residence
sentences.chinese: 大使官邸

detailed_translations.english: the state of living in a place

name: turbulent
trans: adj.骚乱的，混乱的；狂暴的；吵闹的；激流的，湍流的

sentences.english: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.chinese: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.english: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

detailed_translations.english: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes

name: turbulence
trans: n.骚乱，动荡；湍流；狂暴

detailed_translations.english: irregular and violent movements of air or water that are caused by the wind

name: coordinate
trans: n.坐标；同等的人或物vt.调整；整合adj.并列的；同等的vi.协调

sentences.english: Matching bag and accessories provide a complete ensemble of colour coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc
equal in importance or rank in a sentence
to organize an activity so that the people involved in it work well together and achieve a good result

name: coordination
trans: n.协调，调和；对等，同等

sentences.english: Too much alcohol affects your coordination.
sentences.chinese: 喝酒太多会影响你动作的协调。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which your muscles move together when you perform a movement

name: mismatch
trans: vt.使配错n.错配；不协调

sentences.english: There is a mismatch between the skills offered by people and the skills needed by industry.
sentences.chinese: 人们所提供的技能和行业所需要的技能并不匹配。

detailed_translations.english: a combination of things or people that do not work well together or are not suitable for each other

name: overcrowded
trans: adj.过度拥挤的v.拥挤（overcrowd的过去分词）

sentences.english: Staff had to work in overcrowded conditions.
sentences.chinese: 员工们只得在过度拥挤的环境中工作。

sentences.english: overcrowded housing
sentences.chinese: 过度拥挤的住房

detailed_translations.english: filled with too many people or things

name: overlap
trans: n.重叠；重复vi.部分重叠；部分的同时发生vt.与…重叠；与…同时发生

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: overshadow
trans: vt.使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩
detailed_translations.english: If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are

name: cunning
trans: n.狡猾adj.狡猾的；巧妙的；可爱的

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: tricky
trans: adj.狡猾的；机警的

sentences.english: I can get you tickets for the show but it’ll be tricky.
sentences.chinese: 我能给你弄到演出的票，但会很费事。

detailed_translations.english: a tricky person is clever and likely to deceive you

name: wander
trans: vi.徘徊；漫步；迷路；离题vt.游荡，漫游

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: linger
trans: vi.徘徊；苟延残喘；磨蹭vt.消磨；缓慢度过

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

name: distasteful
trans: adj.令人不快的；不合口味的；表示厌恶的

sentences.english: What follows is John’s story. Parts of it may seem distasteful, even shocking.
sentences.chinese: 接下来是约翰的叙述，其中有些部分也许令人不快，甚至令人震惊。

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or morally offensive

name: disgusting
trans: adj.令人厌恶的令人极不能接受的

sentences.english: Rubbish was piled everywhere – it was disgusting.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾堆得到处都是，很恶心。

sentences.english: Smoking is a really disgusting habit.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是一种十分令人讨厌的习惯。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant and making you feel sick

name: envy
trans: n.嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕vt.嫉妒，妒忌；羡慕vi.感到妒忌；显示出妒忌

sentences.english: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
sentences.chinese: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩，你俩在一起看起来多幸福。

sentences.english: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

sentences.english: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy(= feeling a lot of envy ).
sentences.chinese: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

detailed_translations.english: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
the feeling of wanting something that someone else has

name: enviable
trans: adj.值得羡慕的；引起忌妒的

sentences.english: Now he was in the enviable position of not having to work for a living.
sentences.chinese: 现在他已不必为生计而工作，着实令人羡慕。

detailed_translations.english: an enviable quality, position, or possession is good and other people would like to have it

name: hitherto
trans: adv.迄今；至今

sentences.english: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
sentences.chinese: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

detailed_translations.english: up to this time

name: hence
trans: adv.因此；今后

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

name: transplant
trans: n.移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者vt.移植；迁移；使移居vi.移植；迁移；移居

sentences.english: The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine.
sentences.chinese: 移植肾脏的手术如今相当常见。

detailed_translations.english: to move an organ, piece of skin etc from one person’s body and put it into another as a form of medical treatment

detailed_translations.chinese: 移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者
detailed_translations.english: the operation of transplanting an organ, piece of skin etc

name: transparent
trans: adj.透明的；显然的；坦率的；易懂的

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: transparency
trans: n.透明，透明度；幻灯片；有图案的玻璃

sentences.english: ...transparencies of masterpieces from Lizzie's art collection.
sentences.chinese: …莉齐艺术收藏品中一些杰作的幻灯片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 透明，透明度；幻灯片；有图案的玻璃
detailed_translations.english: a sheet of plastic or a piece of photographic film through which light can be shone to show a picture on a large screen

name: transient
trans: n.瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟adj.短暂的；路过的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: transition
trans: n.过渡；转变；转换；变调

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: exceed
trans: vt.超过；胜过vi.超过其他

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: excess
trans: n.超过，超额；过度，过量；无节制adj.额外的，过量的；附加的

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

name: excessive
trans: adj.过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: excessively
trans: adv.过分地；极度

sentences.english: excessively high prices
sentences.chinese: 过高的价格

detailed_translations.english: greater than what seems reasonable or appropriate

name: surpass
trans: vt.超越；胜过，优于；非…所能办到或理解

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: autonomous
trans: adj.自治的；自主的；自发的

sentences.english: They proudly declared themselves part of a new autonomous province.
sentences.chinese: 他们自豪地宣布自己是新自治省的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: an autonomous place or organization is free to govern or control itself

name: spontaneous
trans: adj.自发的；自然的；无意识的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

name: painful
trans: adj.痛苦的；疼痛的；令人不快的

sentences.chinese: 僵硬疼痛的关节

sentences.english: Is your arm very painful?
sentences.chinese: 你的手臂很疼吗？

sentences.english: The neck becomes swollen and painful to the touch (= hurts when you touch it ) .
sentences.chinese: 脖子肿起来了，一碰就疼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛苦的，疼痛的，令人不快的
detailed_translations.english: if a part of your body is painful, it hurts

trans: adj.悲惨的；痛苦的；卑鄙的

sentences.chinese: 自从帕特离我而去后，我十分痛苦。

sentences.chinese: 我那个周末心情很糟糕。

sentences.english: Jan looks really miserable .
sentences.chinese: 简看上去很痛苦。

sentences.english: Why do you make yourself miserable by taking on too much work?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么揽这么多活儿，把自己弄得很辛苦呢？

name: distressed
trans: v.使痛苦；使紧张；使困苦（distress的过去分词）adj.痛苦的；忧虑的；贫困的；受损的

sentences.english: The animal was clearly distressed.
sentences.chinese: 那动物显然很痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 痛苦的；忧虑的；贫困的；受损的
detailed_translations.english: very upset

detailed_translations.chinese: 使痛苦；使紧张；使困苦（distress的过去分词）

name: grieve
trans: vi.悲痛，哀悼vt.使悲伤，使苦恼

sentences.chinese: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。

sentences.english: She grieved the loss of her only son.
sentences.chinese: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy

trans: n.事件，事变；插曲adj.入射的；附带的；易发生的，伴随而来的

sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

trans: n.附带事件；偶然事件；杂项adj.附带的；偶然的；容易发生的

sentences.english: Increased motivation is more than an incidental benefit of reward schemes.
sentences.chinese: 积极性提高不仅仅是奖励计划附带的益处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 附带的；偶然的；容易发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in connection with something else that is more important

detailed_translations.chinese: 附带事件；偶然事件；杂项

trans: adv.顺便；偶然地；附带地

sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你在哪儿出生的？

trans: vi.一致，符合；同时发生vi.(在性格、品质等方面)完全一致，相符

sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

trans: adj.一致的；符合的；同时发生的

sentences.chinese: 他们的目标和我们的一致。

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening at the same place or time

name: coincidence
trans: n.巧合；一致；同时发生

sentences.english: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’
sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合
detailed_translations.english: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual

name: accident
trans: n.事故；意外；意外事件；机遇

sentences.english: Ken had an accident at work and had to go to hospital.

sentences.english: a train accident

trans: adv.意外地；偶然地

trans: n.插曲；一段情节；插话；有趣的事件

sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲

name: prosper
trans: vi.繁荣，昌盛；成功vt.使……成功；使……昌盛；使……繁荣

sentences.chinese: 他的生意持续兴隆。

trans: n.繁荣，成功

trans: adj.不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

trans: n.兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰vi.繁荣，兴旺；茂盛；活跃；处于旺盛时期vt.夸耀；挥舞

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣

sentences.english: The economy went from boom to bust (=  from increasing to decreasing  ) very quickly.

trans: vt.通知；为…做广告；使突出vi.做广告，登广告；作宣传

sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.chinese: 《斯托克波特广告报》

detailed_translations.english: a person or company that advertises something

trans: n.广告；广告业；登广告adj.广告的；广告业的v.公告；为…做广告（advertise的ing形式）

sentences.english: advertising aimed at 18–25 year olds
sentences.chinese: 针对18到25岁人群的广告

sentences.chinese: 广告业生涯

trans: n.广告，宣传

sentences.chinese: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。

detailed_translations.english: lack of fairness, or something that is unfair

sentences.chinese: 关于现代英语用法的书

sentences.chinese: 作为一种通勤服务，渡船已经没有用武之地了。

name: dentistry
trans: n.牙科学；牙医业

sentences.english: Digital record keeping is another change coming to dentistry.The UCSF clinic went digital about a year ago, and dentists there believe paper files will be obsolete within 10 or 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 牙科学的另一项改变则是记录保存的数字化，UCSF诊所一年前实施了数字化，这里的牙医们相信在未来10到15年内，纸质档案将被淘汰。

name: dissatisfied

sentences.english: dissatisfied clients
sentences.chinese: 感到不满意的客户

detailed_translations.english: not satisfied because something is not as good as you had expected

sentences.chinese: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。

sentences.english: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
sentences.chinese: 沃勒法官，东北地区的首席法官

trans: n.攻击性；进取精神；霸气

name: drone
trans: n.雄蜂；嗡嗡的声音；懒惰者n.无人机（非正式）vt.低沉地说vi.嗡嗡作声；混日子

sentences.chinese: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

trans: n.化肥（等于fertilizer）

sentences.english: Why do Americans spend such huge amounts of time, money, water, fertiliser and fuel on growing a useless smooth expanse of grass?
sentences.chinese: 为什么美国人要把如此大量的时间、金钱、水、化肥和燃料花在一大片平整却毫无用处的草地上呢？

sentences.english: At the moment we are losing our groundwater very quickly, destroying soil nutrients, and farmers are going into debt because they are dependent on fertiliser and other inputs.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我们正在非常迅速地失去我们的地下水、破坏土壤养分，而农民们正在欠债，因为他们依赖于化肥和其它投入。

name: fertilizer
trans: n.肥料；受精媒介物；促进发展者

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: swell
trans: n.肿胀；隆起vt.使膨胀；使隆起adj.漂亮的；一流的vi.膨胀；肿胀；隆起

sentences.english: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
sentences.chinese: 她的脚踝已经开始肿起来了。

sentences.english: The window frame was swollen shut.
sentences.chinese: 窗框膨胀变形，关得死死的。

the roundness or curved shape of something
very good

trans: n.礼物；贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物

sentences.english: The players wore black armbands as a tribute to their late teammate.
sentences.chinese: 球员们戴着黑纱悼念已故的队友。

sentences.english: I’d like to pay tribute to (= praise and admire publicly ) the party workers for all their hard work.
sentences.chinese: 我谨向党内工作人员致敬，感谢他们的辛苦努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
detailed_translations.english: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

name: confusedly
trans: adv.混乱地；受困惑地；慌乱地

name: confusion
trans: n.混淆，混乱；困惑

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

trans: adj.不均匀的；不平坦的；奇数的

sentences.chinese: 她小心翼翼地从凹凸不平的地面上走回来。

detailed_translations.english: not smooth, flat, or level

name: mammal

sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

trans: adj.不值得的；无价值的；不相称的

detailed_translations.chinese: 不值得的；无价值的；不相称的
detailed_translations.english: not deserving respect, attention etc

trans: adv.巨大地，庞大地；非常地，在极大程度上

trans: adj.按年代顺序排列的；依时间前后排列而记载的

detailed_translations.chinese: 按年代顺序排列的；依时间前后排列而记载的
detailed_translations.english: arranged according to when things happened or were made

sentences.english: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He only has occasional use of a car.
sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.

name: multidimensional
trans: adj.多维的；多面的

name: stubbornly
trans: adv.顽固地；倔强地

sentences.english: And for those who stubbornly suggest pricing above what I believe the market will bear, I say 'best of luck to you.

sentences.chinese: 但是日本的教育系统——仍在强调事实和数字以及心算的训练——仍固执的深深扎根在过去的土壤之中。

sentences.english: People often stubbornly think they are different, especially in a large company such as IBM, whose environments are large and complex.
sentences.chinese: 人们经常顽固地认为他们是不同的，特别是在公司环境大而复杂的大型公司，例如 IBM。

trans: n.构词要素adj.形成的；造型的；格式化的
