sentences.chinese: 她出生于巴巴多斯，但他的成长期是在迈阿密度过的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成的；造型的；格式化的
detailed_translations.english: A formative period of time or experience is one that has an important and lasting influence on a person's character and attitudes

name: fatal
trans: adj.致命的；重大的；毁灭性的；命中注定的

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

detailed_translations.english: able to be carried or moved easily

trans: adj.规律的；训练的；训诫的

detailed_translations.english: Disciplinary bodies or actions are concerned with making sure that people obey rules or regulations and that they are punished if they do not

trans: n.革新；修理；恢复活力

sentences.chinese: 它通常还导致较低的翻新、清洁和保养维修费用。

sentences.english: For novice friends, we do not know how much the specific renovation costs?
sentences.chinese: 对于新手朋友来说，大家都不了解具体装修费用是多少？

sentences.chinese: 这些统计资料严重歪曲了实际情况。

detailed_translations.chinese: 歪曲，误传；不合适地代表

name: procedurally
trans: 程序上地

sentences.chinese: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

sentences.chinese: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。

sentences.chinese: 这部小说里的叙述比对话多。

sentences.english: If this story must be written, we must have the courage to eliminate all adjectives that tend to excite wonder: they would achieve the opposite effect, of impoverishing the narrative.
sentences.chinese: 如果必须要写这篇故事，我们必须要有勇气剔除易于激发我们想入非非的所有形容词：这些词会使叙述贫瘠无力，起到相反的效果。

detailed_translations.english: a description of events in a story, especially in a novel

trans: adv.强烈地，激烈地；非常地

sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

trans: adj.苦恼的；痛苦难忍的vt.使极度痛苦；折磨（agonize的ing形式）vi.感到极度痛苦（agonize的ing形式）

sentences.english: He did not wish to die the agonizing death of his mother and brother.
sentences.chinese: 他不希望像他母亲和他兄弟那样痛苦地死去。

sentences.chinese: 那只古老的钟大声地嘀嗒着。

detailed_translations.english: if a clock or watch ticks, it makes a short repeated sound
A tick is a written mark like a V. It is used to show that something is correct or has been selected or dealt with.
to mark a test, list of questions etc with a tick, in order to show that something is correct, to choose something etc

trans: n.精明（的人）；机灵（的人）adj.精明的；狡猾的；机灵的

sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

sentences.chinese: 它的外形极不规则，满是凸起和凹陷的地方。

detailed_translations.english: having a shape, surface, pattern etc that is not even, smooth, or balanced

trans: n.吵闹;噪度

sentences.chinese: 同一群体的不同动物对同一疾病有不同的表现形式。

sentences.english: the search for technical perfection
sentences.chinese: 对技术的精益求精

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: impartially

sentences.english: If she gets the nod, Kagan says she will consider every case impartially and with commitment to principle.
sentences.chinese: Kagan 说如果她能通过，她将公平地处理每个案子并忠于原则办事。

sentences.english: In order for the independent director to exercise his rights impartially and equitably, nothing can go without a constraint mechanism in addition to above-mentioned incentive mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 为了让独立董事更公正与公平地履行他的职责, 除了上述的激励机制外, 一个有效的约束机制也是必不可少的.

sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

sentences.chinese: 国务院就海外局势发布旅游警报。

sentences.chinese: 管理咨询公司

sentences.english: a consultancy firm
sentences.chinese: 咨询公司

detailed_translations.english: a company that gives advice on a particular subject

name: multibillion
trans: adj.<英>数万亿的，<美>数十亿的

name: vastly
trans: adv.极大地；广大地；深远地

sentences.english: The jury has heard two vastly different accounts.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团听到了两种极为不同的陈述。

detailed_translations.english: Vastly means to an extremely great degree or extent

name: empathy
trans: n.神入；移情作用；执着n.感同身受；同感；共鸣

sentences.english: Having begun my life in a children's home, I have great empathy with the little ones.
sentences.chinese: 在一家儿童福利院长大使我对这些小孩子们怀有深深的同感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同感， 移情； 全神贯注

sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失

name: suicide

sentences.english: More people commit suicide at Christmas than at any other time.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。

sentences.english: My mother attempted suicide on many occasions.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲多次试图自杀。

sentences.english: He apparently left a suicide note (= letter explaining his reasons for killing himself ) on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他显然在桌上留了封绝笔信。

detailed_translations.english: the act of killing yourself

name: quickness
trans: n.急速，迅速；尖锐化

sentences.english: At Qian Hu, we proactively seek opportunities to participate in initiatives to promote philanthropy, business and entrepreneurship in our community.
sentences.chinese: 在仟湖鱼业，我们积极寻求机会来参与各种活动措施，在社会中推广慈善事业、商业和企业家精神。

sentences.english: But perhaps nowhere are the roadblocks to youthful enterprise so evident, and the consequences to the Japanese economy so dire, as in the failure of entrepreneurship.
sentences.chinese: 但或许年轻人的进取心到处碰壁，这在日本社会已司空见惯。 而缺乏企业家精神，这对日本经济造成了可怕的恶果。

sentences.english: However, entrepreneurship is clearly growing on them, as more than a quarter of graduates (26 per cent) reported starting their own company during their EMBA or since graduating.
sentences.chinese: 然而，学员身上的创业精神明显在增强，超过四分之一的毕业生（26%）称在就读EMBA期间或毕业后创办了自己的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Entrepreneurship is the state of being an entrepreneur, or the activities associated with being an entrepreneur

name: erroneous

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: appropriately
trans: adv.适当地；合适地；相称地

sentences.english: Try to dress appropriately for each occasion.
sentences.chinese: 试图为每个场合适当地打扮。

sentences.chinese: 我们是否有可能根据对这些风险的理解来适当地调整我们的研究方向呢？

name: unpredictable

sentences.english: He is utterly unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人完全让人捉摸不透。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可预知的；不定的；出乎意料的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone or something as unpredictable, you mean that you cannot tell what they are going to do or how they are going to behave

name: wherever

sentences.english: Children will play wherever they happen to be.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子走到哪里玩到哪里。

sentences.english: Sit wherever you like.

sentences.chinese: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

trans: n.碎片；残余物；打架；少量vt.废弃；使解体；拆毁adj.废弃的；零碎的vi.吵架

Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use

trans: adj.恰当的；有…倾向的；灵敏的

sentences.chinese: 用“一见钟情”来形容他见到她时的感觉再恰当不过。

trans: n.犯人，罪犯；被控犯罪的人

trans: vt.改正；精馏；整流

trans: n.述行成分，述行语adj.表述行为的

trans: vi.爆炸，爆发；激增vt.使爆炸；爆炸；推翻

sentences.chinese: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队，但没有爆炸。

sentences.chinese: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹，大大早于任何人的预期。

to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

detailed_translations.chinese: ad/ 区别地, 特殊地

trans: vt.&vi.创建理论，建立学说，推理

name: theorize
trans: vt.建立理论vi.建立理论或学说；推理

sentences.english: Police are theorizing that the robbers may be posing as hitchhikers.
sentences.chinese: 警方推测那些劫匪可能会装成搭便车的人。

sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

trans: vi.不赞成；不喜欢vt.不赞成；不同意

sentences.chinese: 我知道父母会反对，但我还是去了。

sentences.english: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.

sentences.chinese: 该课程为期三年。

trans: adv.谨慎地；慎重地

trans: n.不必要；多余

sentences.chinese: …这一家在德国南部的祖宅。

detailed_translations.english: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land that they have had for a long time

name: idealist
trans: n.空想家，理想主义者；唯心主义者adj.理想主义的；唯心主义的

sentences.english: This is a heated debate which involves materialist as opposed to idealist views.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场唯物主义与唯心主义的大论战。

sentences.english: This is because there were a lot of them about in histime—and they were almost all the work of hopelessly idealist radicals.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为大量的工作占用了他的时间——而这些几乎全部都是没有希望的理想主义的激进分子的工作。

sentences.english: And if we take this biological view of life and try to live according to the seasons, no one but a conceited fool or an impossible idealist can deny that human life can be lived like a poem.
sentences.chinese: 如若我们持此种生物学的观点来看待人生，并尝试依照时节来生活，除了自以为是的傻瓜和令人难以忍受的理想主义者之外，没有人能否认人生的美妙如诗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空想家，理想主义者；唯心主义者

detailed_translations.chinese: 理想主义的；唯心主义的

trans: adv.理想地；观念上地

name: idealism
trans: n.唯心主义，理想主义；理念论

sentences.english: religious idealism
sentences.chinese: 宗教的理想主义

the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in

sentences.chinese: 莫扎特蛙口哨般的叫声在声谱图上的反应就像音符一般，受此启发，发现者布莱尔·赫齐斯用那著名的作曲家的名字给这个物种命名。

sentences.chinese: 该药已经过大量的临床试验。

sentences.chinese: 该疗法对临床抑郁症病人有帮助。

sentences.chinese: 然而，如果没有看错的话，牧师的力量似乎并不在身体上，倒是在精神上，而且是由天使通过宗教仪式赋予他的。

sentences.chinese: 她认为一切全都是一场梦幻，她虽然梦得如此真切，但在牧师和她本人之间不可能有任何真实的联系，她的精神随着这种念头而消沉了。

very

sentences.chinese: 你将你的秘密“卷起来”，放在一个意想不到的地方，比如MP3或照片文件，这样就掩盖了你曾经分享信息的事实。

sentences.chinese: 你会想，像这些西方进口会拥护电视媒体对同性恋的描写，对吧？

sentences.chinese: 看《奶酪陷阱》会让人上瘾，而且由于对大学生活的真实描写，它也有一定的教育意义。

sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.chinese: 我们肩并肩地走着,她专心地听着我讲述你,讲述我们,以及我们一起分享的那些美好时光。

sentences.chinese: 不要责骂小狗，但要干脆利落地说“不”。

sentences.chinese: 这场大屠杀的唯一幸存者

when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

name: sphere

sentences.english: Because the earth spins, it is not a perfect sphere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球旋转，所以它不是个完完全全的球体。

sentences.chinese: 在此类情况下需要的是对形势的冷静估计。

trans: n.移民；移民出境；移居外国

sentences.chinese: 但是，这样做就失去了移民的意义。

sentences.english: They have known colonization, revolution and emigration.
sentences.chinese: 他们了解殖民、革命还有移民。

trans: n.混合；混合物；混合剂

sentences.chinese: 这个小城新旧结合。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

name: rediscover
trans: vt.重新发现；再发现

sentences.chinese: ...重新发现了自己信仰的一个曾经的反叛者。

detailed_translations.english: If you rediscover something good or valuable that you had forgotten or lost, you become aware of it again or find it again

trans: n.吃吃的笑vt.咯咯地笑着说vi.傻笑；咯咯地笑

sentences.chinese: 如果你再咯咯地笑个不停，就给我离开屋子。

sentences.english: The railway may sue for damages (= in order to get money ) because of loss of revenue.
sentences.chinese: 铁道部门可能会因收入损失而提出起诉，要求赔偿。

sentences.chinese: 他的妻子对他提出起诉，要求离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sue)人名；(日)末(名)；(法)休；(英)休(女子教名Susan、Susanna的昵称)

trans: n.研究者；调查者；侦查员

sentences.chinese: 警探

detailed_translations.english: someone who investigates things, especially crimes

name: runaway
trans: n.逃跑；逃走的人adj.逃亡的；逃走的

detailed_translations.english: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people

sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

trans: v.<主英>=intellectualize

trans: vt.使……有理智；将……作理性研究vi.诉诸理智；推理

trans: vt.赞同；称赞；向…喝彩vi.喝彩；鼓掌欢迎

sentences.chinese: 300名支持者为她的演讲热烈鼓掌。

sentences.english: "I think the feedback can be helpful because we all have blinders on when we fall in love, " says Eva Ritvo, a Miami psychiatrist who specialize sin marriage and family therapy.
sentences.chinese: 专门从事婚姻与家庭疗法研究的迈阿密精神病专家瑞塔沃说：“我认为信息回馈是有用的，因为人们在恋爱时都会变得盲目。

sentences.english: The fight ended only with the timely arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏警察及时赶到，打斗总算停止。

detailed_translations.english: done or happening at exactly the right time

name: timeless
trans: adj.永恒的；不受时间影响的；不合时宜的

trans: n.时间表；时刻表；课程表

sentences.chinese: 这个时间表过于乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a list of the times at which buses, trains, planes etc arrive and leave

name: timescale
trans: 时间量程时标

sentences.english: The timescale for completing the work would be fairly tight.
sentences.chinese: 完成这项工作的时间很紧。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time it takes for something to happen or be completed

name: overtime
trans: n.加班时间；延长时间；加时赛adj.超时的；加班的vt.使超过时间adv.加班地

sentences.english: six hours’ overtime
sentences.chinese: 六小时的加班

sentences.english: They’re working overtime to get the job finished.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在加班赶工。

sentences.english: He’s been doing a lot of overtime recently.
sentences.chinese: 他近来加班很多。

sentences.english: Many employees work countless hours of unpaid overtime.
sentences.chinese: 许多员工无偿加班无数个小时。

sentences.english: Many of our offices will be working on overtime until the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们的许多办事处都要加班到年底。

detailed_translations.chinese: [劳经] 加班时间；延长时间；加时赛
detailed_translations.english: time that you spend working in your job in addition to your normal working hours

name: endangered
trans: adj.濒临灭绝的；有生命危险的

sentences.english: I think there are many endangered animals in the world, such as tigers and pandas.
sentences.chinese: 我认为有许多濒临灭绝的动物，如老虎和大熊猫，在世界。

sentences.english: I think our government should punish those people severely who kill the rare animals. It is our duty to protect the endangered animals.
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府应该严厉惩罚那些捕杀稀有动物的人。保护濒临灭绝的动物是我们的责任。

sentences.english: However, it holds six language families, two of which have only one remaining language, and almost all of the languages here are endangered.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它拥有六个语族，其中两个语族仅剩下一种语言，而且这儿几乎所有的语言都濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 濒危的， 将要灭绝的

name: animation
trans: n.活泼，生气；激励；卡通片绘制

sentences.english: 3-D animations
sentences.chinese: 三维动画片

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼，生气；激励；卡通片绘制
detailed_translations.english: liveliness and excitement

name: banqueting
trans: 设宴

name: darkness
trans: n.黑暗；模糊；无知；阴郁

sentences.english: the long hours of darkness during winter
sentences.chinese: 冬季漫长的黑夜

sentences.english: We lit our campfire as darkness fell (= it became night ) .
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临，我们点起了篝火。

sentences.english: He stared out the window at the gathering darkness (= the night slowly coming ) .
sentences.chinese: 他凝视着窗外渐浓的夜色。

detailed_translations.english: when there is no light

name: nerve
trans: n.神经；勇气；叶脉vt.鼓起勇气

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: apprenticeship
trans: n.学徒期；学徒身分

sentences.english: He’s serving an apprenticeship as a printer.
sentences.chinese: 他现在是一名印刷工学徒。

sentences.english: a five-year apprenticeship
sentences.chinese: 五年学徒期

detailed_translations.english: the job of being an apprentice, or the period of time in which you are an apprentice

name: millennium
trans: n.千年期，千禧年；一千年，千年纪念；太平盛世，黄金时代

sentences.english: people who have inhabited this land for millennia
sentences.chinese: 在这片土地上已经居住了数千年的人们

detailed_translations.chinese: 千年期，千禧年；一千年，千年纪念；太平盛世，黄金时代
detailed_translations.english: a period of 1,000 years

name: observatory
trans: n.天文台；气象台；瞭望台

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

name: observable
trans: adj.显著的；觉察得到的；看得见的n.可观察量；感觉到的事物

name: encyclopedia
trans: n.百科全书（亦是encyclopaedia）

sentences.english: the Encyclopedia of Music
sentences.chinese: 音乐百科全书

detailed_translations.english: a book or cd, or a set of these, containing facts about many different subjects, or containing detailed facts about one subject

name: encyclopaedia
trans: n.百科全书

sentences.english: They were still driving away at the encyclopaedia.
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在孜孜不倦地编写那部百科全书。

sentences.english: I might do an eighth book for charity, a kind of encyclopaedia of the world so that I could use all the extra material that's not in the books ... we'll see!
sentences.chinese: 我可能出于慈善的目的写第八本书，大概是有关这个世界的百科全书，这样我可以使用书中没能出现的所有额外材料······敬请期待！

sentences.english: An encyclopaedia's-worth of knowledge feels trivialised when it can be generated with just a few strokes on the keyboard, just as the live chatter of the world becomes so much waste paper.
sentences.chinese: 当仅靠敲打几下键盘就能创作出那样的作品时，一种百科全书式的学问感瞬间变得微不足道，正如同那对这个世界鲜活的唠叨变成这里的一堆废纸那样。

name: selectively
trans: adv.有选择地

name: amplify
trans: vt.放大，扩大；增强；详述vi.详述

sentences.english: an amplified guitar
sentences.chinese: 带有扩音设备的电吉他

detailed_translations.chinese: 放大， 增强； 扩大； 详述， 进一步阐述
detailed_translations.english: to make sound louder, especially musical sound

name: unremarked
trans: adj.未被注意的未被注意的

trans: n.目的地，终点

sentences.chinese: 埃利斯岛已经成为美国最受欢迎的游览地之一。

detailed_translations.english: the place that someone or something is going to

name: acutely
trans: adv.尖锐地；剧烈地

sentences.chinese: 我们将继续进行测试，但越来越多地，随着长时间的交谈，我们敏锐地意识到，我们的作品将在公众当中引起许多道德问题。

trans: adj.强大的；可怕的；令人敬畏的；艰难的

sentences.chinese: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

trans: n.堕落；道德败坏；士气低落

trans: adj.轻率的；欠考虑的；考虑不周的；不顾及他人的

sentences.chinese: 自私而不顾他人的人

sentences.chinese: 麦吉尔克拥有爱尔兰和美国的双重国籍。

name: archive
trans: n.档案馆；档案文件vt.把…存档

sentences.chinese: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

detailed_translations.english: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

sentences.chinese: 我们由衷地钦佩他的认真和有自知之明的讽刺艺术。

sentences.chinese: 在经济增长方面一直存在急剧的减速。

sentences.chinese: 那个邮包上周送到了。

sentences.english: He sends regular food parcels to his family in Libya.
sentences.chinese: 他定期给在利比亚的家人邮寄食品包裹。

name: amiable

detailed_translations.chinese: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.chinese: 这些窗帘很好，但我更喜欢男性化一点的。

sentences.chinese: 各系统之间似乎没有统一性。

sentences.chinese: 切去边皮的三明治

sentences.chinese: 啤酒是一种最古老的饮料。

sentences.english: And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.

sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，您想为用户提供一种方法，让他们说出自己想要的饮料。

sentences.chinese: 新生儿有轻微的黄疸较为常见，通常会不治自愈。

sentences.chinese: 熟练的打字员

sentences.english: a pair of boots

detailed_translations.english: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg

sentences.english: a yellow rose with a lovely scent
sentences.chinese: 香气怡人的黄玫瑰

sentences.chinese: 她的创业劲头

name: dynamic

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

sentences.chinese: 需要特别注意的是偏差阈值参数和空间移位参数。

sentences.english: The formula on definite proportion exists not only in plane figure but also in three-dimensional figure.
sentences.chinese: 平面图形中有定比分点公式，在空间图形中也存在同样的定比分点公式。

sentences.english: If the dimensional shift in either direction is greater than our previously set threshold, increment the total deviation by the amount moved in both directions.
sentences.chinese: 如果在任意方向上的空间移位大于我们先前设定的阈值，就按照两个方向上移动的量增加总偏差。

name: perceptive
trans: adj.感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的

sentences.english: He was one of the most perceptive U.S. political commentators.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是美国最具洞察力的政治评论员之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious

name: canal
trans: n.运河；水道；管道；灌溉水渠vt.在…开凿运河

sentences.english: We walked along by the side of the canal.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着运河边往前走。

sentences.english: the Panama Canal
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河

detailed_translations.chinese: 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠
detailed_translations.english: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

name: bizarre
trans: adj.奇异的（指态度，容貌，款式等）

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: raid
trans: n.袭击；突袭；搜捕；抢劫vt.袭击，突袭vi.对…进行突然袭击

sentences.english: a bombing raid
sentences.chinese: 轰炸

sentences.english: an air raid warning siren
sentences.chinese: 空袭警报

detailed_translations.chinese: 袭击； 突入查抄， 突入搜捕； 劫掠
detailed_translations.english: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

name: milestone
trans: n.里程碑，划时代的事件

sentences.english: He said the launch of the party represented a milestone in Zambian history.
sentences.chinese: 他说该党的成立代表着赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

detailed_translations.english: a very important event in the development of something

name: undo
trans: vt.取消；解开；破坏；扰乱vi.撤消

sentences.english: The screws can be undone by hand.
sentences.chinese: 这些螺丝可以用手拧开。

sentences.english: I undid the package carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我小心地打开包裹。

sentences.english: He undid most of the good work of the previous manager.
sentences.chinese: 他把前任经理的大部分功绩都毁掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped

name: inexpressible
trans: adj.不可言传的；难以形容的；不能用语言表达的

name: industriousness
trans: n.勤勉，勤奋

name: arguably
trans: adv.可论证地；可争辩地；正如可提出证据加以证明的那样地可能，大概

name: sarcastic
trans: adj.挖苦的；尖刻的，辛辣的

sentences.english: Was she being sarcastic?
sentences.chinese: 她是在嘲讽吗？

detailed_translations.english: saying things that are the opposite of what you mean, in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

name: diabetes
trans: n.糖尿病；多尿症

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

name: fascism
trans: n.法西斯主义；极端国家主义

sentences.english: ...the rise of fascism in the 1930s.
sentences.chinese: …20世纪30年代法西斯主义的兴起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法西斯主义；极端国家主义
detailed_translations.english: a  right-wing  political system in which people’s lives are completely controlled by the state and no political opposition is allowed

name: hindrance
trans: n.障碍；妨碍；妨害；阻碍物

sentences.english: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
sentences.chinese: 在英国工业界，学位反倒是个累赘。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something

name: embed
trans: vt.栽种；使嵌入，使插入；使深留脑中

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: blacken
trans: vt.使变黑；诽谤，诋毁vi.变黑

sentences.english: The married women of Shitamachi maintained the custom of blackening their teeth.
sentences.chinese: 下町的已婚妇女保留了染黑牙齿的习俗。

detailed_translations.english: To blacken something means to make it black or very dark in colour. Something that blackens becomes black or very dark in colour.

name: carefree
trans: adj.无忧无虑的；不负责的

sentences.english: He thought back to the carefree days of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他回想起自己无忧无虑的童年时代。

sentences.english: a carefree attitude
sentences.chinese: 无所谓的态度

detailed_translations.english: having no worries or problems

name: commercially
trans: adv.商业上；通商上

name: noncommercial
trans: adj.非经营的

sentences.english: noncommercial organizations

detailed_translations.english: not of, connected with, or involved in commerce

name: hawk
trans: n.鹰；鹰派成员；掠夺他人的人vi.清嗓；咳嗽；像鹰一般地袭击vt.兜售，沿街叫卖；捕捉；咳出

sentences.english: Oil thieves sometimes hawk stolen gasoline on the side of highways.
sentences.chinese: 石油大盗们有时在公路边上兜售偷来的石油。

detailed_translations.english: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals
to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them

name: unfairly
trans: adv.不公平地；不正当地

sentences.english: And that's going to require some very hard choices. And we're going to have to do that in a way that does not add unfairly to the burdens that the average American already faces.
sentences.chinese: 他还称,"这就需要作出一些十分困难的选择.我们达到此目的所采取的方式,将不会向普通美国人已面临的负担中,增加不公平的累赘."

name: unfairness
trans: n.不公平，不公正；不正当

name: enrage
trans: vt.激怒；使暴怒

sentences.english: Many readers were enraged by his article.
sentences.chinese: 许多读者被他的文章激怒了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very angry

name: campaigner
trans: n.竞选者；从军者；出征者；老兵

name: geneticist
trans: n.遗传学者

name: despair
trans: n.绝望；令人绝望的人或事vi.绝望，丧失信心

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: liberalism
trans: n.自由主义；开明的思想或见解

sentences.english: ...a democrat who has decided that economic liberalism is the best way to secure change.
sentences.chinese: ...一位认定经济改良主义是保证变革的最好办法的民主党人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自由主义；开明的思想或见解
detailed_translations.english: liberal opinions an principles, especially on social and political subjects

name: liberalise
trans: vt.使自由化

name: liberalize
trans: vt.使自由化；宽大vi.自由化

sentences.english: ...authoritarian states that have only now begun to liberalize.
sentences.chinese: …现在刚刚开始放宽限制的独裁国家。

detailed_translations.english: to make a system, laws, or moral attitudes less strict

name: populate
trans: vt.居住于；构成人口；移民于；殖民于

sentences.english: The highlands are populated mainly by peasant farmers.
sentences.chinese: 高原人口主要是农民。

detailed_translations.english: if an area is populated by a particular group of people, they live there

name: insider
trans: n.内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者

sentences.english: an insider’s view of the way that a Japanese company works
sentences.chinese: 业内人士对日本公司运作方式的看法

detailed_translations.chinese: 内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special knowledge of a particular organization because they are part of it

name: tremble
trans: n.颤抖；战栗；摇晃vi.发抖；战栗；焦虑；摇晃vt.使挥动；用颤抖的声音说出

sentences.english: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴唇开始颤抖，接着就哭了起来。

sentences.english: I will never forget the look on the patient's face, the tremble in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我将永远不会忘记那病人脸上的表情和他颤抖的手。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Tremble is also a noun

name: conceivably
trans: adv.令人信服地；可相信地；想得到地

name: reschedule
trans: vt.重新排定日程；重订时间表；重新计划

sentences.english: Since I'll be away, I'd like to reschedule the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 既然我将要离开，我想重新安排一下这次会议的时间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新计划， 重订…的时间表
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something to happen at a different time from the one that was previously planned

name: infect
trans: vt.感染，传染

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: repertoire
trans: n.全部节目；计算机指令系统；（美）某人或机器的全部技能

sentences.english: the behavioural repertoire of infants
sentences.chinese: 婴幼儿的行为能力

detailed_translations.english: all the plays, pieces of music etc that a performer or group knows and can perform

name: Buddhist
trans: n.佛教徒adj.佛教的

sentences.english: In this case, I genuinely believe in the Buddhist way of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，我真诚地相信佛教徒的思维方式。

sentences.english: On the extreme northwestern outskirts of the city stands the Buddhist temple.
sentences.chinese: 那所佛教寺院位于市郊的最西北角。

sentences.english: These were all qualities he recognized in himself, but which all could be improved upon, and so he became a Buddhist.
sentences.chinese: 这些特质他都可以在自己的身上找到，但也都还有着可提高的空间，于是他成了一名佛教徒。

sentences.english: ...Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: …和尚。

detailed_translations.english: A Buddhist is a person whose religion is Buddhism
Buddhist means relating or referring to Buddhism

name: toothless
trans: adj.无牙齿的adj.无权势的

name: reasonableness
trans: n.合理；妥当

name: skim
trans: n.撇；撇去的东西；表层物；瞒报所得的收入adj.脱脂的；撇去浮沫的；表层的vt.略读；撇去…的浮物；从…表面飞掠而过；去除；（为逃税而）隐瞒（部分收入）vi.浏览；掠过

sentences.english: seagulls skimming the waves
sentences.chinese: 掠过浪尖的海鸥

sentences.english: Julie skimmed the sports page.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉浏览了体育版。

detailed_translations.english: to move along quickly over a surface, never touching it or not touching it often

name: correction
trans: n.改正，修正

sentences.english: I just need to make a few corrections , and then we can send it to the printer.
sentences.chinese: 我只要修改几个地方，然后就可以把它发送到打印机。

detailed_translations.english: a change made in something in order to make it right or better

name: solidarity
trans: n.团结，团结一致

sentences.english: a gesture of solidarity
sentences.chinese: 团结的表示

sentences.english: an appeal for worker solidarity
sentences.chinese: 呼吁工人们团结

detailed_translations.english: loyalty and general agreement between all the people in a group, or between different groups, because they all have a shared aim

name: agitate
trans: vt.摇动；骚动；使…激动vi.煽动

sentences.english: All you need to do is gently agitate the water with a finger or paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 你只需要用手指或刷子轻轻搅动水。

detailed_translations.english: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

name: organism
trans: n.有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: organic
trans: adj.有机的；组织的；器官的；根本的

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

name: organizational
trans: adj.组织的；编制的

sentences.english: Evelyn's excellent organizational skills were soon spotted by her employers.
sentences.chinese: 伊夫琳出色的组织才干很快就被她的雇主发现了。

detailed_translations.english: Organizational abilities and methods relate to the way that work, activities, or events are planned and arranged

name: disorganized
trans: adj.紊乱的；无组织的

name: thinness
trans: n.薄；瘦；细

name: prestigious
trans: adj.有名望的；享有声望的

sentences.english: a prestigious literary award
sentences.chinese: 享有盛名的文学奖

sentences.english: a highly prestigious university
sentences.chinese: 赫赫有名的大学

detailed_translations.english: admired as one of the best and most important

name: unavoidable
trans: adj.不可避免的；不能废除的

sentences.english: There are now fears that war is unavoidable.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在担心战争不可避免。

detailed_translations.english: impossible to prevent

name: unaware
trans: adj.不知道的，无意的；未察觉到的adv.意外地；不知不觉地

sentences.english: Many people are unaware of just how much food and drink they consume.
sentences.chinese: 许多人不知道自己到底消耗掉多少食物和饮料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不知道的，无意的；未察觉到的
detailed_translations.english: not noticing or realizing what is happening

name: overprotective
trans: adj.过分保护的；过分溺爱的

name: negligence
trans: n.疏忽；忽视；粗心大意

sentences.english: negligence in carrying out safety procedures
sentences.chinese: 执行安全程序时的疏忽

sentences.english: The bridge’s architect was sued for criminal negligence.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥梁的建筑师被控犯有玩忽职守罪。

detailed_translations.english: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for

name: articulate
trans: adj.发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的vt.清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯vi.发音；清楚地讲话；用关节连接起来n.有节体的动物

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

name: inarticulate
trans: adj.口齿不清的；说不出话的；无关节的

sentences.english: He left me inarticulate with rage.
sentences.chinese: 他把我气得说不出话来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口齿不清的；说不出话的；[无脊椎] 无关节的

name: bewildering
trans: adj.使人困惑的；令人产生混乱的v.使迷惑（bewilder的ing形式）

sentences.english: A glance along his bookshelves reveals a bewildering array of interests.
sentences.chinese: 扫一眼他的书架就可以看出他杂七杂八的兴趣爱好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人困惑的； 令人费解的
detailed_translations.english: confusing, especially because there are too many choices or things happening at the same time

name: pray
trans: vi.祈祷；请；恳求vt.祈祷；恳求；央求

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

name: prayer
trans: n.祈祷，祷告；恳求；祈祷文

sentences.english: Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time.
sentences.chinese: 在这艰难时期我们时刻思念你，为你祈祷。

sentences.english: The children said their prayers and got into bed.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们做完祷告后上床睡觉了。

sentences.english: God has answered your prayer .
sentences.chinese: 上帝应许了你的祷告。

sentences.english: the power of prayer
sentences.chinese: 祈祷的力量

detailed_translations.english: words that you say when praying to God or gods

name: unaffordable
trans: adj.买不起的

sentences.english: You have to become awfully large to be unaffordable -- there's lots of cash, lots of capital out there for acquisitions.
sentences.chinese: 制药业者坐拥很多现金,进行收购的资本雄厚,你必须变成让人买不起的超大公司.

name: solvable
trans: adj.可以解决的；可以解的；可溶的

name: shrug
trans: n.耸肩vi.耸肩vt.耸肩，耸肩表示

sentences.english: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.
sentences.chinese: 我只是耸耸肩，没有理睬他。

sentences.english: ‘Suit yourself,’ he said with a shrug.
sentences.chinese: “随你的便。”他耸耸肩说道。

detailed_translations.english: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something
a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

name: vacuum
trans: n.真空；空间；真空吸尘器adj.真空的；利用真空的；产生真空的vt.用真空吸尘器清扫

sentences.english: I vacuumed the carpets today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天用吸尘器清洁地毯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集； 用真空吸尘器打扫
detailed_translations.english: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away

name: swamp
trans: vt.使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境n.沼泽；湿地vi.下沉；陷入沼泽；陷入困境；不知所措（过去式swamped，过去分词swamped，现在分词swamping，第三人称单数swamps，名词swampiness，形容词swampy）

sentences.english: I spent one whole night by a swamp behind the road listening to frogs.
sentences.chinese: 我整个晚上都在这条路后面的一个沼泽地旁听蛙鸣。

sentences.english: Their electronic navigation failed and a rogue wave swamped the boat.
sentences.chinese: 他们的电子导航装置失灵了，一个巨浪吞没了那只船。

detailed_translations.english: land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water

detailed_translations.chinese: 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境
detailed_translations.english: If something swamps a place or object, it fills it with water

name: consumerism
trans: n.保护消费者利益运动；用户至上主义

name: feat
trans: n.功绩，壮举；技艺表演adj.合适的；灵巧的

sentences.english: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.
sentences.chinese: 赛车是工程学的一项非凡业绩。

detailed_translations.english: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

name: relay
trans: n.继电器；接替，接替人员；驿马vt.转播；使接替；分程传递vi.转播；接替

sentences.english: He quickly relayed this news to the other members of staff.
sentences.chinese: 他马上就把这个消息转告给了其他员工。

sentences.english: The game was relayed by satellite to audiences all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛通过卫星向全世界的观众进行了转播。

detailed_translations.english: to pass a message from one person or place to another

name: shove
trans: n.推；挤vt.挤；强使；撞；猛推

sentences.english: He shoved her towards the car.
sentences.chinese: 他推着她走向汽车。

sentences.english: Everyone was pushing and shoving to see the prince.
sentences.chinese: 大家都推着挤着要看王子。

detailed_translations.english: to push someone or something in a rough or careless way, using your hands or shoulders
to put something somewhere carelessly or without thinking much
a strong push

name: blaze
trans: n.火焰，烈火；光辉；情感爆发vt.在树皮上刻路标；公开宣布vi.燃烧；照耀，发光；激发

sentences.english: Some 4,000 firefighters are battling the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 约有四千名消防人员正在与大火搏斗。

sentences.english: the blaze of light from the security lamps
sentences.chinese: 安全灯的强光

sentences.english: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 房间里暖融融的，壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.english: a big dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
to burn very brightly and strongly

name: scattered
trans: adj.分散的；散乱的

sentences.english: There will be some scattered showers (= short periods of rain ) in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午将有零星阵雨。

sentences.english: a widely scattered set of islands
sentences.chinese: 分散得很广的一片群岛

detailed_translations.english: spread over a wide area or over a long period of time

name: softener
trans: n.软化剂；硬水软化器

name: sake
trans: n.目的；利益；理由；日本米酒

sentences.english: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: I only went for Kay’s sake.
sentences.chinese: 我是为了凯才去的。

sentences.english: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake (= because it will be good for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 为了他自己好，我希望他已经说出了真相。

detailed_translations.english: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

name: systemic
trans: adj.系统的；全身的；体系的

name: systematicness
trans: 系统性;规则性

name: discriminate
trans: vi.区别；辨别vt.歧视；区别；辨别

sentences.english: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.english: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.chinese: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

detailed_translations.english: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: doubter
trans: n.抱怀疑态度的人；不信宗教的人；怀疑论者

name: undoubted
trans: adj.无疑的；确实的

sentences.english: her undoubted talent
sentences.chinese: 她那毋庸置疑的天赋

sentences.english: The film was an undoubted success.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，那部电影很成功。

detailed_translations.english: definitely true or known to exist

name: efficiently
trans: adv.有效地；效率高地（efficient的副词形式）

sentences.english: This oil lubricates efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 这油能有效地起润滑作用。

sentences.english: That means I have to work more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 那就意味着我要工作的更有效率。

sentences.english: Others like to use them because they prefer to communicate efficiently and not miss out on any important conversations and connections.
sentences.chinese: 另一些人喜欢他们则是因为他们偏好于更有效的通信，不会错过一些重要的交谈和联系。

name: naturalist
trans: n.自然主义者；博物学者；（英）动物标本剥制者；买卖玩赏动物的商人adj.自然的（等于naturalistic）；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.english: I am sometimes described as a naturalist.
sentences.chinese: 有时我也被称作自然主义者。

sentences.english: An American naturalist wrote:"a patriot must always be ready to defend his country against its government".
sentences.chinese: 一位美国自然主义者写道：“爱国者要随时准备好为了保卫国家而与政府斗争！”

sentences.english: To illustrate this, let me refer to the naturalist science of the 19th century, and the effects it had on our opinions of life.
sentences.chinese: 为了诠释这点，我要引用下19世纪的自然主义科学及其它对我们的生活观念所产生的影响。

name: naturalization
trans: n.归化，移入；移植

name: naturalistic
trans: adj.自然的；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.english: These drawings are among his most naturalistic.
sentences.chinese: 这是他最具写实主义色彩作品中的几幅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自然的；自然主义的；博物学的
detailed_translations.english: painted, written etc according to the ideas of naturalism

name: inspiration
trans: n.灵感；鼓舞；吸气；妙计

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: remake
trans: vt.再制n.重做；重制物

name: cement
trans: n.水泥；接合剂vt.巩固，加强；用水泥涂；接合vi.粘牢

sentences.english: a bag of cement
sentences.chinese: 一袋水泥

sentences.english: Most artificial joints are cemented into place.
sentences.chinese: 绝大部分人造关节是被黏结复位的。

detailed_translations.english: a grey powder made from  lime  and clay that becomes hard when it is mixed with water and allowed to dry, and that is used in building
to join two things together using cement , glue, etc.

name: scarcely
trans: adv.几乎不，简直不；简直没有

sentences.english: The city had scarcely changed in 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市20年中几乎没有什么改变。

sentences.english: The country had scarcely any industry.
sentences.chinese: 该国几乎没有工业。

sentences.english: He scarcely ever left the region.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎没有离开过这个地区。

sentences.english: He had scarcely sat down when there was a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 他刚坐下就有人敲门。

detailed_translations.english: almost not or almost none at all

name: trainee
trans: n.练习生，实习生；受训者；新兵；训练中的动物

sentences.english: The trainees start next week.
sentences.chinese: 实习生下周开始上班。

detailed_translations.chinese: 练习生，实习生；受训者；新兵；训练中的动物
detailed_translations.english: someone who is being trained for a job

name: concede
trans: vi.让步vt.承认；退让；给予，容许

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: concession
trans: n.让步；特许（权）；承认；退位

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: assurance
trans: n.保证，担保；（人寿）保险；确信；断言；厚脸皮，无耻

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: inexperienced
trans: adj.无经验的；不熟练的

sentences.english: inexperienced pilots
sentences.chinese: 经验不足的飞行员

detailed_translations.english: not having had much experience

name: habitual
trans: adj.习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的

sentences.english: James took his habitual morning walk around the garden.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯又像往常习惯的那样绕花园作晨间散步去了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 习惯的；惯常的；习以为常的
detailed_translations.english: doing something from habit, and unable to stop doing it

name: gathering
trans: n.聚集；集会；收款v.聚集（gather的ing形式）

sentences.english: a select gathering of 20 or 30 people
sentences.chinese: 二三十名特邀人士的聚会

detailed_translations.english: a meeting of a group of people

name: slump
trans: vt.使降低；使衰落；使倒下n.衰退；暴跌；消沉vi.下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

name: blunt
trans: adj.钝的，不锋利的；生硬的；直率的vt.使迟钝

sentences.english: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。

sentences.english: a blunt pencil
sentences.chinese: 钝铅笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 钝的；率直的，直言不讳的
detailed_translations.english: not sharp or pointed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使迟钝； 使减弱； 使钝
detailed_translations.english: to make a feeling less strong

name: structural
trans: adj.结构的；建筑的

sentences.english: structural changes in the computer industry
sentences.chinese: 电脑行业的结构性改变

sentences.english: The earthquake caused minor structural damage.
sentences.chinese: 这次地震造成了轻微的结构破坏。

detailed_translations.english: connected with the structure of something

name: resent
trans: vt.怨恨；愤恨；厌恶

sentences.english: Paul resented the fact that Carol didn’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 保罗非常气愤，因为卡萝尔不信任他。

detailed_translations.english: to feel angry or upset about a situation or about something that someone has done, especially because you think that it is not fair

name: stroke
trans: n.（游泳或划船的）划；中风；（打、击等的）一下；冲程；（成功的）举动；尝试；轻抚vt.（用笔等）画；轻抚；轻挪；敲击；划尾桨；划掉；（打字时）击打键盘vi.击球；作尾桨手，指挥划桨；（打字时）击打键盘

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

name: blueprint
trans: n.蓝图，设计图；计划vt.计划；制成蓝图

sentences.english: By changing the tomato’s genetic blueprint , scientists can alter the rate at which it ripens.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以通过改变番茄的基因蓝图来改变它的成熟速度。

detailed_translations.english: a plan for achieving something

name: deductible
trans: adj.可扣除的；可减免的

sentences.english: Part of the auto-loan interest is deductible as a business expense.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项业务支出，汽车消费的部分贷款利息是可以扣除的。

sentences.english: ...deductible expenses.
sentences.chinese: ... 可扣除费用。

sentences.english: Each time they go to a hospital, they have to pay a deductible of $628.
sentences.chinese: 每次他们去医院，他们必须缴纳免赔费用628美元。

detailed_translations.english: If a payment or expense is deductible, it can be deducted from another sum such as your income, for example, when calculating how much income tax you have to pay

detailed_translations.chinese: 免赔率； 免赔额； 扣除额
detailed_translations.english: A deductible is a sum of money which an insured person has to pay toward the cost of an insurance claim. The insurance company pays the rest.

name: inventive
trans: adj.发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的

sentences.english: It inspired me to be more inventive with my own cooking.
sentences.chinese: 它激励我在自己烹饪时更具创造力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明的；有发明才能的；独出心裁的
detailed_translations.english: An inventive person is good at inventing things or has clever and original ideas

name: illogical
trans: adj.不合逻辑的；不合常理的

sentences.english: illogical and unreasonable fear
sentences.chinese: 毫无道理的惧怕

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合逻辑的；不合常理的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or reasonable

name: implausible
trans: adj.难以置信的，不像真实的

sentences.english: It’s not entirely implausible that a galaxy could be identical to our own.
sentences.chinese: 某个星系和我们这个星系完全相同并非完全不可能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难以置信的，不像真实的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to believe and therefore unlikely to be true

name: veg
trans: n.蔬菜vi.虚度

name: agony
trans: n.苦恼；极大的痛苦；临死的挣扎

sentences.english: the agony of arthritis
sentences.chinese: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛

detailed_translations.english: very severe pain

name: endlessly
trans: adv.不断地；无穷尽地

name: synthetic
trans: n.合成物adj.综合的；合成的，人造的

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced

name: ally
trans: n.同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手vt.使联盟；使联合vi.联合；结盟

sentences.english: a meeting of the European allies
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟国会议

sentences.english: He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.
sentences.chinese: 他将别无选择，只能与这个新运动结盟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手
detailed_translations.english: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them

name: symphony
trans: n.交响乐；谐声，和声

sentences.english: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

name: conspiracy
trans: n.阴谋；共谋；阴谋集团

sentences.english: There were many conspiracy theories (= beliefs that something is the result of a conspiracy ) surrounding Princess Diana’s death.
sentences.chinese: 围绕戴安娜王妃之死有许多阴谋论。

detailed_translations.english: a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal

name: feudalism
trans: n.封建主义；封建制度

sentences.english: As feudalism decayed in the West it gave rise to a mercantile class.
sentences.chinese: 随着西方封建制度解体，商业阶层应运而生。

detailed_translations.english: a system which existed in the Middle Ages, in which people received land and protection from a lord when they worked and fought for him

name: fleeting
trans: adj.飞逝的；转瞬间的v.迅速移动（fleet的ing形式）

sentences.english: Time is fleeting.; Time flies.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝。

sentences.english: I watched, smiling, knowing how fleeting these moments when they are small are.
sentences.chinese: 我微笑的看着这一切，我知道这个时刻是多么的短暂。

sentences.english: Most touches were only about five seconds, but in these fleeting moments, we’re capable of communicating distinct emotions, just as we are with the face.
sentences.chinese: 大部分触摸只有五秒左右，然而就是在这么短暂的时间里，我们有能力传达明确的情绪，正像我们通过表情所做的那样。

name: recreate
trans: vt.再创造；使得到娱乐消遣vi.娱乐；消遣

sentences.english: You can never recreate the feeling of winning for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 你永远无法再次体会第一次获胜时的心情。

name: recreation
trans: n.娱乐；消遣；休养

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities
sentences.chinese: 提供娱乐设施

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

name: albeit
trans: conj.虽然；即使

sentences.english: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些犹豫，他还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 尽管勉强，克里斯还是同她一起去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

name: supplier
trans: n.供应厂商，供应国；供应者

sentences.english: ...one of the country's biggest food suppliers.
sentences.chinese: …该国最大的食品供应商之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 供应厂商，供应国；供应者
detailed_translations.english: a company or person that provides a particular product

name: oxide
trans: n.氧化物

sentences.english: iron oxide
sentences.chinese: 氧化铁

detailed_translations.english: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

name: vulnerability
trans: n.易损性；弱点

sentences.english: Now that we know the basis of an attack, what can we do to protect ourselves from this vulnerability?
sentences.chinese: 既然我们知道了攻击的基本知识，那么做些什么才能保护我们自己避免这一脆弱性呢？

sentences.english: But you also notice the sense of limitation and the vulnerability associated with the physical state of virginity here.
sentences.chinese: 但是你们也要注意到限制和弱点的意义所在,那是与身体的贞节状态相联系的。

sentences.english: This points to another vulnerability.
sentences.chinese: 这指的是另一弱点。

name: unnamed
trans: adj.无名的；未命名的；未提及的

name: stern
trans: n.船尾；末端adj.严厉的；坚定的

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: demonstration
trans: n.示范；证明；示威游行

sentences.english: Supporters staged a demonstration outside the US embassy.
sentences.chinese: 支持者在美国大使馆外举行了示威游行。

sentences.english: Police opened fire on a peaceful demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察朝和平示威的人群开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: an event at which a large group of people meet to protest or to support something in public

name: rivalry
trans: n.竞争；对抗；竞赛

sentences.english: The two players have developed a friendly rivalry .
sentences.chinese: 这两名选手之间已形成一种友好的竞争关系。

sentences.english: She had never overcome her feelings of sibling rivalry (= rivalry between brothers and sisters ) .
sentences.chinese: 她一直没有克服和兄弟姐妹较劲的那种心理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竞争， 竞赛； 对抗
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two or more people, teams, or companies are competing for something, especially over a long period of time, and the feeling of competition between them

name: promoter
trans: n.促进者；发起人；催化剂；促进剂；启动子

sentences.english: a boxing promoter
sentences.chinese: 拳击比赛承办人

name: staircase
trans: n.楼梯

sentences.english: They walked down the staircase together.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起沿楼梯通道往下走。

detailed_translations.english: a set of stairs inside a building with its supports and the side parts that you hold on to

name: alteration
trans: n.修改，改变；变更

sentences.english: Making some simple alterations to your diet will make you feel fitter.
sentences.chinese: 对你的饮食做一些简单的改变会使你感觉更健康。

sentences.english: My newlywed wife and I are deeply in love.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的新婚妻子彼此深爱着对方。

sentences.english: Lavalais raised his glass to propose a toast to the newlyweds.
sentences.chinese: 拉瓦莱斯举起了他的酒杯，向这对新婚夫妇敬酒。

sentences.chinese: 争取种族平等的运动

sentences.english: the lively New Year celebrations in the city centre
sentences.chinese: 市中心热闹的新年庆祝活动

detailed_translations.english: an occasion or party when you celebrate something

name: constitutionality
trans: n.符合宪法；立宪

name: assimilate
trans: vt.吸收；使同化；把…比作；使相似vi.吸收；同化

sentences.english: It will take time to assimilate all these facts.
sentences.chinese: 充分掌握所有这些情况需要时间。

detailed_translations.english: to completely understand and begin to use new ideas, information etc
if people assimilate, or are assimilated into a country or group, they become part of that group and are accepted by the people in that group

name: assimilative
trans: adj.同化的；同化力的

name: rifle
trans: n.步枪；来复枪vt.用步枪射击；抢夺；偷走

sentences.english: They shot him at point blank range with an automatic rifle.
sentences.chinese: 他们用一支自动步枪在近距离射程内射中了他。

detailed_translations.english: a long gun which you hold up to your shoulder to shoot

name: saturate
trans: adj.浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的vt.浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满
detailed_translations.english: to make something very wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: indefinite
trans: adj.不确定的；无限的；模糊的

sentences.english: The next day the union voted to begin an indefinite strike.
sentences.chinese: 第二天工会投票表决决定开始无限期罢工。

sentences.english: The picture has been loaned for an indefinite period to the National Gallery.
sentences.chinese: 那幅画长期出借给国家美术馆。

detailed_translations.english: an indefinite action or period of time has no definite end arranged for it

name: quotation
trans: n.报价单；引用语；引证

sentences.english: The following quotation is taken from a nineteenth century travel diary.
sentences.chinese: 下文引自19世纪的一篇旅行日记。

sentences.english: a dictionary of quotations
sentences.chinese: 引语词典，语录汇编

sentences.english: a quotation for car insurance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险的报价单

detailed_translations.english: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

name: publicise
trans: vt.宣传，宣扬；公布，颂

name: publicize
trans: vt.宣传；公布

sentences.english: television’s failure to publicize the unemployment issue
sentences.chinese: 电视未能报道失业问题

detailed_translations.english: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it

name: dazzlingly
trans: adv.耀眼地；灿烂地

sentences.english: How to smile dazzlingly – it will light up your life.
sentences.chinese: 怎样灿烂地笑——它会 点亮你的人生 。

name: adverse
trans: adj.不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: nonagricultural
trans: adj.非农业的

sentences.english: Many causes have been proposed for both the intelligence gap and the Flynn effect, including education, income, and even nonagricultural labor.
sentences.chinese: 人们对智力差距和弗林效应提出了许多成因，包括教育、收入，甚至还包括非农业劳动。

sentences.english: There has been "good" progress in persuading locals, mostly people engaged in nonagricultural activities, to give up land, she says.
sentences.chinese: 她指出，针对当地居民的说服工作已经取得喜人的进展，大部分未从事农业活动的居民表示愿意放弃土地。

detailed_translations.english: not of or relating to agriculture

name: shortfall
trans: n.差额；缺少

sentences.english: The government has refused to make up a $30,000 shortfall in funding.
sentences.chinese: 政府已经拒绝补足3万美元的资金短缺。

detailed_translations.english: the difference between the amount you have and the amount you need or expect

name: suite
trans: n.（一套）家具；套房；组曲；（一批）随员，随从

sentences.english: a honeymoon suite
sentences.chinese: 蜜月套房

sentences.english: a suite of rooms for palace guests
sentences.chinese: 王室贵宾套房

detailed_translations.chinese: 套间； 一套家具； 套， 组， 系列
detailed_translations.english: a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel

name: precision
trans: n.精度，精密度；精确adj.精密的，精确的

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: serially
trans: adv.连续地；连载地

name: forefront
trans: n.最前线，最前部；活动的中心

sentences.english: They have been at the forefront of the campaign for political change.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直处于政治变革运动的前沿。

detailed_translations.english: If you are at the forefront of a campaign or other activity, you have a leading and influential position in it

name: combative
trans: adj.好战的；好事的

sentences.english: Congress is in a combative mood.
sentences.chinese: 国会斗志昂扬。

detailed_translations.english: ready and willing to fight or argue

name: crude
trans: n.原油；天然的物质adj.粗糙的；天然的，未加工的；粗鲁的

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge
sentences.chinese: 粗糙的木桥

sentences.english: crude oil/metal
sentences.chinese: 原油；未经提炼的金属

detailed_translations.english: not developed to a high standard, or made with little skill

name: interface
trans: n.界面；<计>接口；交界面v.（使通过界面或接口）接合，连接；使联系vi.相互作用（或影响）；交流，交谈

sentences.english: ...the development of better user interfaces.
sentences.chinese: …更好用户界面的开发。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program

detailed_translations.chinese: （使通过界面或接口）接合，连接；[计算机]使联系
detailed_translations.english: if you interface two parts of a computer system, or if they interface, you connect them

name: resolute
trans: 不管；不顾；不理会不;adj.坚决的；果断的

sentences.english: resolute opposition
sentences.chinese: 坚决的反对

sentences.english: resolute leadership
sentences.chinese: 果断的领导

sentences.english: She remained resolute in her belief that the situation would improve.
sentences.chinese: 她依然坚信情况将会好转。

detailed_translations.english: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

name: monotonous
trans: adj.单调的，无抑扬顿挫的；无变化的,不管；不顾；不理会

sentences.english: a monotonous diet
sentences.chinese: 单调的饮食

sentences.english: a little boy who wet his bed with monotonous regularity
sentences.chinese: 一个老是尿床的小男孩

detailed_translations.english: boring because of always being the same

name: enclosure
trans: n.附件；围墙；围场

sentences.english: the bear enclosure at the zoo
sentences.chinese: 动物园中的熊园

sentences.english: the enclosure of arable land for pasture
sentences.chinese: 将耕地圈起来用作牧场

detailed_translations.english: an area surrounded by a wall or fence, and used for a particular purpose

name: cheerfully
trans: adv.高高兴兴地

name: cheerfulness
trans: n.高兴；快活

name: fuse
trans: n.保险丝，熔线；导火线，雷管vt.使融合；使熔化，使熔融vi.融合；熔化，熔融

sentences.english: two 13 amp fuses
sentences.chinese: 两根13安培的保险丝

sentences.english: I taught him how to change a fuse .
sentences.chinese: 我教他怎么换保险丝。

sentences.english: A bomb was deactivated at the last moment, after the fuse had been lit.
sentences.chinese: 一枚炸弹在导火线已被点燃后的最后一刻被解除。

sentences.english: The skull bones fuse between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five.
sentences.chinese: 颅骨在15和25岁之间长合。

detailed_translations.english: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合; 融合; 熔合
detailed_translations.english: if electrical equipment fuses, or if you fuse it, it stops working because a fuse has melted
